Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful resort”
Reviews.Author: Keith P
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Petit Lafitte from March 14-21 in Bungalow #7. This is our fifth year of coming to Playa del Carmen/Cozumel for a week in the springtime. Previously, we had stayed at some of the big all inclusives, and wanted a smaller, more intimate experience this year. Before choosing Petit Laffitte, we did a lot of research on Trip Advisor. Overall, the reviews on Petit Lafitte accurately reflect our experience of the resort. It is beautiful, and we loved the smaller, more intimate nature of the property. The service was very good, although some of the meal service was a bit "leisurely" at times. We found the bungalow very nice, not as luxurious as the large hotels but very charming and comfortable. The air conditioner worked fine, even though they did maintenance on the system one day. The beach is amazing, with plenty of chairs and papalas available no matter what time we made it to the beach. We did have two areas of criticism. While the food was acceptable, some nights it was very good, other nights only passable. Our first night, they had fresh grouper that was excellent. Other nights, the main courses were a bit under-seasoned and bland, as were a number of the soups. We never went hungry, but some nights were better than others. Our biggest issue was with the hot water. The first day when we tried to take a shower in the late afternoon after a day on the beach, the hot water was the same temperature as the cold. Also, the pressure was so weak sometimes it barely cleared the shower head. The next day, we went into Playa for the day, and we told the front desk about the hot water issue. They said that three of the bungalows shared the same hot water heater, so sometimes you had to let the water run for a while for it to heat up (although since I took an entire shower with both faucets on full, I would think that would have been long enough to heat up). When we returned that afternoon, two of the maintenance guys accompanied us back to our room and the water was piping hot and had decent pressure, almost immediately - obviously, they had done something on the issue while we were in town. However, the next day, we tried again to take a shower in the late afternoon, and it was back to very cold and low pressure. We waited until after dinner and tried again, and the water had heated up, but it was not as hot as the previous day. It was hit or miss like this the rest of our stay, and some days the hot water was not so hot and very brief. I understand the quaintness of staying in a bungalow, but the lack of hot water took us from quaintness to something a bit more like camping. Would we go back to Petit Lafitte? If we could be guaranteed of adequate hot water, I would go back in a second. Maybe I'm just acting like a spoiled American.

Reviews.Title: “So Much Beauty”
Reviews.Author: sandygalWi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Petit Lafitte the first week of March. Before coming I had read everything I could get my hands on. Since the vast majority of the reviews were so positive I had very high expectations! Thankfully, they were generally met, we had a wonderfully relaxing time and would return without question. The only thing that we were not overwhelmed with was the main course at dinner as they tended toward the bland side. However when considering that they are trying to accomadate people from many different cultures, that may explain the need for having dishes that will suit different flavour palates. The self serve soup and salad/vegetable spread, though, more than made up for it. One night, the soup was a delicious cauliflower soup, the salad was fresh crispy romaine, a selection of cheeses, DELICIOUS grilled zuchini and red onion with a cumin flavour, and roasted beets, just to mention some of what was offered! Between that and the fresh bread, I was basically full for the main course so it really wasn't a problem on the nights that I may have been underwhelmed by the main dish. The reason I go into detail on this subject is because there have been many rave reviews about the food, and while some meals lived up to the raving, some did not. We never went hungry, the breakfasts were great, and the lunches were delicious, so my comments are to give a heads up to those whose expectations are as high as mine were. There was a decent selection of wine, a bottle of chilean merlot/cabernet for 190 pesos, very reasonable. The margaritas, pina coladas and mojitos (best ever) were all fabulous! And, as mentioned so often, the staff went out of their way to take care of any need or want. Truly genuinely friendly, hospitable people. Vacation for us is good food and a quiet lovely beach. The beach met our high expectations!! So beautiful, so relaxing, could not ask for more. We had bungalow #1, oceanfront! What a treat, it was hard to absorb how beautiful the view was from the front porch. When we walked down the beach in both directions, and saw the huge resorts, with their crowded lounger area, we were so grateful we were headed back to our Lafitte Retreat! It may not be as luxurious as some of them were, but we would not trade our quiet comfortable spot any day for more luxury. And that is why Petit Lafitte ultimately does live up to the hype! Let first say that there were buffets twice and the food was delicious both of those nights.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for...”
Reviews.Author: lueallen
Reviews.Content: A perfect ocean front bungalow looking out through palms to a pristine beach. Sounds of waves and birds. Lively, friendly bar where we met fun people. Attentive, tactful service. Good food too. This is one of the last small resorts left in this area. If a fancy pedicure is your vacation goal, go down the line to La Princess or another of those huge all-inclusives. We'll be back to La Petite next year.

Reviews.Title: “It Grows on You”
Reviews.Author: poindextermn
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 8:00 p.m., just in time for dinner, which was only so-so. When I asked for decaf coffee, and was given a cup of tepid water and a huge bottle of instant Sanka, I wondered what we'd gotten ourselves into. But by the end of Day 2, I was a believer. Even with overcast, rainy days, I don't think I've ever had a more relaxing vacation. You have to get into the rhythm of the place (which is very slow), to properly appreciate it. A leisurely cup of coffee, then a choice of whether to go to a beach chaise, a hammock, or one of the front porch stairs (we stayed in a bungalow, which I highly recommend). Then a walk on the powdery sand and maybe a move to a different place of relaxation. A brief morning siesta, and it's almost time for lunch (the fish or shrimp tacos are good). More walking, more reading, and then to the bar for happy hour. Even the food, which I was so doubtful about at first, seemed to improve as the days went by. I've probably never eaten so many fresh fruits and vegetables as I did in the week we were there. As so many others have said, the employees are uniformly friendly, efficient, helpful, and kind. I especially appreciated that they tactfully encouraged your use of Spanish--they were all fluent in English, but the staff often reminded you of the Spanish word as well. My very limited Spanish vocabulary doubled or tripled during our stay. There are some things you should be aware of before deciding whether Petit Lafayette is the right place for you. The wi-fi connection is spotty. The bungalows are very clean, and the sheets are changed every day, but they're not at all luxurious. The shower's temperature and flow were both highly changeable. A trip into Playa requires a taxi ride (or a pretty long and sandy walk). And then there's that bottle of instant Sanka. Because it's a small resort, your experience could depend on who was in the bungalow next to you. On our last day, a family with a seemingly unlimited number of voluble and enthusiastic children checked in. I think our experience of Petit Lafitte as a peaceful retreat would have been different if the same family had been there all week. On the other hand, if we'd complained about our neighbors, my guess is that the staff would have tried everything possible in order to accommodate us. They clearly wanted us to have a good time, and we did.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Gina B
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a relaxing beach getaway, away from crowded gigantic resorts, this is the place. Petit Lafitte has friendly staff, clean rooms, good fresh food and is right on the beachfront. My boyfriend and I never felt crowded, liked that we could hear the ocean from our room and that our balcony had a partial ocean view; it felt like we had escaped to a little tropical paradise. We liked that we could take long walks along the beach, relax under a palapa on the beach during the day and get to enjoy the little beachside bar for lunch and for a drink after dinner. Breakfast and dinner were nice and fresh; it was nice to eat outside under a thatched roof and look out towards the ocean every day. And we found the area around PL a great place for photos. The staff were excellent and very helpful! We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and setting is like paradise!”
Reviews.Author: travelplannermom
Reviews.Content: My daughter's first comment, upon looking at the beach from the porch of our bungalow, was that "this looks like paradise." 'Nuff said (but I'll say a little more anyway). Bungalows are rustic -- toilet clogged one day and we had some ants, and you get a beach towel when you check in that you use all week. Dinner is a set menu every night, with 2 choices of main dish. If any of that throws you, this probably isn't the place for you. Those are about all the "negatives" I can think of. The staff is great -- polite, helpful, friendly, willing to practice a little Spanish with you, etc.etc. Without exception, top-notch people working there that added so much to our stay. Beautiful fruit selection every morning, great toast (homemade bread? tasted like it), great banana pancakes, huevos racheros, etc. Sample the cocktails -- wonderful, fun, professional bartender that knew his stuff and obviously took pride in his drinks. The mojitos and margaritas were the best I've ever had (including places like Rick Bayless' Frontera Grill). Beach is BEAU-TI-FUL! Some nice places to swim, great sandy beach to walk on. Candlelit dinner outdoors every night was great. Nice, mellow, relaxing vacation. Myself, DH, and 2 teens all agreed we'd come back here in a heartbeat! Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Beachl0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Petit Lafitte and had a fantastic time. The service is top-notch, all of the employees went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and kept the grounds in top shape. I would suggest springing for a bungalow, definately worth it! This is a great place to get away from it all and relax. We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Escape”
Reviews.Author: Jrice3981
Reviews.Content: My wife, five year old daughter, and I stayed at Petit at the end of January for a week and we found our time very pleasant. The food was fairly good, the staff was very kind and helpful, and the resort though off the beaten path, was quiet and relaxing. The bungalows were not the largest but, did accomodate the three of us pretty nicely. The shower in our cabin was a little weak and leaked into the living area a few times during our stay but, it was not a hassle. The AC did give out but, again the staff being helpful, allowed us to move over to the next bungalow without any issue. I would recommend this hotel to those seeking a peaceful place away from the hustle and bustle of the city area and traffic. This is a place geared towards a slower pace. If you are looking for a lot of activities and a lively atomosphere I would look more towards a larger resort. For those looking to stay here seek out Caesar for he was very kind and helped make suggestions on where to go, what to see, and where to eat. Thanks Caesar for all help. Jeremiah/Merci/Michaela

Reviews.Title: “Back again.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy F
Reviews.Content: We did it again a family vacation at this small but first class slice of paradise. If you want a resort that is relaxing and only feet from the beach no matter if your in a bungalow, or one of the clean and comfortable rooms. This is the place for you. Their are no crowds or elevators to hassle. With miles of beach to walk, or just hang out in a hammock and enjoy the beautiful blue ocean. Staff is always welcoming and friendly feel as if you never left. Service and meals I have to say is the best we have had in any resort. My husband is gluten intolerant (Celiacs disease). They remembered this and his meals were always gluten free. So nice not to have to worry about this while on vacation. Looking forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven......”
Reviews.Author: morrisdb
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more pleasantly surprised and pleased with our experience at Petit Lafitte - our first experience here, and hopefully not our last!. We opted for the Ocean View Bungalow, and truly enjoyed stepping barefoot directly into the silky sand, walking by shaded hammocks underneath palm trees on the way to the beach. All of the staff went out of their way to insure our comfort and happiness - we especially remember David, Javier, Herman, Eduardo and Antonio for their great wit, diligence, attentiveness and demeanor. We realized the first day that we were in a very special place - after walking the beaches and seeing the larger resorts, we knew we chose the right place, and felt like we were at home when we returned. Excellent fresh fruit and yogurt at the breakfast buffet - my favorite egg dish remains the Huevos Motulenos - and every dinner was superb. We usually opted for a later dinner (we didn't skip many meals !!), and especially enjoyed the Wednesday evening mellow music of a talented guitar and violin duo. We had one of the best massages from the strong and soothing hands of Lorena under the shade of a palapas with the sounds of the waves. Great swimming, great pool, great food, great experience! (Be sure to ask David H. about his older brother Javier (or is it the other way around??? :-))

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing hotel but unfortunately we´re disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Pluttan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a seaview room. We liked: * The room. Nice, clean rooms, soft beds and pillows (+++), clean bathroom *The pool was clean *The beach restaurant *The nice and serviceminded staffs *The amazing beach *So relaxing place and beautiful garden *Not too many rooms *And a lots more We didn´t liked: * We paid extra for a seaview...but we only saw a little bit of ocean. The view was not the same as the picture of a seaview room we saw on Petit Lafittes website, before we booked our holiday. We had the worst location on our seaview room. That means, we paid as much as all other tourists that had a nice seaview for our partial seaview room. That room should be called partial seaview and should cost less than the other rooms with good seaview. *There was not enough with sunbeds on the beach for everyone. So guests went up 6 am in the morning and reserved sunbeds with their towels, then they went back in their room and returned in the middle of the day. So if you was eating breakfast after 9.30 - you had no sunbeds on the beach for the whole day. Worst thing about that - the hotel accepted that. *They served dinner for 7 pm at noon. If you wasn´t there at 7 pm, you had to wait for a table...because they hadn´t enought with tabels for their guests to eat at the same time. So when you finally get your table, some dishes was finished. Bad!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in paradise”
Reviews.Author: JBGeorge
Reviews.Content: Our friends tipped us off to Petite Lafitte, what a spectacular place to get away from it all and relax. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and accommodating. It is a little piece of paradise. Two of my favourite activities were relaxing in a hammock and walks on the beach. The food was delicious and beautifully presented (also just the right amount). We loved the chicken sopes. The drinks were also sensational. We stayed in a garden room and enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the afternoons. We met a lot of people that had been coming to Petite Lafitte for years and we could see why; we’ll be back too.

Reviews.Title: “Our second time back...and we'll visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Davis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to Petite Lafitte for a second time this year and were not at all disappointed. We found it to be just as fantastic as it had been the year before: the staff was wonderful, the food fantastic, and the drinks well mixed and plentiful! The review I posted from last year still stands true – we found this resort to be wonderfully secluded. The only thing I’d update from my previous review is that the wifi signal seems to have been boosted as I had no issues connecting from my room. What surprised us the most on this visit was that we recognized a number of hotel guests that were down at Petit Lafitte the year before! If that’s not a glowing recommendation, I’m not sure what is! We’ll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Leslie608
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from 8 nights @ Petit & we fell in love with the place & the staff! Our flight was delayed & we arrived in the evening, driving down this tropical jungle road, which was lit with torches and looked magical, to start our magnificient week. We were checked in promptly, shown around & offered dinner even though the dinner service had ended. We stayed in one of the beach bungalows, which we loved. Like others have said before, if you are looking for luxury, Petit is not the place, but if you are looking for natural beauty, a magnificient beach & friendly, helpful staff, there is no where we have been that's better! The bartenders Jesus, Victor & Manuel Bee were wonderful & entertaining. Davide made sure everything was great & went out of his way to greet you & check in with you. Javier, Antonio & the rest of the wait staff do a superb job of serving and Guillermo was an absolute pleasure to meet. His passion & philosophy about Petit are one of the reasons it is so wonderful! Our room was clean and although the beds were hard, neither my husband's or my back ever hurt & we slept beautifully each night. We would sit outside on our porch each evening, having drinks & listening to the waves. We did not get one single bug bite during our entire stay. It was amazing! Breakfast was delicious with a buffet of fresh fruit, cereal, yougurt, granola, pancakes, french toast & sweet rolls each morning & a menu of omelets & every type of mexican specialty breakfast you could want. I asked for fried eggs, bacon & toast & was happily accomodated. Dinner always included a delicious salad bar & a fabulous soup along with 2 choices for an entree or a buffet was provided. Everything was fresh & delicious, although the food in the buffet could have been kept hotter. There are many animals in the back of the resort. Wander back there & don't be alarmed if a man with a machete in his hand appears & beckons you with the machete to follow. You won't be disappointed. He will show you minature deer, antlered deer, turkeys, pheasants, peacocks, macaws, toucans, african grey parrot & capybaras. Petit arranged a taxi for us to go into PDC in the evenings & we rented one for the day & traveled to the Tulum Ruins, Casa Cenote in Tankah & Akumal. The drivers were always polite, professional & informative. Both my husband & I agree it is our new "home". We always felt extremely safe. I even told my friends that I could see myself staying there by myself if something ever happened to my husband. I was that comfortable there. We can't wait to return, to swim in the beautiful Carribean Sea, lie on the gorgeous white sand beach, drink delicious Cuba Libres & lay dreamily in one of the hammocks....absolute paradise found!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjago1000
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the PL from the end of January and cannot praise it enough. Small, charming, delicious food and exceptional service throughout. We had an oceanfront bungalow which was very nicely located set in the sand just a short way back from the ocean and in peaceful coconut palm shaded surroundings. The rooms are not luxurious but well equipped with lots of bottled water replaced each day, a small fridge, comfortable beds and very good housekeeping. All the staff are so enthusiastic about their hotel and really care about satisfying their guests needs. We never ate out because the quality of food was so good with lots of local produce and home baking. There is good swimming from a sandy area beside the hotel (although immediately in front it is rocky) but walking down the beach was a bit of a disappointment - it really wasn't that attractive a beach coastline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Spot”
Reviews.Author: Sally K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Petit Lafitte for eight nights and it was lovely. The service is superb. Everyone is friendly and helpful. The meals are delicious! Breakfast and dinner were included. We loved the bar. Great mojitos and pinacolados! Great guacamole and quesadillas. Nice chats at the bar w/ fellow travelers. We spent much of each day under a palm tree reading. It's easy to either walk into town or get a taxi. We preferred the solitude of the beach. We also got some great massages. It was a really nice vacation for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Hansfrue2
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Petit Lafitte, we checked in to a slow-paced, calm atmosphere. Next, instead of having us stay in the main hotel portion, they upgraded us to one of their bungalows. The bungalow was perfect, just a few steps from the beach. We had the half-inclusive package: Breakfast and dinner were included, lunch and drinks were not. The food was the best part, ranging from Chicken Sopes to Ceviche and pablano pepper soup...delicious. Davide made our stay a breeze. When we had an issue with renting a car, he acted as liason for us, solving our problems. I would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. Quiet, friendly with great food. Lots of choice. Far enough away from the Playa Carmen crowd but close enough if you want it.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service from a by-gone era”
Reviews.Author: andrew m
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just came back from a wonderful holiday at petite Lafitte. If your looking for a more intimate experience in a beautiful part of Mexico then this small hotel would be the perfect choice. Our time spent here was second to none. The food was delicious and the service was personal in that we felt we really knew the staff by weeks end and they cater to your every need. Perhaps the nicest beach in the area and definitely the quietest with a cozy beach bar.We bumped into so many guests who were repeat customers. If your into the all-inclusive experience this is probably not for you. This place caters to those looking for an alternative experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Hunabku2012
Reviews.Content: Petit Lafitte is a charming small hotel located in one of the most quiet beaches in Riviera Maya, excellent for kids or couples. The service by the Mayan staff is superb and meals delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: Glenn H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a wonderful week at Petit Lafitte. The location was wonderful, (close to Playa del Carmen without being too close), and we had a nice sandy swimming area, (which was unlike most of the resorts up and down the beach). The staff were helpful, efficient, humorous & courteous, from the front desk to the dining & bar areas, as well as housekeeping and grounds crew. We enjoyed waking up in the rustic bungalow surrounded by native palms, fruit trees and flowers. This was exactly the getaway we were looking forward to when we planned our vacation. Good food. Clean. Friendly. Good wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing again”
Reviews.Author: fullgamut
Reviews.Content: Our second stay and the staff at Lafitte have again wowed us. The attention to detail, the location, personal service, everything, truly, unmatched. Thank you for a wonderful holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the toucans!”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 relaxing days at Petit Lafitt and would not hesitate recommending this charming small hotel to our friends and family. The white sand beach was pristine, the bungalow was spacious and comfortable, the food was delicious, and the service was friendly. If you are looking for glamour (or even a TV), you won’t find it here. Here you will find a hammock, a beach, a pool, a ping pong table, a beach bar, friendly people to meet, and (if you look carefully) a small animal refuge with the most gorgeous toucans and other critters being tenderly cared for. And---the price was right. Satisfied customers? You bet!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Playa del Carmen, Quintana Roo, Mexico
Reviews.Title: “Wedding plans with Ivan...”
Reviews.Author: Lynn E
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually stayed at PL as yet but I live across the highway in the jungle so I take lots of my visitors there for eats/drinks and a day at the beach. The reason I'm writing this review is because my neice from Calgary fell in love with the place and has decided to have her wedding reception there. I've been delegated as Mexican aunty to handle arrangements; I met with Ivan Fuentes today for the first time and was so very impressed with his professionalism and gave a huge sigh of relief that I will have him to help me with the plans!! Thank you Ivan for taking the time out of your busy schedule to speak with me; I look forward to planning this wedding with you!! Best regards, Bridezilla's Aunty!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure Island”
Reviews.Author: ChasPappas
Reviews.Content: A family-run hotel set on a stretch of beach away from the noise and the T-shirt vendors of downtown Playa del Carmen, Petit Lafitte is as quiet as a Buddhist retreat and as relaxing as a pina colada. Make that *two* pina coladas. I had researched several dozen area hotels and resorts for a month, narrowing them down one by one until I was sure I had found the best combination of comfort, location, amenities, and, of course, price: Petit Lafitte. After staying there for about a week, I can say I was more right than I could have ever known. With about 40 rooms -including 17 beachfront bungalows - Petit's lodgings all have tiled floors, fans, A/C, safes, minibars, coffee makers, and free Wi-Fi.The private bathrooms also come outfitted with a hairdryer. The bungalows -where I stayed- are rustic chic, set in grove of coconut trees. Large and spacious, the room's noisiest aspect was the rhythmic whoosh of the surf and the occasional plonk! of a coconut dropping to the ground. The bungalow shared all the same amenities as the regular hotel rooms, too, except for phones and TVs, which you'll miss about as much as I missed my down parka. Every day at Petit was a mix of Margaritaville and the Garden of Eden. If you're feeling ambitious, the activities center, located in a kiosk facing the ocean, could arrange for scuba diving, snorkeling, kite surfing, etc. either there or in the area's caverns, caves, reefs, and the like. Or, if you're like me and play at relaxing the way others play at Farmville, you just lie on a chaise lounge under palm trees or in a hammock that swings gently in the nap-inducing breezes. The beach itself has sand as white as cotton balls, and in my opinion, after walking several miles up and down the beach, is the most pristine and immaculately-kept beachfront of any hotel or resort there. Getting in some walks was a necessary evil after downing the pina coladas, margaritas, and "daquiri y limons" at the Petit's open-air bar a few steps from the Caribbean. Nothing there is made from scratch; in fact, they grab some of the fallen coconuts and use the fresh fruit to make your pina coladas. Hang out at the bar at night and you'll also run into several people who have been returning here for up to 20 years -which is in itself the kind of review you can never buy, only earn. After all that pina colada-slinging, hammock-swinging exertion, I needed to replenish myself at the Petit dining room. (Along with breakfast, diner is included in the the cost of a room.) Unlike the mega-resorts, Petit doesn't put out an assembly line of 739 dishes in an effort to convince you that bloated is better. Here you get two main entrees - one of which is usually a seafood dish- and a buffet of salad ingredients as well as soups, such as a perfectly made poblano-pepper soup I enjoyed one night. There's also the nightly dessert, of which the flan was as light as an angel's wings. Based on traditional Mexican and Yucatan cuisine, the food was simple but freshly made. For me, the highlight was the Wednesday-night BBQ where the chef served up marinated pork, beef, chicken, and fish entrees that were sublime in their balance of spicy and savory tastes. Their homemade guacamole and pico de gallo would have made Rick Bayless break down and cry in envy. Anyone feeling the need to leave the hotel can arrange virtually any kind of tour or activity through the always-helpful concierge service there as well as transportation back to the airport when you depart -although by then you'll leave only after realizing, yes, you do have bills and a job to return to somewhere. As for me, i plan on coming back in a few months -because too much of the Petit is not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Mexico Magic”
Reviews.Author: Tana4pm
Reviews.Content: One of the joys of being married to a travel shop manager is you get to benefit from all of the years of experience and feedback they have first hand. Recently (Jan 2012) this was highlighted when we stayed at Petit Lafitte. In a word it was Fantastic. The charm of the bungalows is only exceeded by the determination of the staff to ensure your stay is memorable. From a beautiful beach off your doorstep, to cocktails at the excellent bar, we loved our stay. Having travelled to many summer holiday destinations throughout the Pacific, Australia, Thailand and Bali, we feel this destination rated the best so much so that we'll make the 24hrs + flight back to stay with David and his team again. Superb! Go there and be delighted with your choice and try the breaded shrimp tacos at the bar for lunch! Simply amazing and affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Classic,traditional Mexican charm”
Reviews.Author: THOMAS C
Reviews.Content: It had been 17 years since I had been to Mexico and I was pleasantly surprised that the smaller quaint Mexican resort hotel was alive and well in the Petit Lafitte. The staff, the food,the accommodations and the beach setting were great. I look forward to returning to this special place. Our compliments to David Herrera,the hotel concierge and all the staff .

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: thegadsby
Reviews.Content: We took our 4 month old on his first real vacation and Petit Lafitte was the perfect spot for this. While there is not shortage of options in Playa del Carmen, this was the right place for us. The whole time we were there, I kept thanking my husband for finding Petit and sparing us from a busy all inclusive. We stayed in a bungalow and loved it. Modest space, but what we expected. I loved that I we could put our feet in the sand first thing in the morning. We stayed in a jungle view room, but hope to rent an ocean view next time - they look amazing. The service was perfect. Everyone was very polite an helpful. Meals were very good as well. Fresh and yummy. Others reviews said the food was not good, but we disagree. Again, not fancy food but really good. The only complaint we had was the showers in our room. Almost no water pressure and took a long time to get hot. A good shower after the beach is nice to have.

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL OF A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LaurieandPeter
Reviews.Content: This hotel (although I would love to keep it a secret so we will always be able to get a room) is without a doubt our favorite hotel of any place we have traveled to (and we travel quite alot). The hotel is simple, nothing fancy, but it has everything you could possibly need and is super clean. But the staff is what makes this hotel special. They are incredible. They refer to you by your name - what other hotel can say that?! They make you feel like you are their friend, which you are! We have been there twice now, and will be going back. It is a jewel among all of the huge all-inclusive horrible places that I would never stay at (I don't care if the booze is included). It is quiet, beautiful grounds, simple, warm, friendly, uncrowded, good simple food, and a wonderful, wonderful staff. WE LOVE THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Our first and definitely not last visit to Lafitte”
Reviews.Author: denitzfamily
Reviews.Content: Petit Lafitte is perfection - small, intimate and totally unfussy, warm and friendly to its international and intergenerational group of guests, and with a lovely and uncrowded beach, grounds, delicious food, a loving staff and more than enough creature comforts to make us happy to do little more than rest and renew over the arc of each day. Playa del Carmen is a short ride away and still a lovely town (the un-Cancun), We hired a driver for a day's visit to Coba, Tulum and some still unspoiled small villages. But mostly this was all about enjoying each other and the company of our fellow guests. It's miraculous that Petit Lafitte has remained so true to itself over so many years and to understand the deep affection so many people feel toward it. My only advice is to make certain to read the descriptions of Petit carefully so you are perfectly clear about what Petit Lafitte is and what it isn't ...if you buy the concept, you will absolutely, positively be a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lawgirl78
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my trip yesterday, and Petit Lafitte was everything I expected and more. Like others have said, you have to know what you're expecting here. My friend and I stayed in a standard garden view room, which was perfectly located between the beach and the open air dining area where breakfast and dinner is served everyday. The room was simple and very clean, and had a lovely patio where you could sit and enjoy the view. If you're looking for luxury amenities and nightlife, this isn't for you (I'm pretty sure my friend and I were the only singles at the hotel. This wasn't an issue for us, but it was hard not to notice all the couples). If you're looking for a place to unwind and relax, this is perfect. I didn't have a single worry while I was there. The food was good, with plenty of variety. Breakfast was outstanding. If you go, definitely book a massage on the beach, it was amazing! The stretch of beach in front of the hotel is beautiful, I think the nicest in the area, and there was never an issue of finding a beach chair. I can't say enough about the staff, who really made the place feel more like someone's home than a hotel. For the value, especially, I couldn't have imagined anything better. I hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “reviews need to be more accurate”
Reviews.Author: CanadaScot
Reviews.Content: We looked forward to our first trip to Mexico and to this hotel based on the reviews. Whilst conscious it was 3 star, the reviews gave the impression that the food, staff, surroundings exceeded the 3 star rating. We were disappointed. When we were there there was a dispute with the immediate private residential neighbor. Loud music played with outside speakers from 7am to 11pm. Not the hotels fault you say? No attempt to advise hotel guests about the issue and what they were doing about it. We had to ask after enduring it for two days. The resident had even built up piles of rubbish outside his house, guests from other hotels walking along the beach were stopping to take pictures! When we asked what was happening, we were offered a room in the apartment block.We declined as we had paid for the ocean front beach hut and there were 5 of us. Sorry we cannot do anymore we were told. Other people moved and luckily the hotel was not full. Okay bad timing you say, after 4 days it stopped, then we felt the quiet and fantastic views of the ocean begin to take over. Queue the staff to pick up the service that they were famous for, nope just fine and polite nothing above standard. The pool was a nice break from the windy ocean front, bit chilly mind. The food. Really people? Come on - whilst the options were great (one day main course options were 2 types of fish, wtf?) it was okay. The breakfast was the best for options and amount you could have. Ignore the whiners about the road, its fine. I would agree with bungalow 1, don't take it as its the main thoroughfare to beach front and next to the toilets. Family friendly? Just about, in fact if it was not for the oceanfront, we would have picked another resort. Still surprised at the number of WOW reviews, almost too good to be true and you know what they say about that! It clearly works from a marketing point of view and good luck to the management for getting it that right, maybe we were elevated to the heightened frenzy by other reviews and let down when we got there? I ask my fellow reviewers to be realistic please.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ss2010Alexandria
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Petit Lafitte and its predecessor for over twenty years, and it's better this year than ever! The staff, many of whom have been there for many years and remember returning guests, go out of their way to make your experience personal and perfect. The seaside bungalows are wonderful--right on the beach, with your own porch and hammock. The beach was heaven, which guests from the Princess admired longingly. They were paying many times more to be stacked up like chckens in a coop and their beach was smelly and so littered it was unusable. The palapas on the beach gave everyone the opportunity to get as much or as little sun as they wanted, and to still be together. Food was better than it's ever been, and the seaside bar is a great place to relax and meet other guests. A quiet place, Petit Lafitte attracts those who don't want the glitz, which tend to be international travelers, couples looking for a quiet place to get away, and families--often of multiple generations. Don't be fooled by its informal style--this place is definitely first class, and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional and Unusual Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: stmalo7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what a beach resort should be. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and the small scale of the hotel allows the guests to relax, get to know each other (if they want to), and not worry about things like whether there will be room for them on the beach in the shade under a palapa, or whether they will be able to get a table at dinner. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and the scale is such that it is a short walk from one's room to the pool, the beach, or the restaurant. My wife and I spent the week reading, playing scrabble, and swimming. The hotel manages to cater to different tastes and interests--young couples without children, young couples with children, older couples, family reunions, Americans, Canadians, Europeans and Asians. Everyone seemed to get along very well, The design of the grounds ensures that people have enough personnel space when they need it, but also places to meet other guests. The guests who come here seem to be somewhat "self selecting" in that they are looking for something different from the large glitzy resorts on the Mayan Riviera. Although the hotel caters to many different tastes, it is relatively peaceful and quiet. There is a bar, and it is hopping at night, but it does not disturb the peacefulness of the resort. The only minor criticism I would have is that with such a small hotel, the food choices are somewhat limited. There is a menu at breakfast, and there are a lot of choices, but at dinner there are only two entrees offered. The breakfasts were uniformly very good; the dinners were somewhat less consistent, but certainly of a good standard, at a minimum, and certainly very reasonable considering the relatively low pricing of this resort. We would definitely recommend it and we expect to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more perfect”
Reviews.Author: KCP_FragletsArt
Reviews.Content: My 18 year-old daughter and I just returned from a week at Petit LaFitte, and had a wonderful, relaxed time. The last day we were there, we were thinking of all the friends and family that we want to bring back with us for vacations in the future. The simplicity and small size of the "resort" adds to the comfort and pleasure we experienced all week. The staff called us by name after only one day, kept the threads of conversation going throughout the week, and made us feel very welcome and safe. The guests were friendly, as well, making the whole experience feel a bit homey. Not intrusive, 'tho. The gardens are lovely, the pool, while small, was perfect for refreshing dips, and the food was fabulous. The beach was quiet, clean, and the perfect place to relax. I should mention that I did not leave my tips until the very end of the week (always short of cash), so the staff's friendliness and hospitality felt genuine. I wish I'd left more...

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Retreat”
Reviews.Author: ks60
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Playa Del Carmen, and spent the last three nights of our vacation at Petit Lafitte. It was a wonderful contrast to the busy big hotels, and we were very well cared for. The concierge, David, is friendly and helpful. He is from the area, so he is able to give you great advice on day trips, etc. We chose an ocean view bungalow for our stay, which was very quaint, but it had a very comfortable king size bed, A/C, hot water in the shower, a safe, and a refrigerator. The beach is nice and well cared for. Hammocks are available as well as plenty of comfortable chairs. The meals were excellent , and served in an open air dining room. The entire staff was so accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to families, as well as adults.

Reviews.Title: “Clean facility, Personal Attention from staff and Great Food & Drinks!”
Reviews.Author: LeneBean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just took our 9 month old baby on his first trip, and Petit Lafitte in Mexico was the place to be! The Hotel is sooooooo clean and manicured and all of the workers were willing to help us with anything we required - crib, high chairs, bottled water ... They would even hold and entertain our little guy. The food that they served us was always plated artistically and tasted divine! Having been to several big all inclusive resorts, it was nice to NOT have music blaring everywhere, NOT to have to wake up early to save beach chairs, and to be able to get fresh beach towels whenever we needed them. The sand on the beach at Petit Lafitte was amazingly bright and soft, the hammocks provided were great to relax in, and the musical entertainment on certain evenings was classic and enjoyable. We also appreciated that the staff learned our names so quickly. Our baby enjoyed the water in the pool (and the fact that the pool was usually all his), and we loved that our room was steps away from everything : the beautiful beach, the dining room, the bar, the clean blue pool, and the ping-pong/billiards area. It was also great to have the Free Wireless Internet so that we could E-mail pictures back home, update our Facebook accounts, and most importantly...FaceTime our family who were missing the baby. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality at this Playa gem :-)”
Reviews.Author: margaretreiko
Reviews.Content: The bungalow I shared with my two friends was perfect because it had two beds on the ground level plus a loft, which was a lot of fun. Bungalow was super-cute, just the right amount of rustic without being too rustic. We had electricity (lights and A/C) and hot water 24 hours a day and the beds were extremely comfortable and the room spacious. The hospitality at Petit Lafitte, however, is what is truly unique at Petit Lafitte. The staff are warm and make you feel genuinely welcome. They go out of your way to make sure you are happy and comfortable. The concierge/manager and the bartender were particularly friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this for just about anyone - I can see it as a great place for families with kids, couples or groups of friends. The food is great. It is so close to Playa if you want to explore the city or go out at night. The beach is calm with comfy hammocks. Simply a little slice of heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Petit Lafitte - it's just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCarole
Reviews.Content: You have to know what you want and what you don't want to enjoy this small hotel and collection of bungalows. We knew what we wanted and Petit is perfect for us. We are here till Tuesday, and I will live post on forum if you have any questions. Our ocean front bungalow is simple, clean with great daily housekeeping service. It's right on the beach about 120 yards from the ocean. The bathroom is small, but shower is a good size with reasonable water pressure. Because it's wooden, it seems dark - I like this - a nice contrast to the bright sunlight. Plenty of shade, chairs and hammocks on beach or pool. Certainly NOT crammed together like the other resorts we passed on our daily beach walk. No organized activities - again perfect for us. Staff will chat if you want, or leave you in peace. Great drinks at the bar, or brought to you on the beach, but no-one is pestering you to order. The food is simple, nicely presented, and served in the open air restaurant. If you want an AC restaurant, with pretentious staff, an extensive menu, and some sort of dress code, this is not the place for you. David (the on site manager/boss) makes sure to check in with every guest at breakfast or dinner in a friendly, non intrusive way. He is exceptionally professional and knowledgeable. A man to be completely trusted. We took a day trip with Cesar. Not a tour guide - Cesar is a taxi driver - so we planned out ourselves what we wanted to do. Very pleasant. USD180 for the day. The beach is cleaned of seaweed daily - not that there's a lot of it. A bit rocky right in front of hotel, but 20 yards to left is a sandy entry. Water (in January) is very pleasant (but we are from Calgary canada where it hit minus 49C) We would definately return, as it is a perfect fit for us - but make sure this is the kind of laid back vacation you want :-).

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation. The staff and service are simply extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: lfm2011
Reviews.Content: We planned to go for a vacation during Christmas to Riviera Maya, but we didn't want one of these all-inclusive and impersonal big hotels. After looking the recommendations from other travelers we found this little pearl. About most people agreed on the great service, extremely friendly staff and wonderful experience. I called the reception to learn more and to make a reservation and since the very first moment it was clear that they wanted to help and make things easy for us. ( Thanks Luis, thanks Felipe!). It was clear that the positive recommendations were completely true. We traveled with our two teenagers and stayed in two bungalows. The experience was great. We just went out from the door and walked into a beautiful beach. Complete relax. When we walked the beach along the big hotels with hundreds of people and returned to our Petit Lafitte we thanked our luck for having found it. The staff is really amazing. David, always with good humor and extremely professional, was at all time ready to help and to make sure that we enjoyed our stay. In the restaurants, Javier and his colleagues made sure that we felt at home, calling us by our name from the first day, remembering our preferences and making us feel that they care about us having a great vacation. You can have lunch at the restaurant by the beach, and you will always enjoy the mexican food and the perfect location. Breakfast and dinner are included. Also good. In summary, we have traveled quite a lot, to different places and hotels, and this experience has been really special. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Low-Key Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: 1st family vacation in Mexico, and we loved it. Was a little worried when arriving due to that last stretch of unpaved road, but the resort itself is perfectly fine so those worries were quickly put to rest. As we booked very late, we did not stay in one of the bungalows, but we were very happy with the room we had. Simple, functional and clean. Kids (4 and 6) loved the beach and water, but it was a little rough for the youngest one without a helping hand. The plentiful seaweed was a bit of a turn-off at first, but you quickly get used to it. Lots of families there, and the kids enjoyed playing with the other kids running around. In fact, we didn't travel much outside the resort as it was so easy to stay there and relax. It felt completely safe to let the kids run around and play, so we weren't worried if they were out of sight for a bit. The pool was a bit cold when you first jump in, but it was definitely warm enough to enjoy. We split each day between the beach and the pool and had plenty of fun with both. Food was almost always good to great in our opinion-- we were pleasantly surprised at the quality at dinner our first night. Dinner was our favorite meal of the day, but the late start (7pm) and slow serving time was tough for the kids to wait for after a hard day of play in the sun. After a couple days, we figured out that ordering some food from the bar (which serves simple food for lunch) a couple hours before dinner would keep them from being quite so hungry. Couldn't avoid them being tired though! There were a couple of buffet nights (special holiday meals) that were perfect as you could avoid the wait time. The best thing about Petit Lafitte is the staff and service. They were always friendly and helpful without exception. They helped us arrange a rental car which was dropped off and picked up directly at the hotel, which was very convenient for the 2 days we used it. We used it to visit the ruins at Tulum and a few beaches further south-- the kids favorite was Akumal Bay since the waves were low and the floor was nice and sandy with no rocks. If you are looking to spend some quality time with family in a low-key, relaxing setting it would be hard to beat this place. We were very happy with our time here, and our kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A charming oasis”
Reviews.Author: amm1u
Reviews.Content: The Petit Lafitte is small, peaceful and relaxed, with a pretty beach and attentive service. The non-bungalow rooms are not luxurious and could be improved by some simple additions, such as better bed-linen and soft furnishings. However they are spacious, with effective A/C and showers and they are continuously topped up with bottled water and materials for coffee making. As others have said, the food is not cordon bleu, erring on the bland side. However it is filling, healthy and they do try to be imaginative without scaring the horses. Breakfast is excellent, with lots of fruit and a number of freshly cooked options. There is also a good lunch selection offered in the baechside bar. Although the beach is not private and has quite a lot passers by, anyone familiar with Mediterranean equivalents would consider it secluded and the mostly rocky entry to the sea can be avoided easily by walking a few yards to a sandy spot. The restaurant staff are professional and efficient without being overly friendly, but generally, the staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way to make one feel welcome. All in all, I would definitely return and it's only to be hoped that they can continue to resist the encroaching tide of giant all-inclusive resorts that seems to be getting closer and closer. If you want to see how different it can be in this part of the world, a brief visit to one of these zoos is enough warning!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Workhardplayhar
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Petit Lafitte on Jan. 2-6 2012 with my wife. We stayed in a bungalow, it was great to have alittle place with a porch. The hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly. The hotel is right on a uncrowded beach. Never had to race out in the morning to claim a spot. Plenty of chairs and was never asked to buy anything on the beach. Pool is small but if you are going to Playa to swim in a pool, you are crazy. Breakfast is great and lunch at the beach bar is good. Dinner was good but I could see how some describe it as average. So if you are looking for ultra-luxury and swim up pool bars with blasting techno music do not go to this hotel. BUT if you are looking for a clean, friendly, relaxing beach vacation this is your spot. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “sand at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: sailart
Reviews.Content: This little gem is rustic and hidden away on a beach with difficult road access but is worth the effort. Everyone in the area knows exactly how to get there. The front desk (Eduardo) staff is remarkable. The bartender is grumpy and the drinks reflect that. The beach at the hotel was rocky. The beaches within walking distance in front of nearby larger hotels were nice. The views and private (dark) bungalos were special. When we left in September, the hotel was generous with solving our communication problems and we were definitely going to return this winter when the place was busier.... We probably will someday.

Reviews.Title: “The truth about petit lafitte !”
Reviews.Author: Dakotatravel
Reviews.Content: Food is bad, the place is not very easy to find, the pool is small and cold, rooms are ok, service is ok we next time I'll try an all inclusive

Reviews.Title: “Hey, hey hey!”
Reviews.Author: Chachie2
Reviews.Content: Our Trip was absolutly GREAT! We stayed at Petite in November 2011. The hotel is as a previous reviwer said "Truly a Hidden JEM!" as we soon found out how good a private beach feeling is as opposed to a busy all inclusive hotel you really feel welcome and safe at this hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious, the Pool was clean and available,the dinners were very good choices were very well planned and prepared and of course the service provided by the staff was very courtious and helpful. We also met other guests who were very nice and also enjoyed the private feel of this hotel. Although I stayed here with my friend I will plan to stay here again with my family as it is a very accomodating hotel towards single people, couples and families of all kinds.This hotel is a good place to stay if you are looking for a peaceful getaway, Because you can always take a cab into town for about 15 dollars to see a band Jam on stage at ......Jam On... right across the street from Coco Bongo(if your not into a club scene..)...... Thank You To everyone Philipe, David, Jesus, Louis, Martin,Javier, Guillermo, Canello, Victor, Ivan and who ever I missed its Choooochooooochichas fault. I loved the ostrich! Chachee 2 VKB

Reviews.Title: “I Fell In Love With...”
Reviews.Author: KatChachie1
Reviews.Content: .....Petit Lafitte! Yes! Let me tell you why: my best friend and myself followed the advice from many traveling souls who fell under the spell of Lafitte. We now know why. We are so fortunate to discover such a place that represents such tranquility, peace, comradery and deep beauty- from the kept grounds, the wonderful food ( and drinks;), the accommodation, the close proximity to the beach transcends one into vacation mode...However, what sets Lafitte apart is the most attentive & kindhearted staff ever! Thanks for putting up with the 2 Chachie's!!!! Much love to Jesus (che-chu:) Felipe, Luis, David, Martin, Javier, Victor, Canelo, Guillermo, Francisco, Ivan...for those not mentioned love to you too! Absolutely recommend Lafitte to all! Hope to be back in November? Lots of love Gato aka Chachie Uno!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: travelgal220
Reviews.Content: We spent the Christmas holiday with our family (2 kids - 8 and 10) and it was wonderful...very relaxing and easy. Because of the size of the resort and the attentive staff, we all felt at home and the kids especially enjoyed being able to run free-range. Our kids made friends within the first 2 hours of being there and ran around thereafter as a little gang of giggles and laughter. As per the previous comments from Borisatlas... this is a fun, friendly, family place...it is loud with laughter and kids. The facilities are a bit basic but perfect for a low-key beach holiday. The staff is AMAZING! David, Victor, Jesus, Havier, Antonio... we knew everones' name because they knew all our names! They are kind, warm and so accomidating that you just want to hug them and make them part of the family. Warning... if you are a complainer, high maintance, materialistic or looking for a high style, fancy experience..this is not your place!!! It's more of a Maragettaville than a Ritz... and we can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, skip dinner”
Reviews.Author: joyceg
Reviews.Content: The room had nice air ventilation and an overhead fan so that air conditioning wasn't needed when we were there. The bed was soft for our tastes and we wish that the comforter wasn't so heavy as the sheet wasn't enough but the comforter was too much. But we could deal with those issues. The people were very good. The outside bar great. The live musicians were wonderful. We had breakfast and dinner as part of our plan. Breakfast was very good. Dinner....well, really bad doesn't even describe it. It came lukewarm. They reheated it for us but the food was not worth the calories. My husband had the chicken and I had the lasagna (you had to choose between the 2). Both were not even close to our liking. What's interesting is that the people at the bar told us how great the food it. I guess great is in the eyes of the beholder. Other than the food, it was nice. However, at $300 (including breakfast and dinner), I suspect you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Rejuvenating Ramily Retreat”
Reviews.Author: kaydeegee_1
Reviews.Content: If you love waking up to the sound of the surf, walking out your door to the beach and never having to wear shoes, a bungalow at Petit Lafitte is the way to go! The glamor is in the beautiful ocean view, intimate surroundings and clean facilities. An attentive, efficient staff is available to answer your questions and meet your needs, whether it is to arrange a taxi to the Mayan ruins at Tulum, an evening of live music and shopping in Playa del Carmen or snorkeling along the coral reef. My favorite part of the day was early morning walks along the beach topped off by a fabulous, made-to-order breakfast, don't miss the Huevos Rancheros! After relaxing on the beach our adult children settled in at the bar, getting to know the other guests in a "Cheers"-like atmosphere. This resort lives up to its billing and we plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful NYE stay!”
Reviews.Author: Smithla6
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Petit Lafitte over New Year’s. We booked an ocean-view room and spent many hours on the incredible beach, swimming in the ocean and walking up and down the shore. The hotel room was fine – nothing to write home about, but comfortable beds and a nice balcony. The refrigerator filled with free bottled water was an excellent perk. Dinners and breakfasts were plentiful with great service. I’m a vegetarian and the staff did work to accommodate me. Sometimes those accommodations left a little something to be desired (for example, one night I ate plain buttered noodles) but they did try to meet my needs. The fruit at breakfast and the salad bars each night were wonderful. On New Year’s morning, they gave us complimentary glasses of champagne, which was lovely! I would definitely stay at Petit Lafitte again, but next time I would get a rental car. It’s a little ways out of town (about $15 USD to 5th Avenue) and from some of the sights ($50 USD to Xel-ha), plus, some of our taxi drivers did not know the hotel and we got lost coming back, especially at night. Overall, though, I highly recommend this hotel, if only for the beautiful beach alone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, family oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachtravelguy
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and children 22 &18) just completed a five day stay at this hotel. We had two rooms side by side which worked well. The hotel was right on the beach and we had no problems getting chairs. Claudio is on-site to help arrange water activities. Playa Del Carmen was a 15 minutes, 155 peso drive away. The rooms were basic and clean. You are advised to not dring the water but liters of water and provided for free. Breakfast and dinner is included. The food was good but not outstanding. The cahrm of this place was the staff. They were extrememly friendly and helpful. Daivd has been there for over thirty years. Javier and Jesus were great bartenders and had been there more than 20 years. We met several families who make the Petit Lafitte a yearly event. We have stayed in fancier places but this was a great experience and an affordable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Keep this secret”
Reviews.Author: myscreennameDenver
Reviews.Content: This is not a place for everyone, but if you are looking for a relaxing resort north of Playa del Carmen, this is it. We stayed for a week in a bungalow just steps from the best beach we saw in the area. Breakfast and dinner is included and if you still have room, lunch can be purchased on the deck right by the beach. When we were checking out, I asked how often they repeat the menu and was told that they are constantly changing the menu and would probably not repeat for a year! I almost hate to give this such a good review for fear that they will be fully booked the next time I want to gol.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, cozy and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ellaschris
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at one of the Petit Lafitte beach bungalows - literally two steps to the beach (you don't even need to wear flip flops or anything, just walk out of your bungalow and into the sand!). This is a very relaxing, beautiful, clean and quiet small resort, service is great and everyone makes you feel at home -excellent staff all around. We traveled with our 4-month old girl and everyone at the resort really went out of their way to make our stay happy and comfortable. Really - you can ask for pretty much anything and it is most likely that they will accommodate you... One small drawback: the food is average. Whilst the beach cafe serves excellent made to order Mexican fare, dinner is very mediocre, heavy on meat and with lots of sauces etc... Why not keep things simple? Break fast is much better but overall if there is one thing that they can work on, that is their food. We also loved the rest of the hotel guests, it really felt like home away from home. We would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great wedding week”
Reviews.Author: cbcmjc
Reviews.Content: Everything for the wedding was great and exactly what we asked for. A real bargain compared to anything else. A great place for the family to be together. Very relaxed and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BeachBugger
Reviews.Content: Amazing place. Amazing Service. Amazing food. I would go back in a heartbeat. We stayed 4 nights at Petite Laffite and it was a great experience. It all depends on what you deem important in your stay. If you want night life, shopping, music ect ….this is not your place. Go stay at a big resort or in Playa. If you want fancy rooms and “5 star hotel-ish” comforts ….this is not your place. This isn’t luxury accommodations. It’s simple accommodations on a secluded part of beach. Simple. Rustic. Quiet. Relaxing. The beach is beautiful. The water is crystal clear. There are only so many rooms so crowds are not an issue. The people at Petit Laffite are truly amazing at what they do. Service levels are out of sight. They get to know each and every patron. They make sure everything is right. I’ll say when we arrived everything wasn’t right. We booked a king size bed as this was part of our honeymoon. Unfortunately there was an issue with our bungalow and we had to settle for two double beds. We were not too happy. But David the concierge made sure everything was done to try to make it better. They pushed the beds together and placed a foamy on the top and made us a make shift king size bed. At dinner, they brought over a nice bottle of wine as token of our understanding. The owner/manager Memo made sure to apologize in person for the issue. There was such sincerity to their actions that we were over it very fast. Nothing is always going to be right in the service industry, but it’s what you do afterwards that sets places apart. The food. This is why the cost is what it is. This is not your all-inclusive type meal my friends. The food was very good. The soups…..my goodness the soups alone are worth talking about. Lime soup, Talepeno soup, tomato soup all homemade and some of the best I’ve had. Breakfast was delicious. Lunch (you pay for lunch) was outstanding. Well we only ordered the ceviche, but we did a few times cause’ it was unreal. Ask for the homemade hot sauce. I am also a decent sized man, 6’0 210 lbs and I have a good appetite. The portions were good. This place reminded us of our trips to Thailand. Beach front bungalows on a quiet beach. But much closer to home. Much, much more expensive mind you, but well worth it for a few days. I recommend for a quiet, relaxing time

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel in Playa....(IMHO)”
Reviews.Author: palmer77
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and two daughters 12 and 14) stayed here one night before taking the ferry over to Cozumel for the Ironman Race. This place is great if you want unique bugalows, GREAT service, good food and a relaxed quiet enviornment. If you want music by the pool and lots of people action then pick any other big place and pay double. The bungalows were great for a family of four although the beds were a bit small for two adults. But my daughter had her own bed and the loft was great for my other daughter. They did not have to sleep together which is a bonus. There is a reef right out front with tons little bait fish all over the place but the water is rough and there is a lot of wind so dont think you are going to get this fishbowl snorkeling experience there. Also, if you go out to dinner, ask them about the underground cave place. AWESOME experience. I highly recommend this location. FYI....they were the original hotel in Playa years back so these guys have years of customer service experience and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: TravelByDotty
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is located on a lovely, amazing beach. I have been going to Mexico for 30 years and this is definitely one of the finest properties I have ever stayed at. The staff is just wonderful - they make sure everything is just right. The food is great - and if you should have special requests - the chef accomodates. I would highly recommend Petit Lafitte!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice bungalow on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Patrick M
Reviews.Content: Quiet and small. The staff was wonderful. They made us feel like family. The beach was great. The food was first class all the way. Our oceanfront bungalow was very quaint, only a few sandy steps to the ocean. They recommended a tour guide/ driver for a day trip to the Mayan ruins. Ceasar did an awesome job with our tour ***** five stars to you Ceasar. Victor at the bar was great, as well as Javier, and all the rest of the staff. They went out of the way to fix an expedia mess up with our daughters room. David and the reception staff are top notch!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Petit is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: DingusBother
Reviews.Content: Petit Lafitte is a lovely beachfront resort. And it lives up to it's "Petit" name - it's small and intimate. You get to know the staff, who are great (and most speak English fluently). The other guests were great too, many of whom have been coming here for years! What stands out for me personally at Petit is the food. Breakfast was off of a menu which offered authentic Mexican breakfast (eggs, chorizo, etc). The bounty of fruit was amazing! Who knew a banana could taste so good? Lunch was also from a menu, prepared and served at the beachside bar it was fresh and delicious. Dinner was a fixed menu, but they are very accommodating for any dietary issues. Petit is the perfect resort if you wish to do nothing but lounge on the beach all day. Personally, I need to be more active and my only complaint would be that the resort is off the beaten path and a car is needed to get to Playa or any other attractions. Ask the staff to arrange a cab for the day, like we did. Of course you can always just take a walk down the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxation!!”
Reviews.Author: JNSA
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a brief but amazing 5 day stay at Petit Lafitte, which is a lovely small beach resort, very peaceful and secluded, and yet only a 15 minute drive from Playa de Carmen. My husband, two children and myself had more than enough space in a bungalow right on the beach. The beach itself is superb and uncrowded, so that we could really relax and enjoy the beautiful Caribbean. For more activities, there is a dive center that can organize diving and snorkeling trips right from the beach. Petit Lafitte is so different from the large glitzy resorts. It offers everything you could need at a beach resort, but yet the service is so personal and friendly. All the staff knew us by name after our first day, and were more than happy to attend to all our needs and requests. I would certainly recommend Petit Lafitte to anyone (especially families) looking for a good value alternative to the large resorts, without having to compromise on comfort or service.

Reviews.Title: “Blissful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Olisan
Reviews.Content: I cannot emphasize enough how wonderful the overall experience at Petit Lafitte is. My husband and I spent four romantic nights there in September. We stayed in the oceanfront bungalow - clean, beautifully appointed, comfortable. The food was delicious. My husband and I still dream about the breakfasts. The hotel is private and small enough to make you feel special, and large enough to have nice amenities. We loved the staff - they take care to get to know you, work with you, and engage with you in a personal manner. My only caveat would be that walking out into the ocean in front of the hotel is rather tricky because of the rocks. But the view - priceless! David, one of the managers, set up a romantic dinner for us one night on the beach - I think he was more upset about it raining a bit than we were because he wanted us to have the perfect experience. If you want to go somewhere you will feel safe, somewhere you will feel special, somewhere you can genuinely make friends - then go to Petit Lafitte. I'd go back tomorrow to Petit Lafitte if it was feasible. We loved Playa del Carmen and the surrounding area as well. But I would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: CTZN
Reviews.Content: When we first looked at the Riviera Maya we looked at all inclusive packages - I'm so glad we kept looking and found Petit Lafitte. It was a perfect antidote for the stress of the daily grind. All the rooms are only a minute from the beach, the included breakfast and dinner was enjoyable, and the staff were delightfully friendly. Many thanks to Luis, David, Martin, Javier, Felipe, Manuel, Waldermero and everyone else. Lunch was not included, but was reasonable, as were drinks at the bar. Since we're not drinkers and we had lunch at Xel-ha and Coba two days we didn't feel like we were paying for something we didn't use. We were there for a week in early November and it wasn't crowded at all--we always got loungers on the beach with our own palapa (thatched permanent beach umbrella), and even with a wedding at the hotel we never felt crowded. Some tips: the included menus were not particularly kid friendly--we'd look somewhere that had a buffet if we brought our little ones. There were mosquitos, but only at dusk, and few on property (they spray for them, thankfully). Bring bug spray for that sunset beach stroll. Also, rain showers happened on a couple days--there was an umbrella in our room, but you may want to bring a plastic poncho or (very) light rain jacket if you're coming in early November. The in-room safe is quite small - it fit my 11.6 inch Acer laptop, but just barely. I'm not sure how well it would fit the slightly longer/narrower 11" Macbook Air. That said, I could fit my laptop, a couple point and shoot cameras, a small m43 Lumix camera, a couple cell phones, and our passports/wallets, but was very glad I didn't bring my SLR or bigger laptop. My only hesitation in writing the review is that more people will discover my new perfect secret getaway ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Colin785
Reviews.Content: I was there in November 2011. I had my wedding there based on a recommendation from a friend and we were soooo impressed. The ceremony was beautiful and amazing. The staff is so friendly, the place is very secluded and totally relaxing. The food was also great. I highly recommend Petit Lafitte. We could not have asked for a better wedding celebration.

Reviews.Title: “We will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: RoundWorldin246days
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 10 days here. The staff were amazing, the food was great, something different every night we were there! We loved the room, right next to the swimming pool and a stones throw from the beach. We stayed here for a relaxing holiday after 9 months travelling round the world. This was perfect. The service was enough to make us go back there again, but everything else was great too. All members of staff knew your name and made you feel like family. Love it! Petite Lafaitte is great for families and couples. If you want an 18-30's party holiday then you probably want to stay in town but for relaxtion this is the place to be. It isnt far from the main centre of Playa Del Carman - we walked it along the beach, but probably not the most sensible idea in the heat! Treat yourself to a cab! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ripley1747
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at Petit Lafitte and thought it was excellent. Bungalos were clean, well kept, property immaculate. In addition to the fantastic location, the draw to coming to Petit Lafitte is the staff. It seemed like all the employees we encountered were there to see to our needs and make our vacation special. The front desk staff of Luis, David and Eduardo were very visible around the resort and stopped frequently to talk to us and answer the million questions we seemed to throw at them. They were more than willing to arrange transportation into town, or customize an excursion, or do whatever else needed doing. The restaurant/bar staff were fabulous, and went above and beyond in making sure each meal was perfect. Baldy, Geovany, Martin and Javier are very good at what they do, and very friendly. Bartenders Jesus and Victor were also very attentive and friendly. Even the iguana that lived behind our bungalo seemed friendly, although we didn't get too close.....The tejon, maybe not so friendly! We didn't venture too far from Petit Lafitte by choice, but we did go into Playa del Carmen one day to go shopping. The front desk arranged for Ceasar to take us there in his taxi, which was great. We made a stop at the Mega store, which has just about everything. Ceasar then took us to Fifth Avenue, which was touristy and horrible! We walked up and down the street, didn't buy anything, checked out the beach, and thanked God we were staying at Petit Lafitte, far from the madness! We'd definately come back to Petit Lafitte. This was our second trip, and hopefully not our last....

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: verucasweethardt
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at PL and are missing it already. The staff went out of their way to make it a comfortable experience for us. We stayed in a room with an ocean view on the third floor in the hotel section. This worked out perfectly for us as we were traveling without our child and wanted a bit more privacy. The view of the ocean as well as the sound of the waves at night was wonderful. The resort is rustic but very comfortable. If you want a place that has excellent food, comfortable rooms, outstanding service and is on the beach look no further. The location is great, being 40 min from the airport and Tulum and about 10 minutes by car from downtown Playa. We'll definitely be back for the fish tacos and the mojitos! Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Peace & Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: kurtnkim
Reviews.Content: Title explains it all. From the grounds to the ocean, to the service and amenities, Petit Lafitte has it all at an amazing price if you're looking for the best value for your dollar and relaxation. They have the best spot on the beach in either direction for entering the ocean. There are rocks in front of all the other locations in either direction. You can also easily snokel right from the beach or swim out further for more. The included breakfast and dinner were also top notch. An extensive breakfast menu and a 4 course dinner (appetizer, soup, entree, dessert) as part of your price was also a great value. And make sure you try Manuel's mojitos - they're the best. The set-up of the resort is great. An open air palapas towards the rear for dining, then the pool, followed by the beachside bar and smaller dining area and the beach itself. Ample supply of chairs and shade as well as hammocks. Rooms were clean and adequate. The only downside was the beds themselves. It is traditonal mexican style cement base with mattress on top which was really hard. My husband didn't mind, and once I folded up the comforter to use as a pillow topper, it was fine. This was in the hotel section, so it may be different in the cabins. You will need mosquito repellant though for dining in the evening, but that's pretty normal for any tropical location. The location to Playa del Carmen is really good as well. You can even walk all the way down by beach (about 3miles) and taxi back. Above all, the service was A++++!!! All the stagg were more than accomodating and so friendly to talk with. We came away refreshed and ready to go again. We've been up and down the coast 8 times now, and Petit ranks at a top spot for us!!
