Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon Experience”
Reviews.Author: Susie S
Reviews.Content: We can't begin to tell you how wonderful the staff is at Petit Lafitte. We immediately felt at home, safe, and cared about....We had a bungalow on the beach facing the ocean (#9) and loved it. Rustic, comfortable, and well-appointed. We stepped off our porch right onto the sand. There were hammocks, comfy loungers, the pool was pristine, and the open-air pool bar was perfect. Javier is the best bartender in Mexico, maybe the world. We felt like he was one of our best friends. The food was great. Always interesting choices, and who would have thought carrot soup would be good? We tried not to lick the bowls. One of the most pleasant surprises was the cost of lunches and cocktails....very very reasonable. The waiters were very nice and helped us with our Spanish. We needed mucho help! We had a couples massage on the beach by Berta and I can't remember the young man's name. Again, fabulous and not too expensive. We spent the first week of our honeymoon here, then went to a big all-inclusive hotel for the second week. We both wished we had stayed at Petit Lafitte for both weeks. We will definitely return. You will never go wrong staying here. It was absolutely perfect. And last but not least, the concierge, David, was an absolute gem. It is the first time either of us ever hugged a concierge when we said good-bye. Need I say more? We miss him as he was an intelligent, friendly, caring man. We regretted not being able to say goodby to Javier, but he wasn't on the property when we left. It was a perfect place for our honeymoon. Ron and Susie

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, wonderful place and people”
Reviews.Author: Vivamexico99
Reviews.Content: Petit lafitte was exactly what we were looking for, a quiet personal place on a beautiful beach where we could enjoy just being there. We stayed in a bungalow and the rooms and facilities were very pretty, clean, and well maintained. Food was wonderful. I would say the only downside for us was that most of the places we visited were south of playa del carmen,and since petit lafitte is north, we were a little farther from things than we would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Larainez
Reviews.Content: This beachfront, cozy property is tucked away in Playa - away from all the BIG crazy resorts. A very relaxing feel - We recommend the bungalows on the beach - we upgraded to one when we arrived and had beautiful views every morning upon waking! There are hammocks hanging from the palm trees and open air cabanas near the beach for relaxing. There are many rocks on the beach for most of Playa - apparently a result of the hurricane 6 years ago- Sad for the hotels - but still worth the trip there. They do have a nice pool and bar area. Half-board plan is a great deal - Filling breakfasts and dinners - every day. ** We must say, the staff here are amazing - as other reviewers have stated!!** They go above and beyond to meet your needs - David, Felipe master the front desk - are both super friendly and helpful! The wait staff in the open air dining room are attentive and pleasant - we especially enjoyed our daily service with Baldemare! What a great guy! David worked with the Chef to ensure that our meal restrictions were met - and we had some great vegan meals - They got creative and made our stay pleasurable! The property is clean with well maintained landscaping. Great massage on the beach - just a short walk down the beach to the south. Live music played Wednesday Nights - A great treat! They were very talented and played electric guitar and violin. Would return here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Pure relaxation and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Scott T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Yucatan looking for relaxation. Petite Lafitte was the perfect retreat to end our vacation. We stayed the last 2 nights of our trip here. The hotel grounds are well kept and there is a nice beach front bar and a comfortable swimming pool. We stayed in the garden view room which was very comfortable and clean. The best part about our stay was the very friendly and attentive staff, all of whom had worked there for upwards of 10 years. Our host, david, knew both of our names immediately upon check in and provided us with plenty of privacy. Our lodging included an incredible dinner for each night of our stay, which included salad, soup, entree, and desert. The breakfasts each morning are amazing!!! On our first night, the staff treated us to a bottle of wine to celebrate our honeymoon. We felt very at home when we were staying at Petite Lafitte. The staff offered to set us up with tourist events to the cenotes and ruins but we had already visited those spots earlier in our trip. An animal rescue is located on the property with many exotic birds and mammals that were rescued from very poor conditions, have you ever seen a live marmot? We had a really good time visiting Petit Lafitte and will absolutely return on our next trip to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Quite exceptional staff service, way beyond call of duty!”
Reviews.Author: Martin T
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at this wonderful friendly hotel enjoying relaxing location, pool, beach, swim with a turtle, bar and food. We were sorry to leave but when we got back to England our son realised that he had left a much loved (but low value) T shirt somewhere at the hotel. We sent an email to the front desk not really expecting to hear back. However a few days later we heard back saying that the T shirt had been found and they would arrange for its delivery to England. A week or so later it arrived, care of another family! We have never before experienced such effort being made for such a small item - fantastic. Hotel of the century!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by the beach...”
Reviews.Author: italiantraveller78
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and room large and comfortable. However, we had high expectations about this hotel because of the positve reviews and were disappointed that the beach in front of the hotel is rocky, so you have to walk to the sandy part to have a dip. The overall structure could use a bit of renovation, there is a general "old" feeling to furniture and buildings. Restaurant was OK and breakfast was generous and good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay just outside of Playa”
Reviews.Author: SteveMLOndon
Reviews.Content: We stayed with three young children in one of the bungalows. It was a marvellous, relaxing place to stay, staff are all very helpful and friendly, food was good. The kids adored it.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: crissi_083
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in August for a few days and had a lovely time! Petit Lafitte is a quiet and very beautiful place, a little gem located just 15 minutes outside of Playa. It has its own private beach as well as a very nice pool where you can relax. There's a bar just overlooking the beach where delicious cocktails are served! The food is excellent and all the staff incredibly helpful and friendly. Guillermo, David and Javier really went the extra mile to make sure we were having a pleasant stay. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “No wonder people keep going back!”
Reviews.Author: KatieB83
Reviews.Content: This review is quite late...we actually stayed at Petit Lafitte in February 2009, but it is so fresh in our minds because we loved it so much. Every time we go somewhere else we compare it to Petit Lafitte and every time we think about going on vacation, we consider going back. We stayed in an oceanview bungalow, actually the best one. I think it was #9 and its the first one on the right. We loved the room, the little porch, and the hammocks. I remember the breakfast and the dinner being good, especially since they're included in the price. But what we really loved was the lunch! The sopes de pollo are amazing and so were the tacos de carne asada. We also discovered our favorite beach drink at Petite Lafitte - cheladas. The bartenders Victor and Jesus were so friendly and we often chatted with them. We also loved that when you sit down for a drink, you get fresh tostadas with salsa de ajo (garlic salsa) which was incredible. All of the waiters were so funny and friendly at breakfast and dinner. Overall we had such a great time at Petit Lafitte, and hopefully one of these days we will finally go back.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Postcard Perfect”
Reviews.Author: urbkishere
Reviews.Content: Our time at Petit Lafitte was like stepping into a beautiful postcard. You know, the one that makes you go all dreamy-eyed with that far, far away look. The one with the amazing beach scene that when you see it you can actually feel the ocean breeze, hear the waves on the shore and smell the salty air. If you have ever had that " take me there" moment, then Petit Lafitte is where you NEED to go. Add to the dream; EXCELLENT SERVICE, truly DELICIOUS food (the soup must be Heaven sent) and bungalows with free air conditioning, wi-fi, bottled water and coffee...well, you get the picture, soooo, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR???? P.S. sit under the cabana, out past the bar and paint some hand made pottery. TOTAL RELAXATION and an awesome souvenir. AND GO TO COBA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time, very attentive and personal staff!”
Reviews.Author: mqqmartin
Reviews.Content: We went with our 15 y.o. daughter and 16 y.o. son. They stayed in a garden room overlooking the pool and we had an ocean view room. Two garden view rooms would have sufficed as we were hardly in our rooms. Great beds and a/c, and few mosquitos, which is unusual for the area! The staff got to know our names on the first day and was very attentive. The beach was beautiful, there were absolutely no issues with getting a palapa and the pool was refreshing. We enjoyed the intimacy of the place and the quietude. We were concerned that the children would be bored but they had a great time. If they got bored they would walk to some of the larger resorts up and down the beach and meet other teens, but mostly they stayed at Petit Lafitte. The Princess hotel slightly to the north offers jetskiing and catamarans. The hotel offered dive and snorkel tours. We all had an outstanding massage. The food was plentiful and great, as were the drinks. At night we would meet other families playing ping pong and billiards. We made some new facebook friends from different countries and we will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and delicious meals”
Reviews.Author: HMPC
Reviews.Content: Upon check in: We were greeted by Felipe and Luis to check in. Luis gave us a tour of the hotel. Room: - We stayed in the most basic room with two full size beds and garden view. The beds are comfortable (set on concrete and with tiled headboard). - Wished we had duvets instead of bed spread, but it was ok since we didn’t use it anyway. - We are given 5 1L bottles of water each day. - The water pressure in the shower is weak but do-able. Water was warm enough for a comfortable shower. - The room seemed a bit out of date. We didn’t stay at the hotel for most of the day anyway so we were satisfied with the room. Beach: - The area right in front of the hotel is rocky and we were advised not to swim there. - Some people swim in the area between Petit Lafitte and Princess Hotel (the half-moon area to the north of the hotel). - We only swam at the beach in front of the Princess Hotel (less than 10 min walk north). It’s not that crowded and we felt it was cleaner on the beach. - Go swim and snorkel in the morning! The water is much clearer and calmer. We saw a bunch of fish and even a sting ray. - Enjoy the hammocks by the beach! - If you have the time and energy, walk to 5th Ave along the beach. It takes about 2 hours but you will pass by some really nice stretches of the beach. Make sure you wear sunscreen and bring water! Pool: - We did not use the pool since the beach was so close! However the staff was very aware of the cleanliness of the pool. We saw the staff cleaning the pool every morning. Service: - Service was excellent. They knew our names by the night of our arrival. Everyone was very helpful and treated us nicely. - The staff genuinely cared about the guests. David asked about our plans each day and made sure we get the most out of our trips. - As we were leaving the hotel at 3:40am to the airport on our departure date, the kitchen made a box breakfast for us the night before so we could leave with a breakfast. Meals: The eating area for breakfast and dinner is outdoor. Make sure you wear a lot of bug spray. Breakfast - Every morning we started with a glass of OJ, a buffet of fruits, usually papaya, pineapple, mango, watermelon and honeydew. There are also yogurt, cereal and buns in the buffet. Then you can order from their breakfast menu for hot breakfast. We tried 80% of the menu during our stay and liked every one of them. Would recommend the Huevos Motulenos and the Spanish Omelet Lunch - We only had lunch once in the hotel. We ordered the petit tacos (beef) which were delicious. Even better with an ocean view. Dinner - The menu for dinner is different every night. The soup, salad bar and dessert are buffet-style. They are also different every night. - The most memorable was the cream of carrot soup! And the Mexican buffet was excellent! - Pick the seafood dish whenever you can. I would skip the beef if there’s a better choice since it was dry the two times it was offered. Pros: - The room had all the basic needs - Food was great - Affordable - Location Cons: - There were really small ants running around the sink. We didn’t care much of it but it could be a problem for other guests. - The towels and bedding often have orange stains. - Restaurant is sometimes too dark and full of hungry mosquitos.

Reviews.Title: “A SMALL PARADISE, LITERALLY”
Reviews.Author: Objective1212
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 6 days at Pettite Laffite, this hotel has 2 kinds of rooms, the apartment style and bungalows wich are like small cabins. We recommend the bungalows (very romantic), you open the door and the sand is right there, you`ll find some palm trees with hammocks and the beach it`s ritght there. The hotel is very small, private and quite, everybody there is very kind and carefull of your well being, they will remember your name as well you`ll remember theirs. If you need a taxi, they will call one and within 20 minutes (only us$ 14) it`s gonna be there. You`ll find a lot of tours to every atraction on the area but we find out that the best way is to hire a taxi, you will pay around us$200. for a day, but you will visit more places and save a lot of time and money plus you deside how much time you want to stay in a place or where you want to stop. Anyways the guys at the hotel will take care of everything you want. We are very happy with Pettite Lafitte in our last day I wished to be able to leave more tip, but you know what happened. Playa del Carmen and its 5th street , Chichen Itza, Tulum, Los cenotes los ojos and many more places to enjoy. we`re gonna miss you guys

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with a great beach!”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: So, for my sister's birthday, my brother and I decided to take her and her family to Playa del Carmen. After researching reviews on tripadvisor and prices on expedia, my brother selected Petit Lafitte. This hotel is right on the water nestled a short distance between the Tides and Princess resorts, both much larger. Before each of those resorts, there is a short distance of small homes, undeveloped areas and small businesses. So, although anyone can walk along the public beaches, this small hotel feels somewhat private. The beach is beautiful - great sand, beautiful blue water. Staff raked up the seaweed that made it onto the shore every morning. The resort itself consists of bungalows or motel-style rooms. We stayed in rooms 301, 302 & 401, all ground floor units in the garden view rooms. Five buildings each have six units. The rooms themselves are tile floored, with two-double beds (fixed on concrete pedestals), refrigerator, TV balanced on said fridge. There is also a coffee pot (ours spilled more than it made) and plenty of bottled water (replenished daily). The room has a sink outside the bathroom with enough countertop space for toiletries. The bathroom itself consists of a toilet and shower. The toilet seat had a very wide base --- I felt like I was going to fall through! Our bed had a bedspread (hate them) and keyed door. My sister's unit had a duvet though -- would have preferred that. The TV had limited English language channels and of those, CNN did not come in clearly. The resort WiFi was hit or miss. The rooms were definitely dated (the resort is the oldest in the area), but still had everything one could need. Breakfast is served under a thatched roof area, open air. We speculated on how everything would work in the event of rain, but never experienced an occasion to be able to comment. Fresh fruit, cereal and buns were available buffet style in the mornings along with hot breakfast choices selected from a menu. At breakfast, dinner options were displayed and special dietary requests could be made should the options conflict with dietary needs. Dinner was also partial buffet, partial order. Salads and soups and dessert were available buffet style, entrees made to order. Lunch can be ordered near the bar on the deck that overlooks the ocean. Down three steps from the deck are a single line of lounge chairs under the resorts palapas. There were always palapas and lounges available. The bar sometimes closed down early - open as late as midnight, but sometimes closed earlier. The pool is small with more lounge chairs. Often we were the only ones in the pool. A small resort like this immediately lends a sense of comfort and familiarity. My sister was able to allow her children to roam freely without worry. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly with tours and remembered our preferences at mealtimes. We cannot say enough good things about them. The resort may not have all the amenities of some of the larger places, but the beach cannot be beat and for tranquility, this is where its at. Now for my one complaint. I didn't notice this until I got back. So, the resort is unaware and no mention was made to them about this. When booking through expedia, we input all our data (need 3 rooms, number of people in each room - including the ages of the children). Then, expedia returned a number of options which include the "average price per night." Only after hitting the booking button does the final total come up with the original rate and the taxes and the "extra guest charge" which was an additional $60/person/night. Since we input all the information and were comparing resorts, shouldn't this have been part of the "average price per night"? Two people extra (the kids) at $60/person/night works out to be $120/night or $840 for the week ($950 with tax)! That is more than another room would have cost. It raised the average price per night from $96 to $136 - not insignificant. Many of the other resorts include options to have two kids free! So, the quoted rates would have been accurate on theirs. Hopefully, armed with this information, you can go in with your eyes open -- this is a great little place.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: buchOregon
Reviews.Content: Our sons and their families have spent the last two years vacationing at Petit Lafitte. We went along In January 2011 and loved it!! My husband has Celiacs disease (gluten intolerance). We have never been treated so well!! They watch every meal and let us know each morning as to what would be on the menu for dinner and what he could eat and how it was prepared. The staff is friendly and treats you like family. Beach bungalows are wonderful with a family, the grandsons love it. We can't wait till our next family trip (already booked) Life is about building great memories and we sure have a great start.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: nbowden
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a better vacation. Between the relaxing atmosphere, incredibly friendly staff, and super cool Bungalow, the vacation was perfect. I will definitely go back and would recommend to anyone considering.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, as Usual”
Reviews.Author: daytripper2012
Reviews.Content: I was a bit shocked to read the negative review by Holylander, perhaps they have not traveled very much - they're do not seem very flexible - however, it's the responsibility of the purchaser to know what you are purchasing, and to keep your receipts. You can encounter travel glitches no matter where you go or where you stay. I am pleased that Ivan wrote such an insightful and honest response that cleared up the Holylander 'spin'. Let me tell you what type of place Lafitte is - About 6 years ago, I was staying at Capitan Lafitte when Hurricane Emily was on a collision course with Lafitte and Playa del Carmen. There were not enough flights for all visitors to leave in a 24 hour period. For our safety, Lafitte sent us to a near-by 5 star hotel that had an excellent Hurricane shelter, all expenses paid, for the remainder of our visit. We were pampered in a safe environment - we had a clean room, delicious cooked food (they had generators) and plenty of water to drink and bathe. WE DIDN'T PAY A NICKEL FOR ANY OF THIS. Lafitte paid the entire bill, including the transfer back to the airport. After we went to the airport to return home, we heard horror stories from guests of other hotels, some of them rather expensive places, who abandoned their guests, and whose management disappeared after the storm, leaving their guests without food, running water, and broken window-glass all over their rooms. In Playa, some hotel guests who took shelter at a school gymnasium were knee-deep in water. By contrast, we had been well-taken care of, beyond what I ever expected. I, and many friends, family and co-workers have been enjoying Capitan Lafitte, and now Petit Lafitte, for the past 20 years, every year. The staff are are nothing but accommodating and courteous in every manner, not to mention friendly. I've traveled to many places throughout the world, and Petit Lafitte is at the top of my list for location, service, accommodation, cleanliness, cuisine, ambiance, and for being totally 'sympatico' in every way. It's been perfect for us. It has always been a pleasure to sojourn at Capitan Lafitte and Petit Lafitte, we hope to visit again next Spring. Do not hesitate to enjoy this very special place, I guarantee you will not be disappointed. ps/ I rated the 'spa' as excellent because, altho they do not actually have a spa, they offer spa services and the masseuse (Berta) is wonderful !!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong!!!”
Reviews.Author: Igel6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled here with four children ages 9 to 16. All of the reviews were very accurate. Great food, warm and friendly people, and superior service. We enjoyed very good snorkeling from the beach. We enjoyed a snorkeling trip and parasailing booked at the onsite dive shop. We enjoyed the privacy of cabanas 14 and 15. The pool was fantastic and the other guests and their children were very friendly. We look forward to our next visit. We have already reccomended this hotel to several friends interested in the area. If you are looking for a truly special place, you've found it. Special thanks to Javier, Manuel, Jesus, Daniel and Luis. If you find yourselves in Arizona, me casa es su casa! We stayed from 7/16 - 7/23. PS. John and Ginny, Tom and family and Steph and family, we thank you for the time spent and hope your travels home were safe.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: aureliep10
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Petit Lafitte as a couple from July 10th to 17th and that was great. First of all, we had such a wonderful weather, it didn't rain once during the day - we saw rain showers north and south but not there ! We booked a garden view bungalow, and I have to say that even if beach front bungalows are attractive because right on the beach- ours was at least 30 seconds walk - and it felt great when walking between coconut trees. Bungalow was awesome, food was great (Mojitos and Margaritas were far over great) and the beach was just perfect - calm and clean. For sure, if you're searching for a lot of activities, night shows and crowd, don't go there. But if your trip is about relaxing and spending great quality time don't hesitate. We would go back without hesitation. Thanks everyone for your warm welcome, we felt at home :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Staff were wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: jbmcgary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Petit Lafitte July 9 though July 16, 2011. We had decided to stay there after reading other TripAdvisor reviews. We arrived in the evening on our first night, but just in time for dinner at the hotel's restaurant. Meal was good and the service was excellent. The hotel is fairly small, only 55 rooms and 18 bungalows, and so it was very quiet and private during our entire stay. The hotel is right off the beach, and has its own private beach with chairs and palapas for guests. There is also a nice, and clean (the staff was cleaning it every morning) pool. The grounds were very well kept also. Beach was nice and clean, though the beach area directly in front of the hotel was rocky, so you had to walk about 50 yards north in order to swim, but not a big deal. Water was crystal clear and jade colored just as the photos suggest, and calm during our entire trip. The hotel is a bit deep off the main highway, but it is a quick (15 min) taxi ride into the heart of Playa Del Carmen (5th Avenue). My wife and I made the trip into town about 3-4 times without incident. David, the hotel concierge is excellent and a very very nice guy. I often found myself chatting him up when we ran into him. The wait staff and other hotel staff are all very friendly as well!! Even though most of the other guests during our stay spoke fluent Spanish, we were never treated second class. The only advice I would give, is book your excursions to the ruins or other sites through the hotel. We made the mistake of booking through a fly-by-night operation in Playa Del Carmen. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting an escape to a quiet, private resort. Thanks again to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here once, and you will always want to come back!!”
Reviews.Author: AdamS909
Reviews.Content: Stay here once, and you will always want to come back, seriously. My wife and I stayed in an ocean view bungaloo for 9 days the last week of October leading into November. From the airport, we were taken care of immediately and sent straight to the hotel. We arrived into a secluded jungle like area with smiles and ice cold tea. Check in was maybe 2 minutes, and within five our luggage was in our room, ac already on, and lounging at what I now consider the worlds best bar. The beach was excellent, and the water was perfect everyday. It is true you have to walk up the beach to get around the rocky part of the ocean directly infront of the hotel, but its honestly a 1 minute walk. It didnt bother us at all. Hotel Staff and Food: Every staff memeber knew my wife and I by name within two days, including the owner and chef! We aslo were engaged in conversation by the entire staff throughout the our trip. Not only would they set our trips up for us, something I would never let a hotel staff service normally do, but our trips to many of the ancient ruins were always ahead of the tour bus groups and considerably cheaper. Not to mention the locals driving us around took us to non-tourtisty locations for meals, etc. We also could not find anything to complain about whatsoever. I am incredibly picky, and my wife has a way about her too, but everything was terrific. Room cleaned everyday, showers were rustic but nice, and the beds were far better than most big name hotel chains. We even were given 6 liters of bottle water everyday at no extra charge. At one point in our trip, I even jokingly asked the owner if it would be possible to have some dark lager beer available at the bar during dinner one night, and by 8 am the next day, there was a case available. Food and Service: Cant beat it! We ate everywhere. Downtown Playa, in little back alley taco joints, food vendors, and big name resturants. We both concluded the food at Petite was just better. Something very homestyle about it, and very hearty. Breakfast had the best fruit, and a menu of options to choose from. Lunch and dinner were entirely different every day. However, there was a traditional selection that you could have whenever too. Try the Petite Tacos. Also, you could eat anywhere you like, on the beach, on your bungaloo patio, by the pool, you name it. Everyday we would have chips and salsa with a few beers in the afternoon on our patio. Actually, within two days, the staff would find us if we were on location, and asked if we wered ready for our mid-day snack. Amazing. Bar: One man in the whole world makes this place my favorite bar that I have ever experienced; Victor. This man makes the best Mojito I have ever tasted. And, he always has something interesting to talk about. Victor can make a whole group of strangers friends within just one night! Overall experience: As far as my wife and I are concerned, La Petit Lafitte is our Yucatacan homebase. If you like calm and refreshing, stay here. If you like mega hotels, with drunk frat boys and super crowded beaches then stay in Play Del Carmen's downtown hotels. Also, remember that the staff earns more of a living off of your tips then their hourly wage and they try very hard to help with your experience. I will upload pictures soon to give a better idea of the layout, but the photos on their website are very accurate. And yes, the water is that clear.There is so much more I can rant on about, including the animal preserve, and super fun staff, some fun with the locals during the "Day of the Dead" celebrations, a 2 hour walk home on the beach from playa or even visiting "off the beaten path" cenotes, but then I would ruin for you what my wife and I will always consider as one of the best times in our life!

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend this wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: hilary_almers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June. In spite of the occasional downpour, we loved our bungalow location on the beach and enjoyed swimming in the ocean. The resort is small, friendly and exceptionally well run. We were particularly impressed by the friendliness of all the staff. If you are looking for a relaxing and affordable vacation in a beautiful part of the Mayan Riviera, we would highly recommend Petit Lafitte.

Reviews.Title: “An intimate and fun place”
Reviews.Author: HighlandstoLowlands
Reviews.Content: My wife, our three year old son and I just spent a wonderful week at Petit Lafitte. We have traveled extensively in Latin America and the U.S., but never have felt as much of a bond to our fellow guests and the staff as we did at Petite Lafitte. The hotel has everything you need, but is small, intimate, and peaceful. A wonderful place -- we'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: trentvstone
Reviews.Content: Awesome service, delicious food, beautiful beach, fantastic massage ... highly recommended for a relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The best service I've ever recieved - attention to detail was supurb!”
Reviews.Author: ekkloke
Reviews.Content: We went to Petit Lafitte over Memorial Day Weekend to attend our friends wedding. It was absolutely one of the best vacations we've ever taken. Now, this property is not the newest, most up-to-date & state-of-the-art property in all of Playa. If that is what is most important to you, then you might want to move along. The accommodations were nice, comfortable, etc - but that wasn't why we went. With less then 50 rooms, you literally trip out of your room and land on the beach. A non-crowded beach.. because you're not competing for space with 800 other people. You can see & smell the ocean right from the deck & bar while eating the most amazing fish taco's i've ever had! And, just ask for a mojito - after 1 hour, the bar-tender not only remembered our names & room numbers - but knew exactly what we were drinking and had it whipped up in 2 minutes. The food is another factor that can't be over-looked. The room rate includes breakfast & dinner each day, and they do NOT skimp on the food.. it was amazing. Breakfast each morning includes about a dozen various choices.. along with fruit, yougurt & cereal included in a buffet. Dinner was also a various selection on entrees.. and the service was fantastic. Spa services were great - I had the best massage of my life by "Bertha" right on the beach, and then we stepped over to the water sports center to set up a snorkeling trip. We had a blast! If you're looking for a small resort where you'll feel important & appreciated, and want to relax with a book (or iPad - they have wireless!) on the beach, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: MikeRosckesAnderson
Reviews.Content: Petit Lafitte was the site of our wedding weekend (April 28 - May 1). We had a total of 65 guests at the wedding, and all but four of them stayed at Petit. Of the 60+ that did stay there, the general consensus was pretty much "you couldn't really ask for much better". There isn't much new we can add to the reviews - they are all pretty accurate. The staff is phenomenal, the food is great, the place is nice, and it's affordable. If you're looking for a place to get married, we highly recommend Petit Lafitte. Their attention to detail was outstanding - nothing was left out. They went out of their way to make sure everything was what we asked for. We really couldn't have asked for more. We found it to be a bonus that since we rented out a majority of the rooms, the hotel closed off the remaining vacant rooms. Thus, the resort was essentially ours. This created a really great vibe for the weekend and also made the wedding day more special, as there were no other weddings to compete with (as is often the case with big, all-inclusive resorts). The day after the wedding we moved to more "posh" resort a few hundred yards down the beach for a few days of post wedding R&R. We missed the staff, sopes, guacamole, and margaritas so much that we went back there for lunch both days. This hotel isn't for everyone - if you're in to the swank, hipster places, try elsewhere. However, if you're looking for a very laid back, intimate setting with a wonderful staff, solid cuisine, decent rooms, and a fantastic piece of beach, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Audrey18915
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a place for a totally relaxing break from what had been a very hectic and stressful period of time. Friends of ours have been coming to this resort (and it's previous incarnations) for many years and always raved about it. We wanted quiet and natural beauty, but we also wanted air conditioning and access to the town of Playa del Carmen for evening strolls. We had stayed at some of the mega-resorts in the area and while those were fun, they were definitely not what we were looking for this time. Our time at Petit Lafitte truly was absolute heaven. The service is superb. We had a late flight into Cancun and didn't arrive at the hotel until almost 10, but the kitchen prepared and saved individual dinners for us. The food at all meals was delicious. The mixed seafood ceviche was a perfect lunch. We stayed in bungalow #4 which was wonderful. Totally clean, comfortable bed, nice bathroom and shower, coffee maker for that first cup on our porch before breakfast, and then stepping off the porch directly onto the sand....Ahhhhhh. Beautiful beach for great swimming, great walks, reading and naps. Definitely visit the zoo. Lots of pretty birds and local animals. Once we find some place we love, we tend to go back again and again. Definitely the case with Petit Lafitte.

Reviews.Title: “Read This, Not That! - Best resort in Playa Del Carmen.”
Reviews.Author: nottabox
Reviews.Content: WOW! I’m not sure where to start. This little resort will have you wanting more even before you leave. It’s been just over a week since we have been there and we are already thinking about our return trip. I will try and break this down in to sections so it’s easier to under stand. Location: Petit Lefitte is just a few minutes North of Playa Del Carmen. There’s a good reason for this. The beaches here are fantastic. The closer you get to Playa Del Carmen the beaches are more crowded and well… not as nice. The only reason to go to town is to enjoy the Club scene or to do some shopping. I’m sure you could walk to the neighboring hotel and take in some shopping and dancing as well. Amenities: Beach – Yes, It’s fantastic! Some of the better snorkeling spots we visited were right in front of the Hotel. Check out Google Maps/Earth. You will see a Moon shaped looking formation in the water. That’s the one. Just a few steps in to the water and you will see some great fish. Food – Some of the best I have ever had. I can say without a doubt I am a picky eater. Everything I ate, I loved. The presentation, the portions, the service and the atmosphere were all top notch. The staff was attentive to our every need. They cooked special food for our six year old daughter every night. They were even willing to provide alternative dietary menus for some folks we met while staying at the hotel as well. Drinks – Oh yes! They definitely have those. Just ask Jesus or anyone else at the bar and they will take care of you. They serve some of the best Alcoholic and Non-Alcoholic drinks around. Hotel – We stayed in one of the Bungalows right off the beach. Yes, they are rustic. No there is not a T.V. in the bungalow units. But, how often are you in the room anyway? Most of the time we were on the front porch, in the hammocks, by the pool, at the bar, or eating some great food. Are you thinking about staying in one the Bungalows? All of them are great. Looking to stay close to the beach? Then choose: Ocean Front #9 or Ocean View #3,4,10 or 11. – The main hotel is great. Looking for easy walkways and wonderful rooms. Then choose any of the Ocean Front or Ocean View rooms. I would highly recommend these to anyone who is looking for easy mobility. We met a wonderful couple in there 70’s who have been returning customers for many years and they come back annually. Actually, quite a few people we met had been returning patrons from years past. This really shows the quality of the staff, location, service and more. Massage – Worth it. As a middle-aged male, I am not the typical person that seeks out a “good massage”. I have had a couple through the years and this one was by far the best I have ever had. You are right on the beach, listening to the ocean in the background, no loud music or any other disturbances to be heard. I would highly recommend it. Misc – Don’t miss out on the small merchant on the edge of the hotel near the beach. He sells some wonderful pottery. You can also paint your own and he will glaze and fire it and have it ready for you the next day. Great for kids! Other things you may want to know? Should I rent a car? – No! If you are not use to driving in a foreign country then don’t do it. We rented a car and driving wasn’t the biggest issue. It was the overall use. We planned to visit downtown Playa many times and we never did. The hotel and the amenities nearby took care of most of our needs. Taxis are not that expensive. The hotel has some great folks they can call. The taxis are willing to stay with you the entire day and take you anywhere you want to go. Places to visit: Xcaret – Do you have young children? Do you want to visit an exotic zoo? Then go. We purchased the Plus Package with the Dolphin swim. Overall, it was nice. Would I do it again? No. The park itself is huge. It’s a great place to snorkel, swim and see some wildlife. Don’t expect more than that. We were told the “show” in the evening is really spectacular. A few people at the hotel had said go to the “show” and not the park. Hidden Worlds – Like extreme adventure? This is the place for you. Zip Lines, Rappelling, cave snorkeling in the senotes and more. Our six year old went on almost every adventure with us. However, She was not big enough for the “Avatar”. But, Don’t forget to tip the staff. I will write a review about this under the Hidden worlds forum. Akumal – Hidden gem of a city. Go and snorkel the bay. It’s free! Sea Turtles, Stingrays, and some really colorful fish. All ages can go here. Light waves in the bay and shallow water make it perfect. Great restaurants are located throughout. One in particular is La Buena Vida. It has indoor and outdoor seating with fantastic views. Coba – Mayan ruins you can actually touch. Prepare to spend the entire day here. We were unable to make it this trip. However, the reports were fantastic. Tulum Ruins – Great ocean views, spectacular settings. It’s a great place to capture some breathtaking photos. Go early and bring your bathing suit. There’s a great beach here. There are some stairs leading to the beach (so be warned). I spoke with several couples on the trip home. Most of them repeated similar horror stories of their stays at other resorts. The one that stuck in my mind was having to wake up early every morning, go down and claim a chair on the beach. This was the only way they had a place to put their stuff while they “enjoyed” the beach in from of their hotel. Go and enjoy. We miss it already. Thank you Petit Lefitte staff. We hope to see you again soon. J. M. and T.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SaskatoonGreg
Reviews.Content: If you are a diver the Cyan Ha Dive Center is where they treat you right.Good boats and drivers and excellent dive masters that are totally professional.Petit Lafitte is a little gem that gives everyone that special friendly downhome feel.After a short time they knew my wife and my first name.We loved how laid back and it was never crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfull”
Reviews.Author: johnria
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully intimate hotel to get away from it all. Great service by an experienced staff. Great menu choices served at the table instead of a cafeteria line. Located directly at the beach. Relaxed atmosphere compared to the enormous human wharehouses and their obliigatory noise from motivators, which continues late into the night. This hotel is very clean in all phases. We hilghly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxed vacation at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great experience, specially for the service.”
Reviews.Author: paulinaleija
Reviews.Content: The waiters and bell boys are adorable! The rooms are very confortable, they have exactly what you need. The location is a little hidden, but that gives you more privacity. I love the violinist that amenities wednesday dinner. Waht I like the best, I mean I LOVED the coock!!! I love the least the shampoo, I needed a little more conditioning one.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: mavgirl17
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the perfect vacation spot that makes you feel like you are staying with some really good friends that cook excellent food and make great drinks, then look no further! The staff is so nice and friendly, you feel more like family than a guest. I can't say enough good things about my experience at Petit Lafitte. This will be my permanent destination in Playa from now on. I've been to many places in Mexico and this was truly the friendliest and safest place I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Mexico's best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: kathy0004
Reviews.Content: This was by far my favourite place in Mexico (and I have been there many many times!). Everything about the Petit Lafitte is just exceptional! The resort is small, but cozy and clean. The hotel rooms are great (especially the ocean view premiums), and the bungalows are even better! The beach in front of the hotel is just beautiful. It's a quiet resort for these looking to unwind. There are fun small waves for those who want to do some water activities. You can lay on the hamocs on the beach or have lunch just feet from the water. The service is unbelievable; the staff addresses you by a first name basis all the time. The concierge David is one of the nicest people I have ever met! Very sweet and knowledgeable! Also, Javier and Manuel would always go out of their way for you! Guillermo was really sweet as he greeted you every evening for dinner with a huge and genuine smile. The food is delicious and affordable!! My husband is a fussy eater and loved everything on the menu! I give this hotel a 10/10 and we will be going back in a few months! Keep up the good work Petit Lafitte team!

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, excellent food, good laughs and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: raether
Reviews.Content: Can't ask for more than that. The service was very helpful. I miss the food so much. They have the best cooks!!!!! Very nice resort! Quiet beach. If you don't want the city action this is the perfect place. I was there for a wedding. It was the most beautiful thing I have ever seen. The employees work very hard to satisify your every need. Next time I would like to try their bungalows. I saw the inside of one and they looked very nice and comfy!! I can't say enough nice things about this hotel. I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: ““The most wonderful place in Mexico””
Reviews.Author: Denise155043
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding here and it was more than anything we could have imagined. The staff, especially the Manager Ivan and his Cousin Mamos, went above and beyond to make sure everything was exactly what we wanted. If you are looking for a destination wedding where you still feel special, where they will only have your wedding on your day this is the place for you. We had around 20 people attend and everyone was so very happy at our choice of Petit and all said they will return again and could not say enough about the great food - the best lime soup and coconut chicken you have ever had!!. They work with a wonderful Wedding Planner, Manuela who owns Paradise Weddings in Mexico, she made sure that I had exactly what I wanted and made great suggestions regarding the flowers, cake and food which all turned out to be ideal choices. She is extremely knowledgable and helpful and was there with her daughter Paulina the entire day and evening of the wedding to make sure everything was exactly what we wanted and giving us direction, even bringing our flowers and boutineers and guiding us when to walk out the to beautiful arch she had decorated just steps from the tourqouis ocean. All the guests that were staying at the hotel said they really enjoyed watching our wedding and reception.. This is the perfect place to relax, right on the beautiful Caribbean Ocean - just steps from your bungalow; where the staff know your name and always have a smile and cannot do enough for you. We will never stay at another all inclusive now that we have been to Petit Lafitte and cannot wait to return here - wish we were still there!!

Reviews.Title: “So relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: ImOV66
Reviews.Content: Ahhhhh, a wonderful week spent relaxing and reconnecting with my hubby. PL is a quiet, calm and beautiful place to spend hours in a hammock or by the pool reading and resting. You can walk for miles on the flour white beach but unfortunately the entire coastline is populated by the plastic and mammoth all-inclusive resorts which have hundreds (if not thousands) of beach chairs lined up elbow to elbow. The "town" of Playa del Carmen is now populated by almost 300,000 people -- it is no longer a fun, funky town but just a smaller version of tacky, noisy Cancun. Somehow PL has managed to carve out the last little bit of quiet seclusion between Cancun and Playa del Carmen. The staff is amazing...they work so very hard all day making sure everything is clean and comfortable. The food was fresh and delicious; varying between small buffets and personal table service. Breakfast was always my favorite because of the plentiful fresh fruit. Dinner included great soups, salad selections and a nightly choice of 2 entrees which included fish, chicken, beef or pasta. We never had a meal that we didn't enjoy. Bar & lunch aren't included in your room price, but both are inexpensive...the drinks are smooth and lunch is plentiful...couldn't get enough of the chips, guac and fresh salsa. We had an Ocean View bungalow which was clean, comfortable and spacious. Plenty of bottled water is provided each day and there is a small fridge stocked with sodas, juice and a candybar or two. There is free Wi-Fi on site but I had no desire to "check-in" with reality...isn't that the point of vacation? There is a dive center on-site which offers snorkeling trips and full-service diving and certifications. Inexpensive massages are a-plenty up and down the beach, but PL has a lovely little palapa right on the beach and an hour massage was only $40...it was the perfect way to start our vacation and helped the relaxation seep in quickly. By 9:00 each night we returned to our bungalow having exhaused ourselves with daily activites such as holding down a hammock and a beach chair, soaking up the sun, swimming in the ocean and taking long walks on the beach to find just the perfect seashell. A lovely, lovely vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Heaven....”
Reviews.Author: hastingsmom
Reviews.Content: I am almost afraid to write this, as Petit Lafitte is such an intimate and special place nestled on a beautiful beach that has much larger more impersonal resorts scattered around it and I feel as though it is a hidden treasure. We truly felt like we were on vacation... away from electronics and the hustle and bustle. The bungalows and other buildings are right on the beach so you can always feel the wonderful sea breezes and only have to walk a few steps to your lounge chair (under thatched umbrellas). The staff was so welcoming, friendly and accomodating. Our kids are vegetarians and on the first night of our stay the owner arranged for the kitchen to have vegetarian options for them, which they did quite happily, even asking our kids what kind of dishes they like. Our meals were all fresh and very good. The bar had a lovely patio area on the beach and you could get drinks and food throughout the day. At some point during our stay my husband and kids rented a sailboat from another resort up the beach (and saw two sea turtles while they were sailing), so if you want to take advantage of different offerings they are out there. Mostly though, it was heaven to be in such a beautiful setting with such a warm and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxation with perfect service”
Reviews.Author: jenglandtoyman
Reviews.Content: A great getaway spot could have been the alternate title. Our room was perfect, the beach was great, the food very good, in fact every facet of the stay was truly remarkable. But what really sets this place apart and made the week so enjoyable is the level of service. The staff really go out of their way to make you feel like they are there for you personally. This was a quality and genuiness of service normally reserved for very exclusive places. It is quiet, it has a rustic feel of elegance to the bungalows and it is totally uncrowded. Plenty of beach, pool, whatever, to go around for the guest relaxing there. Plenty of staff to take care of everybody too. The location is very close to Playa so it is convenient to get to town or attractions down the coast if you have a car. It is far enough from Playa so that the beach is not crowded and there is good swimming just feet from the lounge chairs. Beautiful beach and beautiful water without the crowds of town or the large resorts. That's why we will go back again sometime. If you can't do without TV, phones, and chaos go somewhere else but if you want to really unwind this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet resort on a beautiful beach with great staff, personal service and great food.”
Reviews.Author: debonweb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Petit Lafitte from March 19 to April 2, 2011 and would highly recommend this resort for retired people, families, couples or anyone looking for a quiet resort on a beautiful beach. What really made the difference for us was the staff and the personal service. Staff made every attempt to learn our names and went out of their way to provide whatever we needed during out stay. The food was excellent. Breakfast and dinner were included. Breakfasts included a selection of fresh fruit, yogurt and cereals as well as hot entrees including mayan omelets, heuvos rancheros and numerous other hot entrees-we had them all over the 2 weeks and they were delicious. Dinners rotate on a 2 week plan so we never had the same thing twice. There was soup and salad bar every night and usually a selection of 2 entrees to choose from that arrived piping hot to your table every night. There were also a selection of deserts every night or you could have ice cream. At lunch time they do serve a variety of sandwiches and burgers as well as mexican food which were very good. Our favorite lunch was ceviche with their complimentary torilla chips served with a garlic sauce and pico de gaillo. They have a small pool with ample shade and lounge chairs. There are about 10 palapas on the beach and lots of lounge chairs. We were usually able to find shade somewhere. As well there are 4 hammocks on their beach. The beach directly in front of the hotel is rocky but just to the north of the hotel is a beautiful sandy beach that my kids spent hours playing in. There is a small library with a pool table and ping pong table as well. Staff did lend us boogie boards as well. There is a zoo behind the hotel that is worth a visit. There is a masseuse who charges $40US for a 1 hour massage-well worth it. They have musicians play at dinner time 2 nights a week- I enjoyed both but particularly enjoyed the electric guitar/violin duet. The rooms were basic but a good size and fairly comfortable. We stayed in the hotel part-but there are several gungalows on the beach as well. The hotel is quite a walk from the highway. We rented a car and would recommend it if you plan on visiting the area. It was easy to find your way around. Our only glitch was getting ripped off at the Pemex gas station on 307 next to the Coca-cola plant. They created a diversion and distracted us then switched pesos on us-this resulted in us losing 200 pesos in the transaction. This is a fairly common scam that we had been aware of but they still got us. We would recommend taking the pesos out and saying exactly how many pesos worth of gas you want and stating clearly how many pesos you are handing over in the transaction. As well if someone could film the transaction I would recommend that as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, small hotel on gorgeous swimming beach”
Reviews.Author: tboy2000
Reviews.Content: PL is a small quiet hotel right on the beach. Plenty of lounge chairs on the beautiful beach with excellent swimming. Our beachfront room was only a few steps from the beach, no room is more than maybe 100 yards from the beach. It was not luxurious but spacious and fine with a small refrigerator and good shower. They also have a nice pool. The food (breakfast and dinner included) was good but not great. It was prepared fresh, no chafing dishes reheating food like at big resorts. The dining room is an open air pavilion. Lunch was available at tables overlooking the beach. Our room was near the small bar by the beach which was empty by 10:00 so no problem with noise at night. Service throughout the hotel is excellent and personal. Its a 10 minute drive to the town, a place that is swarming with shops and tourists. We rented a car in Cancun and drove to the hotel, an easy 45 minute drive. There was not much to do at the hotel other than it being an excellent place to relax and walk along the miles of beach There are places down the beach which offer the usual beach diversions.We used the car to drive into Playa del Carmen and Puerto Morelos, and for excursions to Chichen Itza (a 3 hour drive), and the ferries to Isla Mujeres and Cozumel, so on alternate days we relaxed at the hotel or did some excursion. There were several families there with small children who played very nicely without disturbing the adult guests. All in all the hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: SunandFun63
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a week long stay at Petit Lafitte. We stayed in an ocean view room and woke up to an amazing view of the beach. The staff is incredibly helpful and dedicated to great service. There were several families and couples staying at the hotel. The food is good -- though I would prefer more traditional Mexican dishes on the lunch and dinner menu. The beach is quiet and very clean. There is a popular swimming spot only 100 yds away. I cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect, as it always has been”
Reviews.Author: Michael643
Reviews.Content: Petit Lafitte, the successor to Posada del Capitan Lafitte, retains the laid back simplicity of it's predecessor. Even though the area's changed radically since my wife and I first visited there 22 years ago (Playa del Carmen was a tiny village, now it's a city of 50,000 plus), the beach is still magnificent and the owners have managed to insulate guests from the hubbub of the large hotels in the area. Dressing for dinner means putting on a shirt, and everyone is friendly. Staff is fantastic, and, as a testament to the owners, many staffers have been around for years (David the manager was the bartender in the 90's). The newly built rooms are great, and everything is clean and elegant, without being stuffy or pretentious at all. Foodnis good and plentiful Love it, just the way we did years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit Lafitte March 29 2011”
Reviews.Author: Steven630
Reviews.Content: My wife and I experienced Mexico Playa Del Carmen for the very first time. After browsing Trip Advisor we stumble on the Petit Lafitte. The great reviews and the quietness was what we were looking for… I can tell you that you will not be disappointed. We stayed in a ocean view bungalow. It was nice, clean and cozy. Loved the fact that there were no televisions. Reading and relaxation is what you get. It’s quiet and small enough that you are overwhelmed by too many patrons. There are ample chairs at the beach and enough distances between Le Petit Lafitte and those monstrous resorts. The staff is superb, I give them A+… David, Javier, Geovanni, Jesus and the other 2 I cannot remember their names will bend backward to insure your every request I met. They made me a special dinner meal on my last night because I don’t eat seafood’s. I will definitely return there and hope to see the same staff. David speaks 7 or 8 different language. English, French, Spanish, Dutch, Mayan. I can go on and on. The night meals were very diverse and never repeated themselves in the 6 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Chillaxation”
Reviews.Author: neighborguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week at Petit Lafitte for the first time at the end of February/beginning of March. Having been to a several all-inclusive resorts by now, I wanted to be in the Mayan Riviera with it's draws (great weather, the carribean sea, white sand, easy access from Toronto) but not the other elements found at the mega resorts (crowds, line-ups, excessive menu choices, low-quality beverages, noise.) I'd looked to TripAdvisor for recs for a winter holiday and reviews were consistent and in-line with what I was looking for. The PL seemed like an ideal option. This would be the first time not doing an AI vacation so there would be a bit more organizing to be done (researching flights, transfers, etc) but it turned out to be not much effort at all. My experience was spot-on with most reported here. ALL service personnel were friendly, attentive and kind people. Accommodations were charming, clean and there was definitely nothing lacking. We stayed in a gardenview bungalow and it was really quiet. The breakfasts and dinners were absolutely delicious and thoughtfully prepared and presented – over the seven nights of dinners I did not see a single salad repeated amongst the generous variety served. Mexican night was my favorite. Lunch (not included in the room rate but reasonable) was a pleasant experience given the quality of the food, drink and beachfront setting. There’s a modest pool and beachfront with plenty of loungers for everyone, so no jockeying for space or planning your day around getting a towel down early enough in the morning. That said getting up to watch the sunrise made for one of the best parts of the day sitting on the beach deck enjoying coffee with fellow early birds. The other guests were friendly and chilled-out, whether they’d been coming here for twenty years or new visitors. Seniors, couples, and young families with children all were part of the gang. Other info that may be worth repeating: Walking along the beach to Playa del Carmen in the early morning (taking about an hour and half) made for a great self-made excursion. Interesting to pass the massive property developments along the way as well as what's left of undeveloped tracts of beachfront. Cab rides back from PdC weren't complicated as most taxi drivers know where the hotel is, and if not would know the Princess resort which is the same turn off the highway. Rates are fixed. Didn’t make it to the zoo until the last day and should have gone sooner. The true value of the Petit Lafitte is its simplicity. Whether you were in the three-storey building or one of the bungalows the beach was no further than a minute away. There is not much to do here other than to rest, relax, and restore. With no TV and noise at night bedtime was usually by 9pm and lots of people were out at the beach for sunrise. Nine to ten hour sleeps... This is on top of the siestas after a full day at the playa before dinner. Looking forward to seeing our new friends next year at this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, & relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: lawyer_mom
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from a six night stay at Petit Lafitte. The wonderful things that earlier reviewers have said about the hotel are true. The staff make you feel at home ... and so do the other guests. We met people who had been coming to Lafitte for 23 years! The hotel staff was extremely helpful -- David coordinated all of our excursions for us, and even packed us breakfast-to-go on a day we had to leave early. There are a few negatives to the hotel that I think I should mention. It's location -- it is far from the road and so you cannot easily walk to catch the bus. But we got taxis through the hotel, and so met some wonderful people in our drivers. One of the drivers stayed with us for the entire day -- driving us to Coba, a cenote, and Tulum. He was related to one of the owners of Petit, and had great stories to tell -- especially about the zoo there. The beach right in front of the hotel is very rocky. But you just walk to the left and you hit a sandy section. There isn't a whole lot to do on the beach other than lay there, drink, and get burned. So what's wrong with that? I fear that my two teenagers would have gotten bored had we done that for more than a day and 1/2. So we did a lot of excursions -- to the ruins, Xel Ha, Xcaret. I don't want to just repeat what earlier reviewers said. So I'll just add that we plan on returning to Petit Lafitte.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: jgphilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and two boys (ages 2 and 4) just returned from a 6 night stay at PL. We chose this hotel based upon the great reviews on TripAdvisor. My husbad and I have also stayed at what used to be called ShangriLa Caribe (now called Mahekal Beach Resort) which is owned by the same company, so we sort of knew what to expect from the place. We had a really great time and felt the resort worked out very well for our family. The best part about the resort, in my opinion, was actually the other people staying there. Several other families with young children were at PL at the same as we were, so the kids all made fast friends and the adults got to know one another and hung out together quite a lot. By the end of the trip, we were all sitting together at large tables at dinner. It was great. Even those staying at PL who did not have kids were all so friendly. I'm certain I've never met so many people on a vacation before. The kids all loved the zoo as well. We took our boys over once in the morning and again in the afternoon. Bring bug spray! I agree with all the other reviewers that the staff was quite nice (a few waiters weren't as friendly and outgoing as I expected, but that's ok) and the food was very good. We ate lunch at the resort every day and asked for variations on some things they had on the menu. They were happy to oblige. A few things: If you decide to rent a car, be aware that the insurance costs are not included in the rates that you get when you go to the car rental companyies' web sites. This additional cost almost doubles the rate you get online. Be very clear what insurance your credit card provides before showing up at the agency. We rented a car partly because we were uneasy about the fact that the shuttle only had a carseat for our 2 year old but not our 4 year old. Turned out that the carseats provided by Dollar in our rental car were an absolute joke. If that is something you are a stickler about, you'll want to bring your own. If you do rent a car, there is a Walmart in Playa where you can pick up anything you need. There is a small fridge in the bungalows with some room for beer or juiceboxes, etc. so that really comes in handy. If you think you'll mainly stay at the resort, just pay for the shuttle. The car rental is not worth it. Bring sippy cups if traveling with young children. The resort did not have lids for cups so it was good we had a few with us. PL gives you all the bottled water you need and you can get apple juice or orange juice at the bar all day long. The massage therapists were offering a special of two one-hour massages for $80. My husband and I took advantage of this and were not disappointed. There is a little cabana right on the beach where they do the massages. So nice!! You pay the women directly in US dollars. The reviews on this site for Petite Lafitte are very accurate. We had a great stay and will seriously consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “A true paradise”
Reviews.Author: frmolinek
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights. Had a fabulous time. The staff make this a special place, they are friendly, helpful, and truly seem to enjoy what they do. It is a calm and relaxing oasis.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fantastic: small, quiet, superb food, amazing service, and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Davis
Reviews.Content: We really wanted a quiet and nice resort – we found that in Petite Lafitte! The hotel was tiny compared to most Playa Del Carmen resorts (just 46 rooms) but we found it to be an absolutely perfect size –all the rooms are a twenty second walk to the beach (or, better yet, ten second walk to the bar). The most important thing to know about this hotel is that the service was top notch! The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly (and fluent in English). The food was absolutely fantastic! Breakfast and dinner are included in the price – breakfast was a buffet of fruit, some cereal, then a full menu of mostly Mexican breakfast items (all were delicious). Dinner consisted of a soup and salad bar, a selection of a main course (which varied each night), and dessert. As an extra bonus, they were easily able to accommodate my wife’s gluten intolerance – the concierge made a point to find her every morning to work out any menu modifications that might be necessary to remove flour. Most of the food did not contain flour, but if it did (typically in the soups or sauces) they offered to make up a special dish for her as a substitute. Lunch and drinks were not included, but both were available for a very reasonable price from the poolside/beachside bar. The drinks were all made with top shelf liquor…no watered down all-inclusive drinks here (the margaritas are really worth it!). The rooms are simple and basic, but still very comfortable and spacious with a firm bed, mini fridge, desk, dresser, window AC unit in the wall, ceiling fan, and TV. The rooms were a bit dim, as they were primarily lit by the sliding glass door leading to the porch. Views were primarily of the bar and pool area below. The water at the hotel is not filtered (not terribly surprising) but each room is stocked with 1.5L bottles of water (free of charge). The hotel has wifi, but the only way we could connect in our room was out on the porch (signal was too weak). There were two PCs in the "lobby" that were available for use (but no printer). The hotel has a small pool with a dozen chairs surrounding it. By the bungalows, there are numerous hammocks for relaxing and plenty of beachfront chairs. The beach was deserted – there was no need to jockey for chairs with an umbrella as there were plenty to go around and more chairs than people. The hotel is far enough from the main part of Playa that there are no beach vendors hassling you to get hair braids or pet an iguana; and the nearest other hotels are far enough away that the beach feels relatively private and secluded. As far as ocean swimming is concerned, there’s some exposed coral in front of the hotel which prevents swimming, but just down the beach a few hundred feet is a fine stretch of sand to swim on. We opted to rent a car and drive (since the cost was similar to an airport shuttle) and the hotel had ample parking on site. We thought we’d want to drive into Playa for lunch from time to time but found that eating at the bar was far more pleasant. Petite Lafitte is not for everyone. If you’re looking for a large resort with lots of activities going on then this isn’t it. If, instead, you’re looking for a quiet place to go with a family or a loved one to relax then look no farther!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place near Playa”
Reviews.Author: daver328
Reviews.Content: Great Place near Playa Del Carmen. The service is wonderful. The employees are truly a great bunch of folks. We stayed four nights last week on a spontaneous getaway. While basic, the rooms are clean and in good order. There is a stocked mini refrigerator and all the bottled water you can drink. Wireless internet is included. Each room although "poolside" or garden has a nice balcony and partial view of the ocean. The beach area is nice and we felt more at home there than we would have in the larger resort beach areas we walked past during our daily walks. Our rate included breakfast and dinner. Both meals were way beyond our expectations! If you rent a car, the map on their website is more than ailed detenough to get you there. (I don't recommend renting a car in Cancun) Playa is too far to walk ... so you will need to drive or a taxi to go into Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Our family in paradise”
Reviews.Author: northnodejudy
Reviews.Content: Each year in frigid February, my husband and I spend about two weeks at Petit Lafitte hotel north of Playa Del Carmen. Each year we are welcomed back by the courteous, sweet and cheerful staff-- the waiters, bartenders, housekeepers and primo chef make this trip feel like we are coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: Okiebanker86
Reviews.Content: What stood out to me the most about Petit Lafitte was the staff. They went out of their way to make our trip the best it could possibly be. The attention given by the friendly workers is at a different level than any other resort in which I have stayed. The food is incredible, the accomodations are wonderful, and the beach is immaculate. We cannot wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “A little peice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Nicole155019
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this quiet little gem of a hotel in Playa del Carmen. My husband and I were in need of some R & R and really did not want to be in the heart of Play del Carmen as we really just wanted to relax afterall so we opted to try Capitan Lafitte. We were pleased that this was a very private hotel that was not inundated with too many guests, and was situated right on the beach. Service was excellent! we were greeted by Eduardo who was extremely helpful and gave us a walkaround tour of the hotel and as our room was not ready we wereseated near the beach for a lovely lunch. The food was outstanding! all so fresh and variable and the Wait Staff were excellent. Everyone was so friendly and accomodating that we will not hesitate in going back again. The rooms are spacious and clean and include all major amenities. Best 4 days vacation for us thus far and well worth the money. Thanks again to all the staff at Petite Lafitte we had a wonderful time. -Nicole & Yassine-

Reviews.Title: “Simplicity, Tranquility on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: pablo_a2
Reviews.Content: I’m one of those people who came to Petit Lafitte after having been to the original Capitan Lafitte many times over the years. The original held so much charm and originality that I was worried that my expectations would be too high; they weren’t. Petit Lafitte is a magical slice of a simple paradise on a beach that is fast becoming home to many mega resorts. Here at Lafitte’s you will not find jet skis, hundreds of lounge chairs nor will you find pesky wrist bands to identify you amongst the literally thousands of guests. No, here you will be at home; one of the family. Lafitte’s is not going to be for everybody, but if you value a paradise that is relaxed, unassuming and personal then you might very well have found your next Mexican vacation destination. Upon arrival I was amazed that even after 7 years the staff remembered me; this is the kind of personal touch you can expect here. Here, the staff wants to know you, where you’re from and more about you than just whether or not you want salt on your margarita. If you wish quiet anonymity you can have it but trust me, the staff here is wonderful. The main resort features a smallish three-story hotel that looks charming, white against the Caribbean blue skies. This area is also home to a sparkling pool that’s surrounded by a lush garden. Here in the central courtyard you’ll find the restaurant area serving breakfast and dinner each day, more about that in a bit. At the far end of the courtyard, near the beach is a quaint little bar where you can mingle with other guests as well as enjoy the best margaritas in Mexico. The other side of the resort is the cabana section; here a growing number of private and simple cabanas begin at the beach and continue around to face a garden area. Currently there are 18 cabanas but there are still a few under construction. We stayed here and I will say that it was peaceful and charming. The cabanas themselves are fairly basic, wood construction with either two double beds or one king (we chose the king) our cabana also had a loft area with an additional bed. The cabana was clean, simple and a great place to come home to each evening. Days start at Lafitte with breakfast, and they should not be missed. There is always a buffet of fresh fruits, yogurt, pastries, a tasty granola mix and freshly squeezed orange juice. If that isn’t enough, by all means count on one of the breakfast entrees on the menu; the molletas, omelets and yes the French toast are personal favorites. Don’t forget to linger with a cup of coffee while you let your day begin slowly. Afterwards, make your way to the beach to savor the crystal clear waters of the Caribbean. There is an area with a sandy bottom perfect for splashing around in the warm water or if you’d like, there are areas with coral that will allow limited snorkeling as well. Either way, when you step out of the sea you will have your choice of reclining on a beach chair in the open sun or one of the palaps on the beach. Don’t overlook the hammocks that are available as well, very comfy, perfect places for a nap. Since lunch is not included in the room rate, you can either order something from the bar, which offers a great variety of Mexican dishes or you can take a car or taxi into Playa del Carmen and try out one of the many restaurants there. As the sun begins to set you’ll likely find many of the guests gravitating to the bar area for those amazing margaritas, ice-cold cervecas or even a surprisingly good glass of vino blanco. Whatever your taste in libation, Victor of Jesus will be sure that you’re happy. After a cocktail, its back to the dining area to savor the amazing cuisine that is native to this area. The food in a word is fabulous. You will be treated to homemade soups and salads as a first course followed by a selection of either of two dinner entrees along with dessert. Prepare to enjoy and savor dinner as you look out from under the thatched roof at picture perfect evenings. As I said in the beginning, this isn’t a mega resort; there isn’t a casino, nightclub, disco or any other distraction that would intrude upon the perfect simplicity of your Mexican holiday. After dinner, let your evening wind down with one last margarita before returning the tranquility of your cabana or room, savoring the rhythmic sound of the sea. In the end Petit Lafitte not only met our expectations but exceed them as well. The resort is an ideal getaway, tranquil and relaxing; the staff is wonderful, very friendly and genuine (bear in mind that some of the staff has been here for over 20 years); and the people you meet here, we had great conversations with people from other snowy locales like Minnesota and Pennsylvania as well as from New Mexico, Montana and Washington DC; the common denominator is that they are all here because they seek a tranquil paradise and at Petit Laffite they’ve found it! Chances are if you seek something different, someplace special that will feel like home you’ll enjoy it too.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return to Petit Lafitte!”
Reviews.Author: elder1923
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5-night stay at Petit Lafitte. We specifically booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. We were not dissapointed! All the previous reviews are right on. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. We stayed in one of the hotel rooms, a garden view king room on the third floor. We had a nice view of the pool and we even had a sliver of view of the sea. Like other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are VERY basic, but clean and functional. The finishes could use some updating, but for the price we paid we feel the rooms were just fine. The price of your stay includes all the bottled water you want. The rooms also have a coffee maker, and free wifi. The wifi was functional and fast the throughout our stay. Besides the room, everything else exceeded our expectations. The staff did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable, and they did a fantastic job. They were accomodating in every way.
