Breakfast and dinner were included in the price of our stay, and they were very good. We looked forward to each meal. There was consistently good variety. Lunch was not included but we ate lunch just about every day at the seaside bar and grill. The fish tacos were out of this world. I don't think they were on the menu but order them anyway. Javier will be happy to accomodate. The beach here is quiet and absolutely perfect. There was good swimming and snorkeling right off the beach. Wy wife and I also both got messages right there on the beach, and I would highly recommend this as well! We also made some new friends both with some of the guests and the staff. There's a very intimate feel to this place and you'll quickly make new friends with other guests. Overall, I can't say enough about this great little resort. If you're looking to get away and enjoy quiet time at the beach, great food and drinks (awesome mojitos!), and getting to know some new folks, this is the place. We left our work and kids behind and went to Petit for a few days, and were able to completely unwind and rejuvinate.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: scampbell33
Reviews.Content: This hotel really was a great find. We just returned from our stay there and would definitely go back. We spent a lot of time walking for hours up and down the beach and I can honestly say we think we found the best hotel that met our needs. Most of the reviews I've seen for this hotel are correct. The location is great- close, but not too close to everything. The staff was awesome, food was good, beach was beautiful and not too crowded at all. We met a lot of people who were walking by and asking about the hotel. Most of them were coming from the huge, crowded all-inclusives and many of them seemed very impressed by what they saw at Petite Lafitte. I had a couple very minor gripes (i.e. the beds could be a bit nicer), but for the price I think this hotel is about as good as it gets in the area. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: rlb1968
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at Petit Lafitte after being long-time repeat guests at their previous hotel, Capitan Lafitte. This small, intimate hotel is unsurpassed for it's quiet ambiance, attentive management, friendly staff, and comfortable accommodations. From the moment you arrive, Felipe, Luis, and Eduardo, at the front desk, as well as the concierge, David, and the manager, Ivan, make you feel like you have arrived at your home! We stayed in the ocean-front room this time, but have also stayed in the ocean view rooms and find them extremely clean and comfortable with just enough amenities. A coffee maker and fridge, plenty of bottled water, a/c, and comfortable beds. They also have TV's which we have never turned on since the spectacular views are enough for us! But the best part of staying at Petit Lafitte is getting to know the amazing management and staff! Most of them have been with this family-run hotel for close to 20 years and it shows in their attentiveness and service! We have traveled all over the world and have never found a place with people so warm, welcoming and friendly as in Petit Lafitte!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing retreat...with outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelstoyou
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful trip to the Petit Lafitte. This is our second trip and we will definitely return again. We stayed in the ocean front bungalow which is rustic but very private. The beds are firm but comfortable. We have travelled extensively in Mexico and consider the Petit Lafitte a true hidden paradise. If you are looking for wild nightlife, this hotel is not for you, but if you are looking for a quiet and relaxing trip with outstanding service, you will not be disappointed. Although lunch is not included, the food is wonderful (try the fish tacos!). The staff could not be more accommodating and after the first day will address you by name. And, if you are in need of something...just ask! We arranged to have a private candlelit lobster dinner on the beach and the concierge David and the rest of the staff went out of their way to make sure it was romantic and an evening to remember. We can't wait to schedule our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at Petit Lafitte”
Reviews.Author: tpad
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Petit Lafitte Jan 4 - 9, 2011. We chose to stay in an ocean view cabin. It was really nice. The accommodations were spotless. It was nice to have a private "home" to use. We were steps from the beach. The sea water was refreshing and clean. Breakfast (fresh fruit was outstanding) and dinner (consistently delicious) were included. The food was of excellent quality. The staff really make an effort to make you feel comfortable and welcome. We at lunch there most of the time too! Yummy! We had chicken sopas, chicken tacos, ceviche, etc. All amazing tasting. Chef David is a natural! The bartenders and waiters (Victor, Manuel, Giovanni) were really nice. David was a wonderful concierge. He arranged for anything you might need. We had pleasant conversations. You could tell David wanted to know about you and your loved ones. A very caring man. Good management staff too (Felipe, Ivan, and the computer technology guy) I could go on and on with all of the good things. I almost forgot, please go see the animal sanctuary. It was so awesome. Capybaras, ostrich, parrots, deer, birds of all sorts. My kids said, this place just keeps getting better and better!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful paradise”
Reviews.Author: ftgrnegrl
Reviews.Content: Petit Lafitte is charming oasis amidst the touristy resort complexes that line this part of the Riviera Maya. This is the perfect spot to come if you're looking for a peaceful and relaxing getaway. Here are the basics: Lovely, well-maintained grounds. An incredible staff, from the moment we arrived til we said our last goodbyes they were welcoming, friendly, accommodating and very professional. The rooms were clean and functional, and every afternoon housecleaning would leave a new animal towel on our bed. I didn't need to have my towel changed everyday, but I purposely would leave it not hung up to see what housecleaning would come up with next. They had a seemingly infinite arsenal of cute animal towel configurations. The vibe here is so mellow and friendly that it is easy to talk to and meet your fellow guests. Overall, Petit Lafitte is an excellent value in everything they offer, the food was fresh, delicious and simply prepared. I can't wait to get back to have more of their pico de gallo and fish tacos. The drinks were strong and tasty (thanks Jesus!). And the setting and people---guests and staff alike----were lovely. Oh, and should you want some adventure with your relaxation ask at the front desk. The hotel has a long-standing relationship with some local drivers (Hola, Cesar!) who will take you to Mayan ruins, Cenotes, and some of the other attractions nearby. Our driver Cesar is of mayan ancestry and filled our drive to the ruins of Coba and Tulum with tales from the history and lore of his people. This is a great way to circumvent the package tours and get to these sites before they are inundated with busses from the large resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little oasis on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Isy999
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this quaint little hotel was superb..the staff all friendly and so helpful..this small resort is a gem for people looking to get away from noisy and busy resorts nearby ..not much else better to do but lay on the beautiful beach and make our way to the beach bar restaurant 10 feet away..the breakfast menu was bery good ..dinner a bit limited as far as choices but that was the only little drawback..next time we are going to try one of those beautiful bungalows on the beach they have..looks like heaven..!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Family Orientated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel12345_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Petit Lafitte during the holidays and the hotel was at its maximum capacity, though it didn’t feel crowded. We had a Garden View room near the restaurant as it was the only room available. I’d probably choose another room should we ever return for noise reasons near restaurant. We were up early and out the door most days so the chatter didn’t bother us much. Based on previous reviews we had thought it would be difficult to find, but this was not the case when using the directions off the website. The road is passable and has been somewhat repaired since earlier reviews. This was important because we had a rental car and traveled daily. I served as a fine base for seeing most of the Maya Riviera & a day trip to Cozumel. The beach is very nice and the staff was very accommodating. The staff works very hard to make your stay enjoyable. They even put on a New Years Eve fireworks show on the beach. The food was pretty good, the best being lunch (not included) …the Ceviche Mixto is outstanding. A local took us to an excellent restaurant in PDC and the ceviche at Petit Lafitte rivaled it. We enjoyed the small ‘zoo’ on premise as we fed the animals ostrich, birds, deer etc. and if we had children we think this would have been a nice little attraction for the kids. During our stay there were many families with children and this is how I would probably classify this hotel, multi-cultural families with lots of kids (though keep in mind this was the holidays). Overall we enjoyed our time and thought the hotel had a nice charm with an obvious devoted following.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples - super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chrisandreou
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at PL. Idelly suited for families with young children and couples of all ages. Pros - Best beach of the hotels outside of Playa (just move a little to the left to avoid the rocky area) - Best staff. Will provide you with the utmost service and make an effort to get to know your name. All staff take pride in what they do and it shows - Rooms are spacious and well equipped - Best food I have had in Mexico - chef is near Michellin star quality - Free wifi Cons - Poor connection from motorway - currently undergoing contruction from a dirt road to a beautiful paved road - Too far from motorway to get the bus to town

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have imagined better service, food, or scenery”
Reviews.Author: Potay
Reviews.Content: We booked this family, pre-Christmas trip based largely on the TripAdvisor reviews, and I have to say that it was better than we ever dreamed!!! Definitely going back next year and know for sure that we will be there with several families we met while there. We rented a car and arrived after sunset without any trouble using the detailed map posted on their website. Next year, no need to rent a car as there are many options for getting to and from the hotel and the other sites we ended up visiting (Tulum, Xcaret, the town of Playa, and a highly recommended Cenote called Dos Ojos). Once we arrived, Felipe greeted us and showed us to our Bungalow #3 which was just passed the hammock hut and beach chairs and no more than 150 yards from the immaculate water - very clean, and comfortable. After settling in, we met and made instant friends with a number of other families and couples enjoying drinks at the seaside cantina where Victor and Jesus' savory margaritas and mojitos are only outdone by the amazing tropical setting and friendly atmosphere. Each night, dinner became more and more delectable. Mouth watering soups, fresh salads and veggies, and entrees of beef, pork, chicken, fish - all culminating on our last night with the Christmas Eve buffet feast which topped them all!!! My daughter, 10 and extremely picky, was thrilled with the salads, pastas, and cheese quesadillas accomodated by the chef when requested in the morning. For lunch, the cantina menu offered a variety of Mexican and American fare which more than satisfied our individual tastes - definitely recommend the ceviche! The beachfront area was quiet and clean, with water clear and warm. The kids played in the water, rested on tubes, built sand castles, and played "hammock wars" or hide and seek with the other kids and mom and dad had no concerns as the property is open and safe with staff knowling exactly who everyone is/belongs to. The zoo was incredible, as the kids were able to feed several of the exotic animals - what great pictures and memories! Every other night we joined David and many families in the traditional Posada singing and Pinata fesitivities - it was like a summer camp feel, very special. The other nights, we made our own happy hour(s) and enjoyed hearing and sharing tales from the diversity of folks at the cantina (northeast/west/central US, German, Canadian). One afternoon we walked north along the beach to view the larger, more traditional all inclusives and noted the contrast to Petit - their Disney-like atmosphere - all great facilities but loud, crowded (try getting a beach chair!), and impersonal. Petit is unique and special, the staff take genuine interest in you enjoying all aspects of your vacation. We feel like we were brought into their family and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Package Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Habari
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in early December and found it to be a gem amongst the tacky All-Inclusives in Playa. The location is north of Playa, quite hard to find, but when you get there it is an attractive laid-back hotel. The beach is great and one can swim in the sea, though there are areas with rocks nearby. The staff were excellent, Jesus looked after us superbly at the beach bar and the front office staff were very knowledgeable and clearly wanting to please. The rooms are very good, sizeable and with all the amenities you would expect from a more expensive Hotel. They have a resonable library too for those who wish to vegetate on a beach chair. The only minor draw back is that the Hotel is sandwiched between large all-inclusives, so the beach occasionally has some people on it!! You might wish to rent a car whilst there as, although there are taxis, you have to call them up and you are approximately 2-1/2 kilometers from the main Cancun-Tulum highway. A bit far to hike to get a bus - but then this is a get-away Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A repeat stay in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Bugsy_10
Reviews.Content: Linda and I have just returned from our annual pre-Christmas stay at Petit Lafitte and we recommend it as the Number One Value on the Riviera Maya. We've been traveling to the Quintaro Roo coast for over 20 years and have stayed at many properites. Lafitte remains our unqualified recommendation for families, couples, singles who wish for a comforatble room/bed and modern bath, in-room refrig, wall safe, and superb daily service. The complimentary full-menu breakfast and 2-choice-entree 4 course evening meals, prepared by master chef Gaspar are matched by the pool-and-seaside bar staffed, alternately, by master bartenders Victor and Jesus. We like the deluxe hotel room overlooking the beach, but newly constructed beach bungalows with now bright ceilings are also very comfortable. The consistent night breezes and ceiling fans make the efficient air conditioners hardlly ever necessary. This year we spent 9 nights at Lafitte, enjoying each and every day. Be sure to introduce yourselves to manager Ivan Flores, his brother Fillipe at the front desk, assistant manager Luis, chief operating officer David, wait staff Martin, Balderamo, Manuel and Jovanny as well as waiter-in-training Jose Luis; assistant chef Jose as well as bar waiter Javier hang out by the beach bar, giving excellent support to Victor and Jesus. We thank Lordes, Ivan's lovely wife, for helping us find fresh lobster for our last evening's meal and for such a great value. We also thank our other Lourdes, our house cleaner, for her excellent service. Tip her well! (She is an artist with towel art.)

Reviews.Title: “Away from it All”
Reviews.Author: Porcheman1
Reviews.Content: Do you want to go to a place where the entire staff knows you and your wifes name by the end of day one? Well this is that kind of place!! Service, service, anything to make you happy. A small secluded beachfront gem with beachfront bungalows, and traditional hotel type rooms. No bracelets to wear, great food, quiet and relaxation ( no activity director to get you to play volleyball). Pristine beach, great atmosphere. If I was ever in the witness protection program, this is were I would like to land. David and staff go out of thier way with any requests. Jesus and the other bartenders take great care of you. Pack lightly, no need to bring down the big bags of luggage for fashion week here. Short trip into town (Playa del Carmen), for a change of scenery or do some snorkling. Will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Beach, Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: cpwomack
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you want to have a relaxing confortable vacation without fighting the crowds of the mega-hotels. The accommodations are clean, beds are comfortable and the staff treats you like family. Everyone from the restaurant, bar, and front desk will know your name and constantly ask if you need anything. The knowledgeable concierge will recommend restaurants in Playa Del Carmen, and loan out tour books if you want to go out to explore the Mayan ruins. Forget about waking up early to find a chair by the pool or beach! This is a small hotel with ample seating and lounge chairs wherever you look. We certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that really does have that personal touch”
Reviews.Author: ndofu
Reviews.Content: First came across this hotel eight years ago when it had just been built. Eight years later it has expanded but unlike the other large hotels, has managed to retain the small personal hotel charm. The entry road was being worked on but remained passable and I expect that it will be finished by the end of the month. Some rooms described as "ocean view rooms" probably were before the coconut trees matured. The hotel was, in general, quiet although this was at the beginning of the season and it may not be that way if fully booked. The staff went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Petit Lafitte so much we want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cherbaby
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 days strictly on the fave reviews on Trip Advisor ... they were all positive. There was not one negative. Well, we were not disappointed! This is a fabulous small intimate friendly hotel with wonderfully trained staff! The breakfasts & dinners included in the price were amazing and the servers have such a great sense of humour. The room was very clean, the bed linens fresh. The grounds and pool area are kept clean and beautiful and Petit Lafitte is situated on a lovely stretch of white sandy beach,

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Spend Thanksgiving Away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: Hodding
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a tasteful, low-key all-inclusive (except drinks and lunch) getaway with wonderful service and well-above par food, the Petit Lafitte is your kind of place. We just spent Thanksgiving week there with our extended family and no one was disappointed (out of more than 20!). Fresh-squeezed orange juice every morning, along with a mind-boggling assortment of locak fruit and pastries. Excellent ceviche for lunch and practically anything else you might want. And dinner was almost always a delightful surprise featuring both local and international dishes. Did I mention the bar makers the best fresh-squeezed lime drinks in Mexico? Only bad thing about that was keeping our kids from going back for 4ths and 5ths. The resort doesn't have an array of "toys" and amenities to distract those who get tired of surf, sun, swimming and reading but we didn't miss a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic cabañas wrapped in first class service seaside on the Caribbean.”
Reviews.Author: dbalcaen
Reviews.Content: I am not kidding about the first class service. Our waiters, the front desk and the cleaners were all fabulous. It felt like we were welcomed into their family home! The cabañas were great! Simple yet more than adequate with a deck on the front so you could sit and soak in the Mayan jungle meeting the ocean. Within a day we settled into a new rhythm of a wonderful breakfast buffet with full course entre to follow. We were stuffed every morning ready for excursions or just hanging around. Dinner was a bit over the top for me salad bar, soup, breads, lots of ended and deserts.......I had to start ordering half portions!! I really enjoyed the food which had a great mix of American dishes and Mayian dishes if you wanted to taste the local recipes like I do. Our hosts at Petit LaFitte were very helpful and even helped us with our very poor Spanish! Mucho gracias amigos! I am an amateur photographer and found the jungle setting right next to the beaches all in a tropical setting an endless source of unique topics. I took hundreds of pictures! Some were simply stunning time exposures of the moon backlighting puffy cumulus clouds at night! Enchanting. I also like sw radio and the reception was great. Next year I bring my ham radio gear and try my luck! I was relived that this was not a party open bar resort. I enjoyed the peace and quiet. There were lots of families there too, some with babies. It all seemed to work so effortlessly. For me, it was five stars all around. It's a jewel set in the Mexican Carribean. Email me if you have questions about my review. dbalcaen54-at-shaw.ca David Balcaen

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for the price and service, great for family gatherings”
Reviews.Author: BRemedios
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling for 25 years touring every place around the world. When my daughter and son-in-law suggested Petit Lafitte for a relaxing holiday, we just didn't know if it was right for us! Honestly, we loved this place the service was just great and the food pretty good. We could not believe that during our 13 day stay the soup was never repeated and every soup delicious - kudos to the Chef(s). From the very top to the staff everyone was very personable and took the time to learn customer's names even though sometimes that can be a challenge! At the reception area they always took care of any need you might have. Conceirge David from the time he handed the key made sure everything was A OK! Victor and Jesus at the bar were very friendly and made sure your thirst for water, drinks or food was always taken care of. We enjoyed the Coconut water daily as per our request. Lourdes who made up the rooms daily was very pleasant and there was never a want of anything. My grandchild made herself right at home and her needs and the needs of my sick husband were always attended to. The wonderful treat for old and young is the Zoo and although the surface was uneven it added to the natural habbitat for the animals and birds. Even the internet was available at all times. I would recommend this hotel to my friends for a relaxing and safe holidays with terrific service at all times. The other visitors at Petit were all so friendly and helpful and it felt like being with family. This place is so safe and away from the hustle and bustle of tourists crowds. The only con was that since the roads are in process of being modernized, the taxi rides to and fro were a little rough. Once completed it will be smooth sailing. I personally feel if you want to do a lot of sightseeing, etc. the best deal would be to rent a car. Keep up the good work at Petit Lafitte and may be you will see us again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Something money can't buy”
Reviews.Author: Gringaquena
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to describe how much I loved staying at Petit Lafitte. I went there with my husband, our 1 1/2 year old daughter, and my parents in November 2010. We were coming from Oaxaca, Mexico and my parents from New Jersey, USA. It was a nice meeting point for all of us. Before we even got there, we were treated kindly by the reservations manager, Luis, offering us any kind of information, whether petty or not, about our stay and the accomodations necessary (especially with our daughter). When we got to the hotel, we were met by the concierge, David, who kindly explained and showed us everything at the hotel. David went beyond his duties to buy us some Tylenol for our baby girl who got fever during the trip. I was worried about making our first trip with our daughter to a hotel, but every one was so kind with her. She loved hugging and kissing the staff and vice versa. This to me is priceless and cannot be found in other hotels. Also, of our 2 week stay, there was only one day that our daughter did not have a play companion. There were always kids, and it made for a nice family-style atmosphere. The kitchen staff and wait staff is incredible. The food is remarkable and there is a nice variety for everyone. Thanks, Martin, Balde, Giovany, Manuel and Javier. You'll find the same treatment at the bar with wonderful service from the bartenders, Jesus and Victor, and lunch waiters. You can eat lunch at the bar or on the deck depending on what you prefer. And the options for lunch are fantastic. You have to try the shrimp tacos! We had the plan where breakfast and dinner were included, but since we spent most of our days there, we ate lunch at the bar as well. I totally recommend getting the plan with dinner included as dinner is truly the event of the day. Our cleaning lady, Lulu, made special extra effort to make towel figures for our little girl, and she always left the room immaculate. Because my parents have trouble walking, it was nice to be in such a cozy hotel. EVERYTHING (bar, reception, restaurant, beach, pool) were EXTREMELY close to our rooms. I can't wait for us to go back. I hope it becomes a yearly ritual.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stretch of beach but be prepared to get off road to get to the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ohayopai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights a few weeks ago, we arrived in PDS after nightfall by car and man, we could not believe how hard it was to find the hotel - even with a gps! We asked roadworkers/hotel staff/locals and after about an hour of getting directed on dug up roads, mounds of construction rubble, and seriously mean looking wilderness we came upon the hotel. We were told there were roadworks to improve access to the area. If we had've known we would not have stayed at this hotel. It was far too difficult driving in and out of the hotel to playa del carmen due to this construction and did hamper our movements. It's a great hotel if you have children and don't want to pop out to town here and there - it's not very convenient. The hotel itself is really nice and the breakfasts are amazing. The beach is beautiful and a computer set up with free internet was a godsend so we could make our onward bookings- it's nice when hotels realise not everyone lugs a laptop around with them when they're on holidays!! The staff are great and the rec room would be great for rainy days, and children. Again, it's really more of a family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good fit for a family with small children in need of a beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: dcn25
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children (ages 3 and 5 months) stayed at Hotel Petit Lafitte in November of 2010. We had a wonderful time and are considering making a week-stay at Petit Lafitte an annual tradition. First, it is important to note that this is not a luxury all-inclusive hotel. There are no mega swimming pools, no performances at night, no parties on the beach, no mile-long buffet of food. What Petit Lafitte is: a small, semi-secluded hotel with everything you need to enjoy a week basking in the Caribbean sun. This type of hotel is perfect for a family with small children because, unlike the mega resort hotels, your room is a 30-second walk from the beach. You do not need to take a shuttle to the beach, and you don't have to collect all your gear and tote it to the beach with you. When you're ready to use some snorkel equipment, just go to your room and get it. Need a sweater or different shoes? Run back to your room to get it. While you are on the beach, the staff at the beach-side bar will periodically check to see if you need a drink and bring it out to you for what I thought was a very reasonable price. Because of the hotel's small size, there is little competition for the hotel's shades and beds on the beach. The atmosphere is that of a slow-paced, relaxing vacation. No loud music, no disco balls, no binge drinking. Instead, it is a quiet, happy retreat. Think pina coladas, massages on the beach, and the sound of waves crashing. As far as location goes, the hotel is just north of Playa del Carmen and a 35-40 minute drive from the airport. Although the hotel does provide a shuttle service, I thought the service was quite costly and would recommend instead renting a car as we did. However, please note that the access road to the hotel is a dirt road (supposedly will be paved soon) that I think would be difficult to traverse in an economy-sized car. We had a Jeep Liberty, which worked quite well. Aside from saving the cost of the hotel's shuttle from the airport, having a rental car allows you to leave the hotel and travel to your choice of destinations (Chichen Itza, Xcaret, Tulum, etc.) without paying the price for a tour package. As far as the rooms go, they are basic rooms, but very comfortable. We stayed in two hotel rooms, rather than in one of the beach bungalows. We loved having a balcony or terrace with a little table and chairs. It allowed us to put our children to bed and then play scrabble on the balcony. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioning units worked well, the shower had plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The rooms were very clean, and the bedding was nice. There is an in-room mini fridge, an in-room safe, an iron, and free in-room Wi-Fi (as well as a shared computer available to use). Filtered, purified drinking water is provided daily for free, and you can always ask for more if you want more. Aside from daily maid service, there is free beach towel service so that you can have clean beach towels every morning. There is laundry service available. I wouldn't have the hotel do a whole load of laundry, but the prices were reasonable for washing a couple of pieces if necessary. I would bring your own shampoo and conditioner, as the provided miniature shampoo bottles were not what I suspect most women would like to use on their hair. (My husband, however, didn't seem to mind.) The food is quite good, most of the time. The normal rate for this hotel includes breakfast and dinner. We booked during a promotional period in which you could get a garden view room, with only breakfast included, for a good deal. The breakfast was great. At the buffet, you could get yogurt, fruit, Mexican breads and pastries, fresh orange juice, cereal, granola. On top of all this, each person could order one hot dish--omelets, eggs prepared many different ways, french toast, etc. This was my son's favorite meal because he loved eating familiar pancakes and french toast. We loved breakfasts here. (One strange note: the french toast was made with the same bread offered at dinner, which is flavored with rosemary and basil. It is hardly noticeable in the french toast because of the cinnamon dusted over it, but strange nonetheless.) Although our rate did not include dinner, we opted on two nights to pay for dinner. Dinner is a four-course meal with a salad/vegetable, soup, main course, and dessert. Sometimes the first, second, and dessert courses are served buffet-style, sometimes they are brought to your table. The main course (you have a choice of two different entrees) is always brought to the table. We thought that the food on one night was very very good and on the other night just okay. Since we only had dinner twice, this is probably not a very representative sampling of the food. Our son was always very hesitant to eat any of the food served for dinner because he was tired and wanted more familiar food, but the staff was happy to bring out a quesadilla for my son. All the fruits and vegetables are washed in an iodine solution. No one in my party had any stomach problems. The service is what really sets this place apart. The staff learned all of our names, including our two kids' names. One of the waiters at the bar (which serves grill food at lunch) brought my son a cup of ice cream as a complimentary surprise one day at lunch. If there was ever a problem, it was immediately resolved. Everyone was very friendly with our children, and we never felt like our children were a nuisance to anyone. There was a port-a-crib available for us to use. When my mother asked for off-menu items at breakfast (plain, instead of flavored yogurt, for example, or hot chocolate), the staff accommodated her request. All in all, Petit Lafitte proved to be the perfect retreat for our family. In fact, we had only booked a three night stay at Petit Lafitte but ended up staying for six nights after a brief jaunt to Merida and realizing how great we had it at Lafitte.

Reviews.Title: “Natural, wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: 77wildhorses
Reviews.Content: I am VERY particular. I ruin trips with my dissatisfactions. It's a fault, I know, but my expectations are high. So, when I say that Petit Lafitte is wonderful, that's the kind of eye I'm applying. We stayed in an ocean view bungalow. It is "rustic" as others have mentioned. By which, I mean, hand-crafted, not The Ritz.. More comfortable, earthy. We walked off our porch onto the beach sand. The gardens are beautiful, the beach amazing. No towering hotels next door. The meals are lovely and service is 5 star. Everything you need. Opposite vibe of the all-inclusive resort, but with some of the things that you do want like planned included meals. One thing, the loft bed in the bungalow was really uncomfortable. A high-density foam mattress would have solved that. We ended up just all piling into the king bed. If you are planning on using the loft for sleeping, you should inquire about the particular bed. Also, I should say, I missed a bathtub--our bungalow only had a shower. The place was very quiet and had only a few guests when we were there. But, I think it would be quiet and peaceful no matter when you went. That's the vibe of the place. Our kids loved the zoo. They're still working on it, pathways are incomplete and materials are piled here and there. But, my daughter didn't notice those things, she noticed the baby chicks and laughed at me trying to catch them for her to hold. We had to visit the zoo every morning. The kids collected coconuts, played hide-and-go-seek, and played on the hammocks while we had drinks. The road to Lafitte IS bad. They are working on it but just get Cesar to drive you though. Ask the hotel about him. You are on vacation and he is lovely. I had to work while I was there. I couldn't get consistent Internet in my bungalow, so was forced to go out and watch the sunrise while working at the bar...steps away from the sea. F-A-N-T-A-S-T-I-C.

Reviews.Title: “The best part of waking up is realizing you are at Petit Lafitte!”
Reviews.Author: Ripley1747
Reviews.Content: I was hunting for someplace reasonable, not necessarily all inclusive, on the beach,not in Cancun's Hotel Zone and small. I'm not into fighting for beach chairs, or sitting in a sea of them. I don't drink, I'm not a big partier and don't need night clubs to entertain myself. I found Petit Lafitte through Trip Advisor and it fit the bill perfectly. I booked a bungalow and got a 40% discount for booking online through one of their promotions. Didn't have to wear shoes at all. Step out of the bungalow right into the sand. The bungalows were great. Clean, cute and very comfortable. The lights were a little dim, but nothing a few new bulbs couldn't fix. Shower big enough for two, bottled water in the room. Between the AC and the fan, it wasn't hard to get comfortable. In addition to beds, table and chairs in room, safe, coffee maker, night stand, mini frig, ironing board. We even found a few candles for ambience that got pressed into service when the electricity went off for a few hours. How romantic! Table and chairs on the deck out front, with a great railing for drying bathing suits/towels. Coconut trees dot the property, and they fall down frequently. The staff will hack one open for you and make you a coco loco. Hammocks hang throughout the property. Probably the greatest thing about Petit Lafitte is the staff. Felipe welcomes you at the front desk, gives a little tour of the property and shows you to your room. The food was outstanding, and the bar/waitstaff extremely attentive. Javier, Martin, Geovanny, Baldy and the other guys who moved too quickly for me to catch their names were wonderful! The beach in front of the resort was beautiful. A little rocky directly in front, but go 50 feet north and it wasn't rocky. . How could you complain when the water was about 80 degrees... We could see Cozumel across the water from Petit Lafitte. Walked up and down the beach, saw the other hotels/resorts and was very happy I picked Petit Lafitte. Dive shop/Spa facilities right on the property, nice big pool. Not very crowded the first week in Nov. Good time to visit. Can't wait to go back. Kind of nervous about all the violence being reported in Mexico, but I felt very safe, and was told by numerous people that the Riviera Maya is not where the problems are. The road leading to Petit Lafitte is a disaster zone, but under construction. I don't think the bandits would be able to find the place! (our taxi broke down about 1/2 mile from the hotel, so we had to schlep our luggage the rest of the way, which was amusing.....what are you gonna do?) The road construction was also the reason for the power outage while we were there, but the bar and restaurant never lost power, only the bungalows. It was actually kind of fun. The staff set up tiki torches to light our way! Would love to come back, which is probably the best thing you could say about a property.....

Reviews.Title: “The Petit Lafitte was a perfect escape”
Reviews.Author: wmunn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from celebrating my mom's 60th birthday at the Petit Lafitte and we had the most wonderful time. The staff at the hotel is absolutely terrific-- they were so friendly and by the end of the first day they knew our names! Victor, Martin, Jose, & Geovanny were the best and Victor and Martin make THE BEST margaritas and mojitos!! The food was also delicious. It was the off season so we practically had the place to ourselves and it was a terrific, low key place to just stop, relax, read a book and get some sun. The beach was beautiful and we took long walks every day (which made me so thankful I wasn't staying in one of the larger all inclusives!) The oceanfront bungalows were the best value in my opinion and my only complaints were that the lighting was not very good and the beds were not extremely comfortable. That said, we weren't in our rooms much so it didn't really matter! We got massages two day in a row and they were so relaxing. I will definitely be going back and hope to make it an annual trip!

Reviews.Title: “Now we know what all the fuss is about.”
Reviews.Author: playa2relax
Reviews.Content: We have been to this part of Mexico over 15 times in the last 10 years. Usually we stay at big all inclusives. We have stayed in Cancun all the way South to Xpu Ha. We use TA all the time to study up and prepare for where to stay. However, this is my first review. Everytime we drive to Playa we see the sign for Petit Lafitte, and think to ourselves that we need to check that place out. In the past, we have been afraid to go out of the box and try something different. This time, we sure are glad that we did. We booked through the hotel website and got a good deal for the "low" season. 35% off of the oceanview bungalow, plus another 5% off because we booked on a Thursday. We used Suncountry to fly out of Dallas, and USA Transfers to get us to the hotel. Both went smoothly. When we arrived at the check in desk Felipe, and David greeted us, and checked us in. We then decided to upgrade to the oceanfront cabana. This was an anniversary trip without the kids, so we figured, why not? Plus we got a great deal on that too. I took my shoes off on Wednesday when we arrived and didn't put them on until we had to check out on Sunday. What a great way to spend a vacation! The best pedicure available by nature. I also had my first ever hot stone massage on the beach by Berta. It was heavenly to lay there and listen to the waves. Our cabana #2 was clean, spacious, private, with comfortable beds. We expect firm beds in Mexico, but this was much better than expected. It had a mini fridge with bottled water, soda, snacks. The room had an ironing board, iron, safe and plenty of towels. The A/C worked very well. We even slept with the windows open a few nights so we could hear the waves. We found the food to be very good, as well as the drinks. Victor, and Jesus at the bar make great margaritas! They have both been with the Lafitte family for many years, and it showed. By the end of our first day, the entire staff new our names and what bungalow we were in. There were only 12 people there when we were there. Two couples were in the hotel section, and the rest in the cabanas. The pool was refreshing and clean. The beach was very nice with a lot of hammocks to relax in. It also had a lot of shade for my hubby. The water was pretty stirred up from the wind, so I didn't get to snorkel as I couldn't see. Although we have stayed in 5 star fancy hotels in Cancun, and Playa, we would probably choose this one again. It was incredibly relaxing, great food and drinks, very private, and you can't beat the staff, and location. Since we were only there 4 nights, we didn't do any excursions. We have done most of them in the past anyway. This was to be a relaxing vacation for us, and we couldn't have asked for more. We got exactly what we were expecting, and more! Yes, the road to the resort is bad, we knew that going in and didn't really care. This place felt like home to us, and we can't wait to go back. Thanks to all the wonderful staff for making our trip amazing. We also met several very nice couples that we hope to stay in touch with. If you have any questions, please PM me.

Reviews.Title: “Great small beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachbums2Houston_TX
Reviews.Content: I had done much research and was very excited to stay here. I loved my stay and would go back again. Small beach hotel with 30 rooms and about 15 or so bungalows. We stayed in the hotel part. Buiding 4, 3rd floor. Room 405. There are 5 buildings, each with 6 rooms. Building 1 is closest to the lobby and building 5 is closest to the beach. We could not stay in building 5, as they were doing some maintenance on those rooms. We had a nice ocean view from our room. Only obstructed by palm trees. The room was basic, but clean and plenty of drinking water is provided. The hot water in the shower is more tepid than hot. I did not like the beds. Very hard. There was a nice plush comforter that we ended up using to sleep on top of, to make the bed a little softer. We looked at the bungalow rooms. They look really nice and rustic. Number 9 looked to be the best to me. Close to the beach, lots of shade. 2 and 3 are nice location as well. The newer ones in the back have less shade and are further from the beach. The beach is very nice. It is rocky right in front of the hotel, but just to left a little is a good swimming area. Nice for long walks and sitting in the shade and reading, too. The swimming pool is also great, although we did not use it much. The food is really good. Breakfast and Dinner included. Both great. We ordered lunch twice. Shrimp tacos were yummy. Hamburger not so much. The bar and bartenders were great. Good margaritas, ice cold beer in bottles. Ice cold coca cola in bottles. The road to get to the hotel is horrible. Good news is, they were working on it while we were there, so hopefully it will be good shortly. They have an area for massages on the beach. I recommend getting one. Not many rooms occupied while we were there. Maybe 4 or 5. Almost too quiet, but we very much enjoyed ourt stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “A true hidden gem: beautiful beach, amazing staff and fantastic food!!!”
Reviews.Author: JandC_NYC
Reviews.Content: We went to the Playa del Carmen area this past summer with the intention of finding a beachside resort for our upcoming wedding. We went to an amazing destination wedding in PdC in 2006 so we knew what the area had to offer, but we also did a lot of internet research on what was available. We decided to stay at Petit Lafitte and planned on being there for a few nights maximum, and then planned to stay at one or two more places during our 8 day trip (all while visiting other hotels during the day). But after experiencing Petit, we decided to stay there for all 8 nights. We still looked at other resorts during our trip, but Petit was the perfect fit for us: a beautiful setting with amazing friendly service and fantastic food! It was just such a peaceful, friendly atmosphere that we knew we had found our spot, especially after meeting the staff, the manager Ivan, and seeing how they treat their guests and each other. Petit Lafitte is a small beachside resort with your choice of bungalows or hotel-style rooms, but it didn't feel small, it felt cozy and intimate. We stayed in a bungalow and loved it, but we also saw inside the hotel-type room and would have been very happy there as well. Both are very roomy and clean. All bungalows and hotel rooms have either a private terrace or balcony, and they're all literally seconds from the beach (and the pool and the bar and the restaurant!). The beach and the ocean were beautiful and peaceful and if that were all this resort could boast, it would be worth it. But it has so much more going for it. We were absolutely blown away by the resort staff and their service! We made so many connections with the staff and are on first-name basis with many of them. We were also amazed by the food. Breakfast and dinner are included in the all-inclusive price and the meals were fantastic! We spent one week there, and felt no need to go into town for dinner at a fancy restaurant because the food at Petit was so delicious and we wanted to see what the talented chef Gaspar and his staff had in store for us! There is also a lunch menu, and one day we had the best ceviche we've ever had (and we've had some pretty good ceviche living in NYC)! We went into town one day for shopping, and PdC is fun as always, lots to do and see and buy, if you ever need a "break" from relaxing on the beach. And it was only a ten minute cab ride from Petit into town. Unlike many of the other beachside hotels we visited in PdC, Petit Lafitte has an "undiscovered" feel to it. The beach is not crowded at all, because it isn't sandwiched between other hotels. Simply put, Petit Lafitte is a beautiful, clean, quiet and peaceful resort with fantastic food and sincere and friendly service...all for a very reasonable price. So if this is what you're looking for in your next beach vacation, I suggest you get there quick before it gets discovered by everyone else!

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen's Best Kept Secret!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chazz7762
Reviews.Content: Here's the deal - if you want a big resort with alot of night life on property, don't book this place. If you want personal service, attention to detail, no hassle and wonderful Mexican Riviera beach vacation you need to BOOK YOUR STAY NOW. First, we can't give a perfect score as there was a mix up on our reservation. After much research, we reserved Bungalow #3 several months in advance of our trip, and found upon arrival that it was occupied. Luckily there were other Bungalows available and were placed in one that was still close to the beach. Our family (my wife and I and 2 girls 16 and 13) are accustomed to an Outer Banks summer vacation with a property right on the beach. We had not as a family been to Mexico, so we wanted the perfect stay for us - no night life and partying, plenty of beautiful beach and opportunity for daily beach activities. The reviews on tripadvisor really told us everything about what Petit Lafitte had to offer and we were sold. The Bungalow is just that - don't expect fancy linens and posh surroundings - these are cabins on the beach, people - love them for what they are! You can check out pictures on their website so you know exactly what you're getting. For me, there is nothing like waking up, walking right out your door onto the sand straight to the beautiful turquoise Caribbean water 30 yards away (after heading for coffee). It wasn't crowded at all during our mid August stay, never had any issue with trying to run out and reserve beach chairs. I won't go into how the staff gets to know you personally and has your names down in 1 days time, learns your favorite food selections (thanks for the extra chocolate swirl bread Baldy!) and seizes every opportunity to make your stay special. OK here's something you won't get at the Royal Hacienda resort just up the beach - my 13 year old found a fallen coconut one morning after a storm the night before. We tried and tried to break it open but there was no way. We were talking about it at breakfast, the staff overheard us. Next thing we knew Martin professionally prepared a coconut cut fresh from the tree and voila - parasol and all - we will never forget it. Yes we ventured out one day of our 5 day stay to do the interactive thing with the dolphins. The staff recommended Puerto Aventouras (~20-30 min drive, like a SeaWorld kind of destination) as the best place and it was wonderful. We had the bus driver drop us off in Playa Del Carmen afterwards where we shopped and ate dinner at Senor Frogs - it's right on the beach where the ferry is to Cozumel. We had no need for a rental car for our length of stay. We will try one of the other local restaurants in town next time :) I've read the reviews of folks complaining about not being able to find the place and the dirt road getting there (potholes and all) and other issues. Simple solution: book the airport transfers ahead of time and you will have no problem - just sit back and enjoy the ride and surroundings. Oh and the food - wonderful breakfast selections including fruit (wonderful Mangos!) and my favorite the Spanish Omellette. Thanks David and all of the staff for a wonderful first time family beach vacation to Mexico. You all do a fine job and we can't wait to come back and see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Bungalow Heaven!!!”
Reviews.Author: wand3r3r
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our trip to Playa del Carmen. Because of an apparent glitch in the Petit Lafitte's website, I was only able to book 4 nights in a Garden Bungalow. Their website was not showing Garden Bungalows available for 5, 6, 7, or 8 nights. We ended booking the remaining 4 nights of our stay at La Tortuga Hotel (see separate review under that hotel). Anyway, it's a shame because it turns out there were Garden Bungalows available for our complete stay. Next time we will call to verify availability. I don't want to repeat a lot of what has been reviewed previously except to say that all of the excellent reviews were well deserved. We loved the place. We have stayed in a large variety of bungalows throughout the world, some more costly and some less. But I must say that PL"s bungalows were one of the nicest. They keep the bungalows spotless. The mattresses are firm just the way we like them. Bottled water is provided free-of-charge. Our bungalow #8 was situated such that the minute you stepped off the veranda, you were literally standing in the sand. We loved the food too. Our rate included the half-board meal plan. The breakfasts were delicious and filling. The dinners were awesome. I still dream of the medallions of beef cooked in a hibiscus sauce. Yummy and so tender you could cut it with a fork. A big thank you to the Chef. Service was top notch. David first showed us around and kind of took us under his wing to make sure everything was just right.. Jesus might make a mean margarita but we loved his mojitos with the "secret" ingredient! One night a light bulb burnt out in our room and we mentioned it to the front desk before dinner. By the time we finished dinner and returned to our bungalow, the bulb had already been replaced and was burning bright to welcome us back. The only drawback to the PL is the road to the hotel. It's a dirt road for much of the way once you get off the main highway and it's full of potholes. It makes the going even more difficult after a rainstorm as the potholes become swimming pools. We had more than one taxi driver or tour van driver cursing under their breath at the road. Maybe PL keeps it this way to keep the hotel a "hidden secret"? I will end by saying that our type of vacation usually is about exploring new places. We just don't go the same place twice. The highest compliment I can pay to PL and its staff is we can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect end to our trip”
Reviews.Author: HeatherBuchheim
Reviews.Content: My partner and i spent the last full day of our vacation at this beautiful resort. We never had to put on our shoes once. The resort is a little out of the way, and you have to drive on an unfinished road to get there (I imagine it will be paved in the future), but once you're there, you really don't have to leave. There's a restaurant with decent food (not the best we had, but definitely a step up from typical resort food) with plenty of amenities -- a game room, pool, bar, snorkel/diving shack, and plenty of space on the beach with hammocks galore. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable and some of the staff even remembered our names and were very personable and gave us a warm reception. We would definitely consider coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Bobeana
Reviews.Content: Looking for a perfect place to chill, relax and enjoy the beach near Playa del Carmen? Petit Lafitte fits the bill. A quiet place just north of downtown Playa del Carmen ; about 45-50 minutes south of the Cancun airport. Awesome beach; and we enjoyed the bungalow lodging 200 yards from the water; loved the breakfasts and dinner (and we could barely finish all the food served to us). Staff was exceptional! Totally took care of us -- stellar service and surpisingly great food at breakfast and dinner (included in the room rate we were quoted). My friend and I were there during the very low season; we got a great rate and we were some of the only guests at the hotel for the week after Labor Day. As a result, we felt like we had the place to ourselves; beach was nearly empty; staff was particularly attentive and hospitable (not that they wouldn't be when busy as well, but it made our time there very special). Some of our favorite staff? David, the conceirge, bartenders Chucho (Jesus) and Box (Victor) as well and servers Geovany and Baldemaro and everyone else who made our stay so special. A taxi to Playa was $140 pesos one way. We went in twice, but did rent a car for the day to go to Tulum (and the hotel staff took care of this for us and the rental company picked us up to go into Playa to go the car, which was nice). Upon arrival, we took the ADO bus from Cancun Airport to Playa for $106 pesos and then a taxi to Petit Lafitte for $140. It was easy! And we were two women traveling solo upon arrival (and not together upon arrival). Very safe and not much Spanish required... We were happy to chill at the hotel and beach most days, but I might consider renting a car next time. Between the transfer from the airport to the hotel, and from the hotel to Playa or other destinations, it might be worthwhile. Then again, who wants to drive home from Playa after a couple of margaritas?!! Petit Lafitte is truly a special place, one I'm glad to have experienced. WE LOVED IT. This is a simple, rustic, yet elegant place on a great, quiet stretch of beach just north of Playa del Carmen. This is not your typical resort that caters to Americans looking for an all-inclusive resort on the Riveria Maya. It has a Mexican feel and vibe to it, and that's why it was so special to me and my college buddy travel companion. It was really perfect. The road in from the main highway is in pretty bad shape. We called it the Beirut road for fun. If possible, take the road leading in to the Hotel Princess and the follow signs from there. Great place for couples. And my friend and I thought it would be particularly fun for an adult group of friends looking to have a great time for a special celebration, or just a good time. Get a bungalow if you can -- they are private and right on the sand, if not ocean front. Easily accomodate 2 adults, could manage 3-5 in a stretch (there is a loft double in most but I'm not sure how comfy it would be to be honest). This place is so great I'm reluctant to tell others in the event it's "discovered" and too difficult to book in the future! SHHH. Don't tell just anybody!

Reviews.Title: “You cannot find a better place!”
Reviews.Author: marketa_tejcova
Reviews.Content: We have had a great time in Pettit Laffite, the place is charming (beautiful beach and sea - a lot to see when snorchling, lovely garden), bungalows cozy and comfortable (air con, fridge...), very friendly and helpful staff, excellent food and drinks, a lot of possiblities for activities (diving, trips...). We would love to come back, we can recommend the end of August as school starts in the US and there are not many people around.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting, Fantastic Staff, Tranquillo !!”
Reviews.Author: jfish930
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Petit Lafitte for 7 days in mid-August and we just love this place! If you are seeking a beautiful beach, clear blue/turquoise water with white sand-this is the place for you. If you are looking for more of a party atmosphere then I would recommend elsewhere. There are approximately 15 bungalows and 30 hotel rooms. We must have seen 20 guests our entire stay. Yes the rooms are basic, but they are very clean and the A/C works great. Here is a summary of a how we spent a typical day here: Sleep in a little ( hey we're on vacation!) because breakfast is served till I think 10 or 1030. Eat breakfast. Hang out at the beach all day, reading, swimming, sunning and napping. Eat lunch on the outdoor deck-they have the best ceviche!!! Take an afternoon siesta to soak up some cool A/C in the room. Have a before dinner drink. Eat dinner. Have more drinks; by the way the bar is next to the beach under a big palapa. You can have some drinks while listening to the waves and watching the moon reflect on the ocean. Repeat day 2 through 7. We did take a taxi for 12.00 US into Playa one night for drinks, and although it was fun, we really enjoyed unplugging back at Petit Lafitte. Lastly, Hola to Victor at the bar--he makes the best Margarita we ever had! (ask for the Don Julio tequila). Also the Mango Margaritas were great! Hola to Javier, (yes Javier I will bring my whole family next time) Giovanny , Martin, Manuel, Felippe,David, Eduardo, Mariano. These guys are always smiling. Besides all the wonderful things as mentioned above, it is the staff who really make this place great with their friendliness, smiles, charm and kindness! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Ybarsabal
Reviews.Content: Totally awesome. We went for the upgraded bungalow and it was awesome. Food was awesome. Bar was awesome (Jesus = best bartender ever). Free wifi near the pool and dining area. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, great experience and the perfect place for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: juanciorcia
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Lafitte, I had a great experience. What can I say, everything. If you are looking for a place to relax, that is quite, very friendly, great service, with a nice pool and a great bar next to the beach that provides a great variety of fresh food and drinks of all kind. OK let me list the highlights 1- The service was very friendly and very knowledgeable of what to do and where to go in Playa. They all are always very helpful and everybody makes sure you are doing ok and have a good time while you are there. 2- The rooms are very nice and comfortable, always very very clean, right next to the beach (I noticed that in the other hotels you have to walk quite a distance from you room to the shore line, and are also more expensive) 3- The Location is perfect. Not too close and not too far from Playa del Carmen, the perfect distance. When you first get there, the road is a bit bumpy and is not very sophisticated, but when you get to the hotel and get settled and look around then you realize what a great place it is. You have two options, you can take a taxi or you can rent a car. Renting a car is easy and if you do it online with Alamo or Hertz is cheaper 4- I was very impressed and very happy with the food. Their cuisine was amazing. I was there for 10 days and they never repeated the same dish twice, they always had something different to offer for dinner. The quality and presentation of the food was excellent. AGAIN, I was VERY HAPPY with their food, their breakfast, lunch and dinner are fantastic! 5- After dinner I could stay at the pool late at night listening to the ocean or by the bar having a drink, by the way the bar that provides a great variety of fresh food and drinks of all kind all day 6- In general the atmosphere of the hotel is perfect and you feel like family I am definitely going back and I have been telling my friends to go there if they are looking for a place to relax close to Playa del Carmen

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, friendly, and absolutely fantastic food, drinks, and beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamericangirlnewyork
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this quaint little gem. First and most importantly, the beach is gorgeous and not crowded at all. Swimming and snorkeling were perfect. the water is so blue and clear. The hotel is kept very well and our room was spotless. We stayed in a premium standard ocean view. All meals were excellent and the margaritas are to die for. They use fresh squeezed lime juice and none of that sugary mix. I highly recommend a mango margarita. Drinks are reasonably priced especially when ordering high end tequila. $8 for Don Julio. The staff are the most friendly and hospitable people I have ever met on vacation. They made sure to get to know us and traeted us like family. The pool is fabulous too. It is clean, deep, and refreshing. We had a wonderful time and plan on going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing times”
Reviews.Author: matejmrak
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a quite place to stay with no mumbo jumbo all inclusive style and you are fan of non conventional places, choose petit lafitte. Clean and nice Cabanas only 20 meter's from emerald see surrounded with palms trees and white sand... we loved it a lot. food was more continental then mexican and tastefull. service in general is o.k. but some of guys like Javier make this place really "wanna come back". we simply loved it. don't expect to have things like you have in big hotels (like fitness room) since you won't get it. this place is not so easy to find and one disadvantage is that if you would like to go to playa del carmen you will have to pay 150 pesos for taxy (one way) to get there....but why would you :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but an even better staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: Jose-Luis_Cote
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Petit Lafitte was captivating, it left us with a sense of having our own resting space in a unique and privileged place not only because of the Riviera Maya but mostly and most importantly because of the attention, approach, and hospitality that you will certainly miss when you're back home. Today, we leave with melancholy because of the beautiful people that shared their kindness and affection with us and made us feel truly at home. We're glad to know that there are hotels with this sensitivity and passion for personalized attention, plus they live and transmit their joy in every detail and in every aspect. If what you wish for your vacations is a simple, sober spot your destination should always be Petit Lafitte. We wish to thank David for his leadership as concierge and his brotherly affection. Martin, Giovanni, and Manuel for their attentions at the beginning and at the end of each day. Javier and Victor for all the cocktails and drinks that made all our afternoon talks pleasant. Jose for his magnificent hand at the Bar kitchen. Eduardo and Felipe for his kind reception. Deysi, Mariano, and the rest of the Staff that we didn't get the pleasure of greeting but from whom we received heartwarming attentions and of course, Luis for being at the head of this hotel and keeping alive this service concept that makes you fall in love with it since your arrival. Fam Ramos Landeros Monterrey, Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxed vacations with great staff at Petit Lafitte”
Reviews.Author: Hebert-HH
Reviews.Content: Just leaving Petite Lafitte, and willing to come back again and again... It's a great place for relaxing vacations... Imagine waking up and finding the beach just three steps from your door! The staff is so kind... they are like a family receiving friends to stay for some days :)

Reviews.Title: “Super Fabulous Over-the-Top Fun”
Reviews.Author: KayPeeW
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Partner and Friends for a week to celebrate birthdays. The customer service is out of this world. Accomodations were made for different dietary needs and room requests were met in short time. No detail was left ignored and we were always welcomed with a sincere smile. The food is super fresh and in a perfect indoor/outdoor atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Lafitte was magical! If ever there is a storybook beach get-away...this is it!”
Reviews.Author: sharon55_10
Reviews.Content: My stay at Petit Lafitte was fabulous! The spotless white beach, beautiful blue water, and peaceful calm setting was much more than I ever expected. Staying here felt like you were a personal family guest in a paradise scenario. Truly a well kept secret hide-away, the accomodations were first class and the food was outstanding...prepared to your individual taste, and not your ordinary large resort buffet. This is the perfect place for family reunions, casual corporate meetings, or to enjoy an environment of complete relaxation! I can't wait to book a vacation trip to Petit Lafitte for our entire family!

Reviews.Title: “Going Home”
Reviews.Author: palapaboy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a Disney cruise on the beach experience, then Petit Lafitte is not for you. If you are looking for a more genuine Mexican owned resort, then you should consider what is offered at Petit Lafitte. The low key/high alpha wave vibe of the old Capitan Lafitte survives here. For over 30 years, the owners, management and staff have successfully created a business model that emphasizes a relaxed, family oriented environment, personal service and great food. Each time my wife (sometimes family members) return it is like reuniting with old friends. Sometimes surprise reunions occur with returning guests such as us. There are no excessive surroundings of glass, chrome and marble here. The facilities express more stucco, limestone and wood with tile and palapa style roofs. Numerous hammocks are slung between coconut trees and a hammock palapa is situated closer to the water. The grounds of Petit Lafitte provide lush vegetation and is well maintained. My wife and I actually saw staff sifting the sand in the cabana area to eliminate any small stones or shells. Perfect for the barefoot experience! Thank you Lafitte. A small zoo is maintained to the rear of the property with an aviary, as well as having havelina, deer, and ostriches. The resort has one nice pool that is approximately 4 feet deep and is cleaned on a daily basis. Petit Lafitte is divided into 2 sections. There is the hotel section and the cabana section. In the hotel section rooms may be considered somewhat Spartan, but spacious and clean with a large shower. Included are a TV, telephone, iron/ironing board, hair dryer, safe and a mini fridge. The cabana area consists of beach front, ocean view and garden view cabanas. The cabanas vary in terms of having king, or two double beds. All cabanas also have a loft bed over the bathroom. The cabanas all contain the same as the hotel rooms except for telephone and TV. All rooms have A/C and ceiling fans. The restaurant is a treat. Two full meals (breakfast and dinner) are included in your daily rate. Breakfast is a menu choice of various offerings. Very good. Dinner is a choice of two specials for the evening, but a menu choice is an option if necessary. We never found the dinner menu necessary however. The meals are 3 to 4 courses and we found all to be delicious. Here is a tip. Whenever asked for salad or soup, always ask for soup, or both. Every type of soup made was fantastic. Waiters, Manuel and Martine are top notch and have a great sense of humor. Oh yes, a good wine selection exists here too. Also, our daughter-in-law is vegetarian, and all accommodations were made for her dietary requirements. A lunch grill is located at the pool/beach bar with a menu of affordable offerings. The pool/beach bar is manned by Jesus and Victor – known on You-Tube as 2 of the best bartenders in Mexico! That they are. Both grow their own mint for the Mojitos that they make. As opposed to many all-inclusive mega resorts, top brands of alcohol may be found here. I would describe the beach as being of two parts. The part in front of the hotel section is nice, but has exposed limestone bedrock off shore and can be rocky. It does serve as a good area for close-in snorkeling however. To the north end of the property is a gentle sloping beach with easy access to a swimming area. New access from hwy. 307 now exists via the main entrance of the Grand Maya Princess resort that is adjacent to the Lafitte beach. Despite the size of this resort, it still offers many of same amenities found in larger resorts such as spa services, laundry service, tours, internet access, private transfers, snorkel trips, dive trips and fishing. When entering the lobby Felipe is there to check you in and answer questions. David serves as Concierge and will assist in making any special arrangements for your room or for tours – almost anything really. Ivan, the manager always inquires about your level of comfort or satisfaction. My wife and I are proud to say that we know this remarkable staff and that we always meet guests there that are interesting people as well. Petit Lafitte continues to uphold the old motto of Capitan Lafitte, where they offer an environment that is “simply different.” We hope to return again and see our old friends.

Reviews.Title: “The setting and the staff at Petit Lafitte are second to none!”
Reviews.Author: Ron2424
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Petit Lafitte. If you are looking for privacy, security, excellent food and a wait staff that truly cares about making your stay enjoyable and comfortable, this is the place to go. It is not touristy in any way. I highly recommend the bungalow accommodations-they are quiet, clean and comfortable. I recommend this property for couples and business teams looking to get away from the rat race. We went into Cancun one day and couldn't wait to get back to Petit Lafitte where we felt safe and away from the fast pace you can find in Cancun. We are going back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel in a beautiful location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: amywhetzel
Reviews.Content: I have never actually written a review on here, but figured there was a first time for everything. This was my second stay at Petit Lafitte hotel which has about 30 rooms and 15 or so bungalows. This time I stayed in the hotel and last time I stayed in the bungalow. I found each experience unique and wonderful. I am not a fan of the oversized all-inclusive resorts that dot the Rivera Maya these days. I find them to be Stepford like and not at all an authentice experience. PL is quite the opposite. It is small, cultured, and the staff is very attentive and friendly. The hotel is right on the beach, so you can walk right out your door and onto the beach. The small bar is a enjoyable and the bartender Jesus is very kind. I would HIGHLY recommend this place! We also took advantage of the massage in the palapa on the beach! Nothing like a massage with a natural soundtrack! Breakfast and dinner are included in your rate as well and the food is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: JHWriter
Reviews.Content: I had lost my Mom a week before arriving at Petit, and so was more in need of than usual of quiet time to unwind and heal. The great thing about this intimate resort is that you can retreat and socialize in any way that suits you: there is no pressure to join in activities if you don't feel like it. In my case, what I needed most was time to heal, think, and relax. The people at Petit were solicitous and helpful (several of them have become good friends over our years of staying at this wonderful resort) and every day was full of low-key pleasures. I had a great time, as always, and as always, wished I could have stayed a week longer!

Reviews.Title: “A resort for peace & relaxation”
Reviews.Author: SKSINCLAIR
Reviews.Content: If you want to get away from it all and totally relax amongst palm tree's in front of the blue ocean, Petite Lafitte is for you. The spacious beach beats the massed ranks of sunbeds found in the large resorts. Food, from the breakfast with a large helping of superb fruit to the 4 course evening meal was all excellent. The staff learnt our names immediately and nothing was too much trouble. Manuel made his best effort to teach us Spanish, Jesus & Victor kept our glasses full at the bar & David made sure everything we needed was catered for. If you want to take a trip into Playa for a busier day a taxi wll get you there in 10 minutes for 150 peso's. The taxi driver will also arrange to pick you up at a designated location to bring you back. David arranged our car rental, through Hertz. We were picked up from the hotel to collect the car from the depot in Playa. We rented the car for 2 day's for about 2100 peso's. We drove down the coast to Akumal (about 50 minutes). The driving is easy apart from diversion's and hold up's in the centre of Playa as a new fly-over is built. Once this is in place driving up the coast will be no problem. Akumal is a lovely bay area and is a great place to swim with turtles, stingrays and a host of fish on the coral reef. Steve & Kim

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: pschiller
Reviews.Content: I have been to Mexico (the Caribbean--Cozumel and Playa del Carmen) many times over the past 20 years. I have stayed in fancy hotels, all inclusive resorts and even with friends. Petit Lafitte is my most favorite spot, ever! Personally, I prefer a quiet secluded location to a busy, in the middle of tourist, location. Petit Lafitte is hidden away from the main road and hustle and bustle---it nestled among the tropical foliage--right on the beach. Playa del Carmen is a 10 minute taxi ride to the south and Cancun is a 35 minute taxi ride to the north. Perfect!!!!!! The original Capitan Lafitte/Kailuum was charming and always a great spot to stay but the new Petit Lafitte is even better. Staff is friendly and never forget your name. They are ready to do anything to make your stay perfect. Most of the staff has been around for 15 to 20 years and it is wonderful to return year after year and be remembered. The rooms are clean and cleverly arranged. The ocean is gorgeous and you can swim right in front of the resort. The food is outstanding. Every meal is delicious. Breakfast is served with fresh squeezed orange juice. Dinner is served with elegance. You can book an excursion right there in the hotel. Parasailing can be booked at a location about 100 yards up the beach. There is a dive shop on the premises where you can book dives and snorkling trips. If you want a massage that can also be books right on the premises. Petit Lafitte is a perfect Mexico get away. You will leave feeling refreshed and recharged--and of course, sorry to be leaving. If you decide to head for Lafitte be sure to tell Ivan (general manager) that Pam sent you. He'll remember me just as he will remember you. Pam Schiller

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and Special”
Reviews.Author: allihaylett
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved staying at the Petit Lafitte! Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We absolutely loved the great food (4 courses for dinner) and the fabulous and personal service (especially Manuel our waiter). All the staff was extremely accommodating and friendly and helpful. Breakfast and dinners were always special events which were catered to our needs as a family. This is a truly special intimate place and is nothing like the huge mega-resort all inclusives with people everywhere. I would highly recommend the Petit Lafitte if you want a true home away from home experience! Other things to do: We rented a car from the airport when we flew in and used it during our stay and drove to Tulum and Chichen Itza, snorkeled in Akuumal (wade in) and Puerto Morelos (on reef via boat). Great little restaurant in Akuumal called La Buena Vida, great location, awesome views. Shopping on Quinta Avenida in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Unwind in peace”
Reviews.Author: NYCholidays
Reviews.Content: Although world travelers, this was our first trip to Mexico and we would certainly go back. Petit Lafitte is a charming place for all - couples, families and even groups of friends. Set on a very quiet and beautiful part of the beach, sandwiched between 2 massive resorts, this rustic and family run hotel stood out to us. The staff were very helpful and knew every guest by first name. They worked tirelessly throughout our stay to make us feel wanted and comfortable, but not hassled. The food was excellent and there was plenty of variety. The drinks were well priced too. We stayed in one of the Ocean View Bungalows and although not very well lit, they were clean and very comfortable, bigger than a standard hotel room. I do agree with other reviewers - the fact the hotel is a little remote, you would be wise to hire a car, should you wish to go to Playa del Carmen or to an already booked tour. That said, the taxi service from the hotel is about $30 return into town so not bad. I have one negative comment here and that is one that is not really the hotel's fault. We had a big problem with Mosquitoes due to the weather. They were all over the place, but take a spray and keep your room windows closed. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Centennial_COQuilter
