Reviews.Content: We loved Captain Lafitte before it was destroyed by Hurricane Wilma, and wanted to see if the rebuilt Petite Lafitte was just as wonderful. Petite Lafitte absolutely lived up to our expectations - staff is very friendly and helpful, but not hovering. Food was delicious and they accommodated a special dietary need with ease. The beach is glorious, with a lovely swimming area, pool is great and the whole atmosphere is relaxed, quiet and wonderful. It was just what we were looking for in our holiday escape. We read, walked the beach, played Scrabble and totally enjoyed the serenity of this small treasure! The beach massage was WONDERFUL too! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stress Free Sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: JackB403
Reviews.Content: In my humble opinion, Petit Lafitte is one of the finest vacation experience available today. Now that is quite a statement and requires some reasons to back it up. Some of which would be Petit Lafitte being a tremendous value, especially in comparison to the large all inclusives along the beach, to both the north and south. And that their chef is superb and could work anywhere. And the myriad of excursions and adventures available from the concierge, David (which is pronounced Da-vid, as in Officer David from NCIS). And the tremendous customer loyalty, many of whom have been returning for ten and twenty years. But there are other vacations that can claim the same. I believe that the two unique aspects that set Petit Lafitte apart are their ability to promote the fine art of doing absolutely nothing and their sense that you are family. It has been thirty years since I had 24 hours out of 24 to do just as I liked. Petit Lafitte gave that back to me. Within two days my watch had run down and I had stopped wearing sandals. I'd spend all afternoon swinging in the hammock, wondering whether the Chilean Chardonnay or that soft little Italian Pinot Grigio would go best with the shrimp in garlic sauce that we were having for dinner that night. Or if I should be dramatic and have that complex Argentinean Malbec with the beef medallions. Petit Lafitte is a stress free sanctuary and my blood pressure dropped 20 points in a week. The other unique aspect is the feeling of family. They will know your name long before you remember theirs. The service is exemplary but what sets La Petit Lafitte apart from all others is the sense that they are not providing a service to a hotel resident but hospitality to an honored guest and friend. I like La Petit Lafitte, I like it a lot and if I can answer any questions please let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday, great place, I have really enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: AlexinMexico
Reviews.Content: We want to thank everybody at the petit Lafitte for a great time and specially “Jesus” at the bar and “David” who was everywhere and always up to date on everything that was going on. We were expecting great weather and got allot of cloud and some rain, but we did get some sun and got to do some snorkeling with the people from the dive shop right on the property and I got to do some deep sea fishing which was great (I caught a huge dorado…LOL ). I would highly recommend that you rent a car if you want to do other things outside the hotel because it’s a bit out of playa and we like to go in the evenings to downtown playa to the shops and the people watching (I recommend the sports bar ”Tequila Barrel” on 5th for people watching and “La Patrona de Playa” on 10th avenue and 12 street for some real Mexican tacos that won’t make you ill). We stayed in the “Room” section of the hotel which is a part of the hotel that is “standard type” hotel and has TV, phone and a minibar in the room, and the bungalow section of the hotel does not have TV at least (reason we chose the room section). All in all, a great time, people making you feel right at home and the beach was really great and not crowded as was our experience last year in downtown playa. We will definitely go back to Lafitte.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: julie57919
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November with our 10 year old son. This place is so welcoming and fun. The food was excellent. We had the ocean front cabana and it was such a great experience for all of us. The staff at the hotel could not have been better. They went above and beyond for us. Prices for drinks and food at the bar were excellent. Yes, the road to get there is like riding on the moon but if you can get past that knwo that this gem is waiting for you. Oh, bring bug spray. The mosquitos were terrible on the beach and every where. If you like to go into Playa often rent a car. We did. We went in every day. Also, bring scuba gear from home if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, friendly service, beautiful location.”
Reviews.Author: mcdonoughescapee
Reviews.Content: My first trip to the area and really enjoyed our stay- very quiet resort, helpful and friendly staff, FANTASTIC mojitos, and wonderful swimming at the beautiful beach. Since it was my first trip, I don't know how it compares to similarly-priced resorts, but it was a very enjoyable experience. Only possible negatives were distance to town if you're interested in night-life or other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay for family”
Reviews.Author: DaWares
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Petit LaFitte the end of March/beginning of April 2010. It was such a great experience we will certainly return. This resort is small and very safe. We felt comfortable letting the kids run around the resort while we sat on the beach or at the bar. Our kids are 6, 9 and 11. We stayed in the bungalows. It literally took us 20 seconds to walk from our bungalow to the beach. There is a snorkeling outfit right at the resort and they pick you up on the beach and take you out snorkeling. It was only US$25 for an hour of snorkeling. We saw lots of great fish, a squid, a ray and a sea turtle. The beach is very clean and there is an area for swimming. There are some rocks out front, too, but it didn't prevent us from swimming. There was always a beach chair available. The pool was also very clean and well maintained. There is also a small game room with a pool table and ping-pong table. The kids loved that. You can get massages on the beach. There is Internet available on computers in the lobby. We rented two bungalows; one for the kids and one for the parents. We felt very safe doing so. The bungalows are right next to one another. They were very clean but not very luxurious. It's a bungalow, not a luxury hotel room. But it suited our needs very well and was very roomy. The "loft" was very small and only accessible by a ladder, but my oldest loved it. I cannot say enough about the fantastic food! We had the half meal plan, which was breakfast and dinner. It allowed us to be out and about during the day and not feel like we were paying for lunch twice. You get a lot of food, a good variety, and lots of authentic Mexican and Mayan fare. Fresh fruit, eggs, pancakes, french toast, cereal, etc. for breakfast. The dinners were gourmet and varied from fish to Italian dishes! These are sit-down dinners, not buffet (although we did have a Mexican buffet one night, but not your typical mega-resort buffet.) Drinks are extra, but very well made and very reasonably priced (they make a mean Margarita - no skimping on tequila!) We rented a car in Playa with the staff's help and also took the airport van recommended on the La Fitte website. We had no problems with either service. The car rental was inexpensive, even with the full insurance. It was about US$60/day. Much cheaper than the airport. Yes, the Hertz office has the stereotypical "manana" (tomorrow) attitude, but that is to be expected in Mexico. It didn't put a crimp in our plans. Just give yourself enough time to fill out paperwork. We did the car rental on the second day we were in Playa and had no plans that day, so it worked out just fine. Mainly, it is the staff that made this the most enjoyable vacation we've ever taken. They are so friendly and polite! We truly made friends with the staff. I can't say enough about how wonderful they all are. We will come back as often as possible! Thank you everyone (Victor, Jesus, Valderamo, Giovanni, David, Luis) at LaFitte for making our vacation so special! I'm sure I'm forgetting to thank someone, so I'm sorry if I didn't mention your name. You are all great!

Reviews.Title: “Same Time Next Year”
Reviews.Author: HelenPleasantHill
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Spent a week with family inluding two year old twin grandchildren. The staff was so accomodating and fun. It is beautful spot, good food, quiet yet a $13 cab ride into town if you want diving, shopping or ferry to Cozumel. There was a dive shop on the beach for snorkeling, diving etc. We opted to spend a little more to stay at a smaller, traditional Mexican resort, we were not disappointed with anything. Some of us stayed in the hotel but the cabana was perfect for a family with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all the way around”
Reviews.Author: voetbal
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Petit Lafitte for a week with our children (7 and 3). We chose PL based on the reviews that we read on Trip Advisor and we were more than pleased with the results. Our family enjoyed the vacation thoroughly from beginning to end. The reviews were spot on! From the location to the food to the staff: everything was perfect! This is definitely the kind of place to take your children to. It is small and quaint and you feel safe and secure about them roaming around the premises. We met so many families there and within a day our children knew each other and played nicely together. I don't think that this would have happened at a mega resort. There was plenty for the kids to do from the beach to the pool to the small zoo behind the bungalows. There was a new surprise everyday! Many families took day trips to the ruins or various adventure parks. Make sure to talk to the staff about helping you arrange this. They know the most about getting around and know the best time of day to go to the various sights! The staff made the trip: David, Cesar, Vistor, Geovanni: hats off to you! Evan and Luis also took the time to talk with us and make sure that everything was ok. This meant a lot to us. We would definitely go back to PL and hope that we can visit again next year. We have fond memories of all of the nice people, food and places we visited!

Reviews.Title: “A nice little break but somewhat overrated”
Reviews.Author: BulldogMatt
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Petit Lafitte for 4 nights. We loved the laid back atmosphere and picture perfect location on a lovely stretch of beach in Playa del Carmen. This is exactly what we were looking for to get away. The staff was very nice and gracious I highly recommend this spot for families with children or those that just want to get away from it all. This is the perfect place. In fact, travelers without children may want to choose another hotel. I believe it is really meant for families. The daily price includes breakfast and dinner. This is a nice gesture. The food was ok. I think the food could have been better. We both preferred breakfast with the nice selection of fruit. We did have a problem with the a rental car office that promised to pick us up and transport us to the rental office. We were originally quoted a $45 rate per day from a staff member at Petit Lafitte. The next day we were told that the office was too busy to pick us up and the rate was $60 plus insurance. Please be careful with this referral from Petit Lafitte. While this was not the staff at Petit Lafitte's fault, it left a very bad taste. We cancelled the reservation. We had a nice time but because of the amazing selection of properties in this area, we would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A personally attentive, down to earth and homey beach paradise!”
Reviews.Author: RobDactor
Reviews.Content: I first went to the Yucatan in 1997 and this was my fourth trip. The first two times I stayed at La Posada del Capitain Lafitte which was, unfortunately, destroyed by a major hurricane a several years ago. The same owners and staff relocated to their current location a few years ago renaming the resort "Petit Lafitte". To return 13 years later and to find many of the same staff working there was a delight. They are obviously happy to be where they are and make every guest feel persoannlly attended to so wlecome. It is an intimate setting, uncrowded and right on the water. The rooms are not fancy but very comfortable and clean. They provide free bottled water, coffee makers, cable TV, showers (no tubs) and daily maid service. Breakfast and dinner included in the cost and lunch can be purchased at the bar or pool. A wonderful, relaxing vacation for a very reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: bornekim
Reviews.Content: Petit Lafitte has become our annual Caribbean destination. It is the perfect alternative to the immense & impersonal resorts now rising daily along the Riviera Maya. If you seek an authentic Mayan mood and comfort without pretention, this is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet refuge -- a world apart from the scene of Cancun and Playa”
Reviews.Author: mm351
Reviews.Content: A small, friendly resort with a staff that greets you and treats you like a member of the family. This is a place for warm sand, a good book, and peace and quiet; the hotel is not secluded, but is well separated from the larger resorts on the Riviera Maya. Come for the beach, stay for the hospitality. We stayed for five days, and never left the grounds. There's something to be said for a day that goes from breakfast, then to the beach (with lunch and drinks served oceanside), and then dinner; repeat as needed. The main restaurant provided more than enough variety, and sometimes surprising and innovative choices. A dive shop offers to arrange snorkeling and dive trips. Some rooms have no phones, no tvs, no radio, no clock. It is a short walk to a couple of small restaurants off the grounds, but, really, a drive to Playa Del Carmen if you are interested in visiting or looking for more variety. If you're looking for nightlife, well, plan on taking a taxi to town (or choose somewhere else). For us, we would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have family in Mexico... you do now!”
Reviews.Author: sanichute
Reviews.Content: This spectacular hotel rests on one of the nicest beaches i have ever had the pleasure of spending time on.The hotel is beautiful,the rooms are gorgeous from the garden view rooms to the private bungalows that are a stones through away from the beach. The food is delicious and immaculatly prepared from breakfast to dinner. I could go on and on about the details of the hotel but what makes this place "shine" is the wonderful Staff. Evan the general Manager has created not only a purely unique hotel environement that is far and above the most special retreat i have ever come across in all of my travels. The most special aspect to Petit Lafitte is all the staff, Evan has created what i can only descibe as my family away from home. Every single member of the hotel staff are some of the nicest people i have ever had the privilage to call my friends. From David who makes it his mission to ensure that every guest is looked after if they have any special needs and doing so like it's not a job it's his nature. Jesus and victor are not only the best bartendors in All of Mexico they are also two of the nicest guys your ever gonna meet. There is always a laugh or two going on and one of my favorite parts of the trip was watching how all the staff get along with each other. I just happened to be lucky enough 9 years ago when my friend stumbled across this "Gem" and told me about it and shortly after we went down together so i could see for myself.It just doesn't get any better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Birthday Celebrations”
Reviews.Author: LynnNortheast
Reviews.Content: Celebrating two significant birthdays of friends, a 40th and 50th, was made all that much better by this resort. The staff were so attentive and did whatever they could to make our stay enjoyable. We loved the food. We loved the bungalows. We loved the beach. In fact they gave us beach sand in a bottle to take home with us. I can't wait to go back to Petit Lafitte.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Bliss”
Reviews.Author: VermontVTer
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this paradise is surpassed only by the amazing staff who work here. Whether you are sitting on the beach, snorkeling off the coral or planning adventures around the resort, the staff makes you feel welcome, pampered and fun. I came with 11 friends to celebrate a milestone birthday and absolutely loved it!! The food was great, the staff so fun and playful and the setting was spectacular! We'll certainly be back,!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL QUIET PLACE, EXCELLENT SERVICE AND INTERESTING GUESTS”
Reviews.Author: Adamoeeva
Reviews.Content: We have been at PL with our children of 9 months and 3 years. We stayed in a bungalow ocean view (#13): very nicely built, wood all over and with a cosy loft for our 3 years old. The premises are immaculate, the sand is white white, the sea incredibly blue and the palms naturally bent, as in a magazine picture of the Caribbeans. Excellent service is the trademark of PL: on day 1 the entire staff had memorized our names and from day 1 they tried to help us in any possible way. When the kids fell asleep before dinner time (7PM), food for us would be brought to our bungalow. A new animal made with towels would welcome us every day on our bed. When at the end of the holiday we accidentally left a picture of us behind, the staff wrote us an email requesting our address to mail the picture (!). The last thing we really liked about PL is the crowd that this place attracts. We met wonderful people there, all passionate about life, nature, and Mexico. All open, curious, intelligent, and extremely gentle with our kids. We loved the place and would recommend it wholehartedly. Rent a car if you want to travel around as we did (Tulum, Xcaret, Hidden Worlds, Muyil etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Your stuff may be stolen”
Reviews.Author: jdf31
Reviews.Content: I normally do not post negative reviews, so this critique is exceptional. I’ll begin by noting that there are many strong aspects to this hotel. It’s easy to get to. (Forty-five minute taxi ride from the Cancun airport). The hotel’s grounds are beautiful, and its proximity to the beach is awesome. Nice sand, swimmable water. The landscape was really stunning, and because the hotel was not crowded (this was early March), it was easy to find a chair and umbrella, which is key. The price of the hotel room includes breakfast and dinner. The food was consistently good, and the options were healthy. With this said, we had to constantly worry about having our stuff stolen. When we were initially shown our hotel room, the host said that the safe in our room was broken, but that he’d come back in the morning to fix it. He didn’t come back, but this was not a big deal. We just carried our money, passports, I-Pods, etc., out to the beach with us. Sort of a drag, but we thought that this was only temporary. After the hotel staff cleaned our room, we returned our stuff to our room, thinking that no one else would have reason to be in our room. We went back to the pool. Two hours later, my wife noticed that $80 was missing from our wallets. Fortunately, no credit cards or passports were stolen. However, since nothing else was displaced in the room, and the door was securely locked both when we left and returned, this was obviously an inside job. The staff set us up. What sucks is that we were being extremely careful, and we would have put everything in the safe if it had not been “broken.” When we addressed the issue with the front desk, we were told that the manager was not present. The assistant manager upgraded our room to a different location on the premises, but the upgrade only meant that we had a king bed (instead of two beds, which we had not requested) and that we were about one hundred yards closer to the beach. (And actually, this was a drawback, since the new room was right across from the outdoor bar, where guests partied into the night). Plus, we did not want the upgrade. We wanted our cash. There were other problems. One day we did not have hot water. There was no explanation for this, and there was no attempt to accommodate us. Also, the wireless internet was inexplicably down for the last two days of our stay. Again, this is not normally a big deal. We were on vacation. However, we were counting on just briefly using the web to access our travel arrangements, which were in flux. So, if you stay here, beware. Further, the hotel decided to spray for mosquitoes on our final night. We were warned, and we’d rather not have mosquitoes around than get bit up. (Which we actually did, anyway). But being confined to our hotel room was just another irritation when compiled with all of the aforementioned issues. Take all of this for what it’s worth. My wife and I are very laid back travelers, and we realize that not everything around the world is exactly as it would be in the United States. I also realize that if I had been more demanding or insistent, maybe the outcomes to these various situations would have been different. But who wants to go on vacation to argue and haggle? Also, who wants to have to constantly worry about having their laptop stolen? If the price of the hotel rooms had been less than $130 or $140, fine, I would recognize that there would be more issues to think about. But for the cost of this hotel, guests should not have to take their belongings with them everywhere that they go.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for the money”
Reviews.Author: tmboc
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Staff, especially David, are friendly and courteous! It's a basic clean hotel. Good food where breakfast and dinner are included. The beach is beautiful and you won't have to fight crowds. The beds are a bit hard but comfortable. If you want to stay away from crowds this is the place to stay. You are about 15-20 minutes from Playa Del Carmen. If you are looking for a great tour guide, Carlos Diaz is awesome and for $275 will take you, on a private tour to Chichen Itza, Ek Balam, and a Mayan Village in an air conditioned van. He's a wealth of information! We took suckers to the kids in the village and were then invited into one of the homes! Took many photos-awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice around Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: ILiveforTraveling
Reviews.Content: Like the previous review, I also spend hours of research to find the right hotel around Playa Del Carmen and I must say that Petit Lafitte met my expectations. Everything is perfect, nice setup, nice beach, good food and exceptional services. But keep in mind that this hotel is not for everybody, it is for people looking for small resort, tranquility and personal services. So if this is what you are looking for don’t hesitate and go. The beach is very nice but be aware that in front of the hotel water entry is rocky but there is a nice entry on the left part of the beach. This place is also great for families and kids and this was of no inconvenience at all for us. Thanks to all the staff, David, Manuel, Javier, Jesus and all the others, we had a great time even if we were not lucky with the weather. Benoit and Louise PS: David good luck with your French lessons...

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: julestarNYC
Reviews.Content: After hours of research my boyfriend and I finally booked 5 days at Petit Lafitte. The property exceeded our expectations. There was nothing fussy but it was clean and absolutely beautiful. This is the place to go if you just need to get away from the world, Go, relax and enjoy the beautiful water and the beach. I would recommend staying in one of the cabanas on the beach. It is great to have your own little beach home away from home. I can not say enough about how great the staff treats their guests. I really have never met a more friendly happy group of people. The food was great, even for a picky fish eating vegetarian... I would recommend that the chef is made aware of any eating restrictions before hand as well as on a daily basis. There was one dinner where I was not able to get a vegetarian option but there are 3 courses offered so I was able to have a salad and dessert. I loved this place and I felt that often we had the place to ourselves. There were several days where we were the only ones on the beach. I would recommend renting a car to get around. We took several day trips but were always so happy to get back to Patit Lafette. This is a true gem and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a low key place to hang out on a beautiful beach.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and value. Shame about the owners.”
Reviews.Author: LastMinuteManToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute, as is our habit. It turns out that we struck gold. This hotel offers exceptional service and value for the money. After ten years in this part of Mexico, we feel confident in saying that the service at Lafitte is extremely generous and consistent. From the waiters to David the concierge to Philippe and Luis, and of course Jesus, it's hard to find fault with the staff's patience or warmth. The food is well beyond what it should be for a hotel that is merely average and a very inexpensive price point. That's another plus. But--and it's an emphatic but--the week we were there, the entire hotel was turned upside down by the behaviour of the owners and their friends, who allowed their insanely out-of-control children ruin the stay of everyone who has the misfortune of staying there during those four or five days. It became a joke amongst us guests about how a hotel can have such fantastic service only to have it ruined by owners too selfish to consider that their paying customers aren't interested in staying in an out-of-control daycare. While the owners and their friends fetted each other, the kids screamed and ranted and kicked room doors, bounced balls against walls and generally did what kids do when their parents leave them with a young babysitter for rafts of time. Promptly at 6:15am, the kids would wake up and start running by the pool screaming and yelling. It was truly astounding--the epitome of selfishness and outright obliviousness. That aside, this hotel has a real charm that has people returning again and again, and it's understandable why. It's generally peaceful and small scale, away from the craziness of Playa but close enough to enjoy it. This hotel is nothing special, but it's proof of how good service, kind and good humoured, can overcome an average place. Like others who stayed there when we did, I salute the staff but have nothing but anger towards the selfishness of the owners who seem to care little about their customers when it really counts. Would I stay there again? Probably not, but don't let that stop you. It's a gem. One complaint, which the staff knows irritated me as I told them about it: cabs take far too long to get to go anywhere. 20-30 minutes when there are dozens of cabs in a line at the resort next store and could be at Lafitte in a minute. Faster cab service is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not what the reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: celtictravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average. I expected something on the higher end of the hotel scale after all of the great reviews on trip advisor. The location if you are looking to get away from the atmosphere of Cancun or Playa is excellent. The beach is nice but as others mention there is nothing to do or really anywhere else to go beyond the hotel. The rooms were clean, but just average and could use some updating. Unless you have great directions or someone driving who knows exactly where they are going it is a hard place to find. Overall the hotel was average as was the food that was included, the made to order bar food for lunch was very good, but this hotel leaves something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you TripAdvisor, this place is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: simbay36
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went to Petit Lafitte in early January. It was our frist trip in the Caribbean... actually our frist trip in a sunny-hot-beachful destination. Even if the weather wasn't very good (a staff member told me he hasn't seen anything like this in 15 year!), we managed to have a wonderful week, thanks to everyone at Petit Lafitte. Like all the reviews mentionned, the staff is truely the best thing about this resort. They manage to remember who you are, they get interested in you, they always make sure everything is alright without being annoying. The food is impressively good! You can choose among 10 or 12 breakfast choices always served with fruits, juice and bread. You can get a quick lunch at the bar if you're at the hotel during noon time. Finally, suppers are amazingly good. There's always 2 choices and we appreciated that since I don't eat fish and my girlfriend is crazy about it. So everyone was happy, everytime! Once again, the staff is always close if you need anything and they always take the time to help you order in Spanish, which was quite a challenge for me! The beach is amazing, seriously! There's never more than like 10 people at the same time on the beach (I guess in high season that is different but still..) and it's pretty quiet even with the big resorts around. We are a young couple (mid 20's) and we wanted to avoid big, loud resorts. We ended finding exactly what we wanted! I feel not a lot of young people are visiting Petit Lafitte so don't go there if you want to party! I could go on and on describing how great this place is but do yourself a favor and try it for yourself! You just can't be disappointed. Cheers to David, Felippe, Luis, Martin, Jesus, Victor, Gionvanni and everyone I forgot. Oh and sorry for the mispelling of your names. Also cheers to Kam and Jen from the previous review. Don't worry guys, Oilers will come up strong next year ;) Simon & Tania

Reviews.Title: “The legacy of Capitan Lafitte lives on....”
Reviews.Author: JandKEdmonton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming to the Lafitte hotel , old and new, on an annual basis since 1997. At that time, the original Capitan Lafitte was still an unknown gem of a hotel, tucked away on a 2 km dirt road and not part of any of the copious all inclusive-monstocities that were featured in the holiday brochures in Canada. We were hooked on our second visit when we arrived at the hotel and the reception, dining and bar staff remembered us by our names. We returned this January for our third visit to the now "Petit Lafitte" for another week of sun, smiles, sand and surf. We were greeted by the staff with warmth and hugs, many of them having been with the hotel for ten or more years. Despite the encroaching resorts that continue to spring up on an annual basis on either side of the hotel, Petit Lafitte manages to maintain an aura of peacefulness and tranquility within the surrounding developments. As always, reception staff are helpful in suggesting and arranging excursions if one so chooses, and there are no high pressure sales pitch to take part in activities or tours outside the hotel. Many guests arrive with a rental car and take in local sights during the day, so the resort is often quiet and low key during the daylight hours. We love the lack of animators and loud music on the beach. Playa's shopping / nightlife and various other tourist destinations are close at hand and can be capitalized on with little or no advance planning. For those who choose to remain on the beach, reading is a popular pasttime, and there is a well stocked library on the second floor above reception that previous guests have added to. A pool table and ping pong table are also present there for evening games. The food remains, as always, excellent and the presentation of the meals is exquisite, worthy of photos for the main entrees. Unlike some of the buffets at all-inclusives that we have stayed at in the past, you don't leave the table feeling overstuffed and bloated. Staff in the dining room are accomodating in making allowances for special diet requests. The replication of Capitan Lafitte's bar has been a success, with Victor and Jesus carrying on the traditions of various local drink specialties, most notably, the lime margarita. These are, without a doubt, the best on the planet and many, many of the friends we have had accompany us have agreed with this wholeheartedly. The beach remains pristine, clean, and allows easy access into the water (no rocks). Our oceanview cabana provided us with ample space and a great verandah to lounge on during the early a.m. or twilight hours while watching the waves roll in. A few of our past travelling companions have preferred staying in the main hotel rooms, as they are brighter, have tvs and air conditioning, and allow easier access to the dining hall and bar. We have already made our reservation for 2011 because visiting Petit Lafitte and its staff are a tradition that we will continue as long as we are able. Jan and Kam Edmonton, Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: eferrer
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from a 12-day trip to Petit Lafitte. This place was highly recommended to us by a friend who used to go to the old Capitan Lafitte. Such a recommendation created high expectations...but these were quickly exceeded by our own experience. What a place this is! First, the location. We stayed in one of the 14 bungalows. These are simple and cozy bungalows with comfortable beds and everything else you need - no TV or phone, which helps you leave any stress behind. Step out of your room and enter paradise. A beautifully maintained garden with bananas, coconut trees, and hammocks will lead you to the beach. A clean stretch of white sand with crystal water. Second, the service. Let me say that by the second day, the staff knew the names of everyone in my family. Not only were they helpful, attentive, and professional, but they were genuinely warm and did everything they could to make sure our stay was the best. It felt as if we were guests at their own house - a close friend's house. They playfully teased my kids about their Spanish, cut coconuts from the trees so they could drink the juice, and got out of their way to accommodate their food habits. I had never been to a hotel with staff as warm, pleasant, and attentive as David and his staff at Petit Lafitte. And, now, the food. I would say that Gaspar (the main chef) could be hired by any high-end restaurant in New York or San Francisco. From pozole to lime soup to grilled fish, every dish was delicious and beautifully prepared, with his own touch. In addition to its flavor, the food was plentiful and every meal combined fresh vegetables, fruits, meat, and fish. The ceviche at the bar was out of this world. In sum, this place is a jewel; one of the last vestiges of what the Riviera Maya used to be before the big all-inclusive hotels took over the coast. Enjoy it before it's too late. We will do our best to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxed long weekend. Other reviews are spot-on.”
Reviews.Author: taveanator
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip solely based on the TripAdvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. This was our first trip to the resort and all of the reviews were pretty spot-on. We were there with some of the old-guard who had been coming for years as well as some younger newcomers over the weekend. I won't bore everyone with a long review so I'll just stick to the highlights: -The last stretch of road was nuts but it got us there. We used the hotel recommend transfer service. -Very friendly staff, plus neither of us knew a lick of Spanish; not a problem. -We stayed in a beach-front cabana, which was sparse but the view and convenience more than made up for it. AC was great. They even fixed a broken shower-head without us having to ask. -Breakfast and dinner were good, but we were not blown away. Keep in mind we are from New Orleans and are used to really excellent food. The lunches were awesome (I recommend the shrimp/fish tacos plus the white sauce for the nachos was made out of crack. I mean it was seriously delicious). -Great bar. The bar is also the focal point of the resort, I kinda wish they had made it a bit bigger but Jesus and the other guys do a great job. All I drank were margaritas the whole week and never got sick of them. Really good and I'm not even a tequila drinker. The nightlife is basically the bar - most guests hit the hay before 10. -Good housekeeping as well. Nobody knocking on the door at 9 AM (we are late-risers) to clean the room, due to the size of the resort they just know when you are away and pop in to clean the room up. It's nice not to walk into a sandy room after a day at the beach. -Great beach. Yes it's rocky right out front but that just means a better view from the beach. This is not a real swimming beach, nor can you snorkel right off of it as I mistakenly assumed. It's more of a dip in to cool off kind of thing. You are a ways away from any of the mega resorts. I had to smile when I walked by some of those resorts and saw everyone packed into the beach like sardines. At Petit you have the beach pretty much to yourself. -There was always a masseuse available during the day. Mind you it was just a massage table under a hutch on the beach but it was still relaxing. -There were a few cons: - the zoo looked pretty pathetic but was under construction. I don't think they were really advertising it until it's finished though. -The water sports shack that was onsite only opened for one day for some reason. I got the feeling that it was just operated by someone else who would come when they wanted. I would have liked to rent some snorkel gear just to play with but could not. -Tips. I still couldn't figure it out but I didn't really ask either. I basically billed the lunches to the room and put a tip on the check. At the bar I never signed anything until I checked out and just put a big tip in the box on the bar before I left. I just had to assume that it was split evenly. -Kids may have a tough time here keeping entertained. While they are more than welcome, there just isn't a lot to do besides relax. -PDC was a longer trip than I had thought, though I had a cab driver that took a pretty nutty route into town. I went there for a scuba dive trip but in retrospect I would have just scheduled that through the resort as I think they pick you up right on the beach. FYI - yes you can walk back to Petit from PDC along the beach but it's about 6 miles and 1.5 hours. Yes, I did it. Well if you read this long here's your reward: http://goo.gl/9qv9 That link will point you to a download for a 360 degree panorama that I took from in front of our cabana. When I say were were on the beach, we were seriously on the beach. (it's a .exe file but it won't install anything - I promise. It's just a self-contained 360 degree file that doesn't need anything else to open. Be sure to maximize the window for the best effect as the images are high resolution). Here's a kmz location file also for those of you who have Google Earth installed: http://goo.gl/rAem That's basically where the resort is located, though there's a lot more construction since those satellite photos were taken. In a nutshell it was a great trip. It's really what you make of it. You can do as little or as much as you like, just call the hotel and plan ahead if you want to do anything else other than eating, drinking and reading (my wife finished 4 books - she was in heaven). Low-key resort with great staff and never more than 20-25 guests. Plenty of room on the beach for everyone. Other guests were very nice and we always managed to strike up a good conversation. Tequila tends to do that ;-). -T

Reviews.Title: “We have to let the secret out...this place is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SusanKj
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from a 10 night stay at Petit Lafitte. This place is a hidden gem! We stayed in Bungalow number 1. Step out your door and enter paradise! The ocean is right there framed by palm trees and hammocks. The hotel itself is quaint. It is just right to make you feel special without being pretentious. The entire staff is pleasant and accommodating. David the concierge is helpful in many ways, from making arrangements for an outing to making sure you are being taken care of, David is there with a smile. The restaurant is an open air thatched area with white tablecloths and candles on a table set out just for your family. Go in your dressy attire, flipflops or bare feet. The food is delicious and plentiful and served in style whether it is a four course meal or a hotdog specially ordered for our daughter. I can stll taste the cream of carrot soup, yum! The bar is casual and friendly. A perfect place to have a margarita and meet other guests if that is what you choose to do. Victor and Jesus will take care of you. There is swimming in the pool or the ocean, it's up to you. Town is just a taxi ride away if you want to do some shopping. Thankfully when you return it is to your own little corner of paradise away from the crowds of people.

Reviews.Title: “This place is truly paradise!”
Reviews.Author: TomBombadil
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just returned from 6 glorious days at Petit Lafitte and we'd go back in a heartbeat. We stayed in Bungalow #6, which was dark and cool, with two double beds. Impeccably clean. If you love to sleep late, I recommend Bungalows #1-5, they face away from the rising sun and are far from the kitchen. We also peeked into one of the hotel rooms, and i might like one of them next time. White walls, simple furniture, pretty headboards, TV and phone. David, the staff member who showed us the room, said the bungalows were more expensive BECAUSE they had No TV or phone! The staff was smart, pleasant and helpful, without exception. And the food was so good! I'm still craving those french buns at breakfast! Maybe we just got lucky, but our fellow guests were also pretty cool. The hotel was less than half full, but many guests seemed to be return customers, which is a very good sign! The bar before dinner was a friendly spot, with Jesus mixing drinks. Ask about his "special" apron, maybe he'll flash it for you! I highly recommend using the transportation service connected to the hotel for transfer to/from the airport. The road in from the highway, mentioned in other reviews, is being improved (so they told us), but it is still a challenge to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: happyman7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Petit Lafitte. We had such a wonderful time there, we are already planing our next trip. This was our first time to cancun and was supposed be a once in a life time trip. We have five kids and wanted to take them somewhere special before the oldest leaves home. We all fell in love with the place and the staff that we will some how manage to make it there once a year. I can't say enough about the staff. They made you feel as if you have always known them. They went out of there way to make you happy. and to help you in anyway that they could. The rooms are basic but clean. You only have a very short walk to the beach, about 200 feet. It truly is a little piece of heaven. The road in is an experience in it self, but well worth it. The food is excellent. My daughter and her boyfriend are both vegetarians and the staff went out of there way to prepare meals for them and give them several choices to chose from. Lunch at the bar is also very good and priced resonably as are the drinks. Most of the people staying here have been coming for years. They all were very friendly. It felt like one big happy family. I could go on and on but you do owe it to your self to try this place. Just keep in mind that this is not a party place . If that is what you are looking for then this is not the place for you. If your looking for a nice relaxing time you have just found it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Super people!”
Reviews.Author: tmrad70
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short trip to Petit Lafitte. Let me first say that if you are looking for the big resort atmosphere with lots of people, amenities and activities, this is not the place for you. But if you want a relaxing vacation with a beautiful beach and a highly attentive and personal staff. This is the place to be. My girlfriend and I were a bit apprehensive on the drive into this resort, the road to say the least is an adventure. But, if you can put that aside, Petit Lafitte is a great place to go! We were greeted by our first names from the moment we arrived. The staff takes great pride in their personal service, and rightly so. Everything was explained about how the resort operates and we were assured that if we needed anything all we had to do was ask. This could not be more true! We chose to stay in a oceanview bungalow. Our first night was in Bungalow #13. All of them are set up the same (some have doubles some have kings), its just the distance from the beach and view that varies. We asked if their were any bungalows a little closer to the beach available and were told that currently none were but as soon as one was, we could move no problem. The next morning #4 was made available and true to their word we were able to move with no hassles. As I said earlier this is not a mega resort, or even semi-mega, the rooms are a bit spartan, but clean and comfortable with great A/C. The beds were a bit stiff for our taste but they added extra padding the moment we mentioned this. We ended up really liking these bungalows and in the future will look for more of the same, IF we decide to go anywhere else. We wanted to take a look at the hotel rooms, but never did unfortunately because we were to busy enjoying paradise! On to the staff, our first night at the bar we were warmly greeted by the General Manager Ivan and his wife Lordes. I can't say enough how much we enjoyed their conversation and hospitality. Rounds were bought and we had a great night drinking tequila (maybe a little too much tequila, right Lordes?) and learning the fascinating history of the Lafitte Resort. Jesus the bartender along with David, Luis, Ricardo, Eduardo and all the great staff there made us feel like long time guests and friends. Please forgive us if we forgot any names or misspelled them. Every single one of you should be proud of your fine resort. The food was really good, we enjoyed the different selections and they would accommodate you if possible for any needs you may have. The service was on the spot and you were never left waiting with an empty glass or plate. Even lunch at the bar was enjoyable. Very fairly priced and again outstanding service. I fancy myself a bit of a tequila snob, and they had the good and premium brands available, again very fairly priced. The beach..... The main reason we love Mexico besides the great people. Unbelievably beautiful!!!! Directly in front of the resort is a reef, but 20 paces to the north is a wide open sandy part for great swimming and or snorkeling. I have researched long and hard trying to find the perfect combination of all the qualities I think make a great beach. Access, swimmability, colors, sand and cleanliness to name a few. So far, this stretch of beach is tops on my list. I have been to quite a few beaches from Cancun all the way down through the Riviera and PDC to Tulum, so I have a bunch of different beaches to compare with. The colors of the Caribbean Sea just blow me away every time I see them. You are able to swim quite far out without the fear of being run over by a boat or Waverunner. And the snorkeling was really nice with the reef having so much to offer with different fish and sea life. We just loved every second of it! They have a water activities desk behind the bar for any excursion you may want, as well as a desk up front for other tourist activities. All you have to do is ask and they will bend over backwards to try and accommodate your needs. Also, instead of setting up a shuttle through one of the other companies, contact the resort directly and make arrangements through them. We went through Olympus, and while they did get us there and back, we spent about 45 minutes at the airport waiting to go and had to stop at another resort on the way there. That is over an hour more we could have sat on the beach. Time is precious, especially when its just a short trip like we had. They also were late picking us up on Sunday, but we still made it to the airport with some time to spare. Next time we will set it up through the resort and avoid those inconveniences. I could go on and on raving about this place, but seeing is believing. My girlfriend and I are now believers and will definitely be returning many more times in the future. Tomorrow is not soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: rdhdwmn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in May of 2005 at La Posada del Capitan Lafitte, up the road. I had been going there with girlfriends before that for a couple of years. We were disappointed that they were closing it down, but were elated when we heard that this same group of wonderful owners and staff were opening up Petit Lafitte down the road! We were there this last May, 2009. True, it was difficult maneuvering the temporary detour to this new location, but we looked at it as a maze and that we would be rewarded with cheese and wine (or at least a pina colada) when we reached our destination. The new location is absolutely wonderful! Unfortunately, our stay there was during the swine flu epidemic that was keeping so many Americans from visiting Mexico, and when we checked in, we were the only people there for 3 nights. This was good news/bad news. The good news is that the staff, which has ALWAYS been accommodating, were giving us full attention - like having our own villa...the bad news is that we felt so bad for all of them. Rooms/bungalows that otherwise would have been full, were vacant and I'm sure affected the incomes of these wonderful people who worked there. Also, during our entire stay in the Mayan Riviera we never saw or heard of one swine flu case. The fourth night there, a young couple, who was there for a wedding next door the following Saturday, checked in. During cocktails at the beachside bar, we struck up a conversation with them while Jesus and Victor prepared our drinks (by the way, these are the best bartenders in Mexico). Martine, the chef, when preparing the table(s) for dinner, asked if we'd like to sit together, which we did. He arranged a beautiful table on the raised area beside the pool, which was still in view of the beautiful Caribbean. We stayed in bungalow # 1 and it couldn't get any better! Petite Lafitte is our favorite place, and we will be spending many more years there on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely oasis, perfect for families. Great food and fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: HoustonMexico1
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for families looking for a small, intimate getaway with convenient access to the beach. The food was incredible ! Our package provided for both breakfast and dinner, both of which were 5 star quality. The dinners were three course meals complete with salad, soup, and choice of entrees. No bland buffets! The service was outstanding and the pool was great for the kids. Everything was so accessible. There were only about 30 rooms and 15 bungalows. Not many families were there during August. There was a small flea market on the beach next door to the hotel that had some good buys ! The hotel also had a dive shop that would arrange for snorkeling trips. My only complaint was that the beds in the rooms were a bit hard. Access to the hotel is confusing so try not to go at night and make sure you get directions from the hotel. There is a temporary detour set up to access the hotel and although the route is well marked, you go down dirt roads and through parking lots of other condominiums. It seems like you are going on a treasure hunt. Supposedly a new road will be available at the end of the year. You will love this place, once you find it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MAandEM
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. My husband and I booked or trip for our honeymoon and we had no idea what to expect. We were amazed. If you want leisure and time to be alone this is your paradise. We staying one of the bungalows on the beach. The entire time we were there we maybe saw 4 other families during breakfast lunch and dinner. The beach was all to us, we could snorkel, drink, and just hang out with out anyone bugging us. I'll have to admit the road getting there is a little sketchy but its all worth it. The other cool thing is there are other very expensive hotels just down the beach and the views are nothing compared to what you get here. Stay in bungalows 1, 2, 3 or 11, 12, 13 and your wont be disappointed. Oh and the food is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: lyn-owl
Reviews.Content: This small delightful boutique hotel is a little slice of heaven. My Significant Other and I spent a glorious week at Petit Lafitte over New Year's 2009. I have been meaning to write this review for six months! We loved everything about it - its charm, its peaceful setting, friendly staff and wonderful meals. And the bartenders make great drinks! Europeans seem to love this hotel because it's not the big American timeshare property where you need to board a shuttle to get around. It's small and quaint, a little gem right on the beach. If you're looking for total relaxation on a gorgeous beach where you don't have to go anywhere if you don't want to, then this is the place for you. Breakfast and dinner are included so you literally can go from your room or bungalow to the lovely dining palapa, enjoy your meal and head to the pool or the beach. There are plenty of lounge chairs both at the pool and on the beach - or nestle into one of the hammocks on the beach and listen to the soft waves of the beautiful turquoise blue Caribbean Sea. We spent a very fun New Year's Eve at the hotel's little beach bar celebrating with new friends we met at the hotel. The city of Playa del Carmen is about a $15 cab ride from the hotel if you want shopping and some action and you can visit Tulum and the other historic spots easily, but once there, we didn't want to move! We did cab it to Playa del Carmen one day and that was enough. Back to our wonderful bungalow on the beach. I loved stepping into the sand from our bungalow and was glad there was no phone or TV, but if you have to have TV, I understand the hotel rooms are equipped. I would return to Petit Lafitte in a heartbeat. Truly a slice of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “The real Riviera Maya!”
Reviews.Author: gypsy001
Reviews.Content: Just back from yet another trip to my home away from home - Petit Lafitte - and I can't wait to return. While the Riviera Maya is in a constant state of expansion with the accompanying noise and crowds, Lafitte remains an oasis of peace and tranquility! The staff is extremely hospitable and happy to do what ever they can to make you visit wonderful. The food and beverages are top notch. If you want a quiet place to enjoy the sun, sand and water, this is without a doubt the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: SANTAFE1964
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 9 days there very few people and great beach time. Be SURE!!!!! to bring beach shoes, ie swim fin shoes for getting in and out of the water. Only one entry point and lots of loose rock and limestone there also. Bungalows are very nice and a c will keep you plenty cool. Getting to Playa and back is kind of a pain, but the up side to that is very quite beach. Jesus and Victor at the bar will take good care of you, for sure and Carlos at the dive shop will make your diviing/snorkling adventure great, I've know him for 20 some years and he has always been a great help. Also, print out map how to get there!!!!!!!! not easy the first time. When going to any, any resort right now DON'T pay full price!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 10 to 30 per cent discount is very doable. Taxi rides are set prices but very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: dmrass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Petit Lafitte during the first week of April, booking the ocean view bungalow #4. We had no trouble finding the resort as there are signs to direct you. The road was pretty good. It is nice that the resort is so far off the highway as there was no highway noise which is common at some resorts. The bungalow was beautiful, clean and very comfortable with excellent air conditioning and good water pressure in the shower. The food and drinks were very, very good. The service was friendly and attentive. The grounds and beach were beautiful. We hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: easytravelgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an ocean front hotel close to 5th Ave, the first nights of our Playa vacation. My boyfriend and I are both 30. We were seeking a relaxing getaway but still wanted to be close to the mix. Or so we thought. After only two days we grew tired of the beach club music, agreed we could care less about the bar scene on 5th and realized we really came to escape, unwind and recharge. Sooo… we packed up the rental car and headed a little north (outside of Playa) for Petite, with hopes of a truly relaxing experience. WOW! Petite was exactly what we were looking for!! No crowds, a beautiful quiet beach, and a caring and professional staff that learned our names within hours. Most of the staff has worked with each other and at the hotel for 20+ years. They surprised us with their pure hospitality, attention to detail, and genuine friendship. The property is not super fancy, trendy or chic but very comfortable and clean. There is a classic quality about it that feels like home or your favorite relative’s place. We felt 100% comfortable there. All the other guests we met were repeat clientele and had been coming for 15+ years. Don’t get the wrong idea… it’s not the bed & breakfast type place where you feel obligated to speak to others. But if you feel like it, you can meet some chilled out and interesting people. The whole experience was just really laid back and casual. Admittedly, the road was difficult to find from Hwy 307... (TIP: turn at the Azul Fives sign). But once on the road leading to the hotel there are signs showing the way. The road is a mess due to the construction of condos, etc. Just sit tight and keep going! We stayed in an ocean front bungalow which I highly recommend. That, or, an ocean view bungalow. The bungalows are really the way to go!! They are rustic (think small cabin) but clean and new – recently built in November 2008. You can’t beat stepping off your front porch and into warm sand! There is free WiFi, AC, mini fridge, iron & board, coffee maker, safe, a large supply of bottled water, desk and chair, king bed, and areas to store your clothing. There’s also a loft with a double bed. The bed was comfortable...after long days of doing nothing, we slept great. There is no alarm clock so we brought our own, which did the trick. No TV either (but again, free WiFi). The meals were very good. The presentation of each plate was simple and pretty. Produce and fish were local and fresh. Breakfast and Dinner were included. Lunch and drinks not included but reasonable and tasty. Overall, we had a 100%, 5 star experience, and can’t wait to go back and be “repeat” guests. If you’re looking for a party or nightlife scene, or consider yourself high maintenance, Petite Lafitte is not for you. But if you’re looking to remember… or need a reminder… how beautiful life really is… and are content with turquoise waters, white sand, a good book, naps under the palapas or catching a breeze in the hammock… then enjoy! You’ve found your second home. Hola to Felipe, Jesus, Victor, David, Martine, Manuel and the rest of the gang! Can’t wait to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond all expectations....”
Reviews.Author: Providencecouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Petit Lafitte for five nights in late April 2009. Our experience completely surpassed what we had expected based on the reviews on this site. First, I will address the only two potential “cons” people may see in staying here. One, there is no technology in the bungalows. If you absolutely need a TV, phone, etc., you will be unhappy. There is a computer in the lobby that has Internet access, though, so you won’t be entirely disconnected. Two, this place is remote and very quiet. Frankly, my husband and I found this to be a plus. The place was practically deserted other than the guests and staff, and it is far off the beaten path. We never had to fight for service or beach space, and there were very few people or things going on. Again, if you need entertainment to be provided for you by a mega-resort, Petit Lafitte is not for you. But we were happy to sit on the beach, read books, hang out together, swim, eat, and drink. The bungalows are beautiful and so well worth the cost. I found the beds to be very comfortable, the space large and clean, and the view spectacular. In under a minute’s walk, you’re on the beach. The beach was amazing. While there weren’t always enough palapas for us, there were plenty of palm trees or hammocks for shade. The water directly in front of the beach was a bit rocky, but a 30-second walk in either direction promised clear, rock-free swimming. The bar does not have waiters directly bringing drinks to the beach, but it is only a few hundred feet away from the farthest chairs. The food included was excellent. We were worried about not having enough to eat, but we ended up with WAY too much food. The breakfast buffet was perfect every morning, but you can always order off the menu if you want something more. Dinners were outstanding. There were two options every night, and we were never disappointed. I’m a vegetarian who only eats fish, and when I informed the head chef, Martin, he was happy to accommodate and made me delicious alternatives on nights that only offered meat. The bar also served lunch every day (extra, but very cheap). We did this a few times, and it was again very good. Perhaps the best part of staying at Petit Lafitte was the service. Yes, it is remote, and the road there is scary. We had the private airport transfer (worth every penny), but were then concerned about leaving and not finding our way back. There was no need to worry; when we wanted to go into Playa del Carmen for a few hours, Felipe at the front desk got us a cab for $10 that the resort knows well. The driver, Eddie, arranged a time and place to pick us up and he promptly returned us safely. The highlight of our trip off-site was a private trip to Chichen Itza and various other Mayan sites with Cesar, another taxi driver that Felipe set us up with. Cesar took us everywhere we wanted to go and brought us to see things we never would have imagined seeing or planning for ourselves. Everyone affiliated with the resort went the extra mile to make our visit perfect and hassle free. This resort experience was phenomenal. If you want a vacation where you’ll meet tons of people, party all night, have loud bands or performances, and go back to the TV every night, then you will not be happy at the Petit Lafitte. However, if you are like me and my husband, you will love the beautiful atmosphere, the amazing service, and the quality time just relaxing in paradise. P.S. Check out the crazy animal menagerie behind the bungalows…Wild birds, native pigs and deer, and an adorable capybara are there for you to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but rustic...Know what you're getting into!”
Reviews.Author: Blinkins2000
Reviews.Content: Petit Lafitte is FINE. I am floored that so many people find it to be the hotel of their dreams! My husband and I were really caught off guard by how simple, and rustic the resort was. If you're looking for a tiny resort where you can befriend the staff and want to do NOTHING but read books (bring LOTS) - this is the spot for you. If you want ANY amenities or ANY luxuries...find another hotel. We stayed in Bungalow #1 (Ocean Front) - presumably the nicest room at the hotel. PROS: You can see the ocean from the bed, which is phenomenal. It was convenient to grab drinks at the bar and take them back to the Bungalow. Front porch was a wonderful place to sit and read. CONS: The bungalow backs up to the pool (noisy) and the side of the bungalow lines the pool public bathrooms (can't keep the side window open). They are very dark inside. We had animal friends in our cabin just about every night (including a scorpion). The bed was hard. Porch furniture was old and plastic. No tv, no clock, no phone...right - no room service, no calls to the front desk, etc. - NO conveniences/luxuries! Beach. PROS: QUIET! Private. No peddlers. Plenty of lounge chairs and shade available. CONS: Cannot swim directly in front of hotel. Chairs are old and weathered. No beach waiters. Staff. PROS: They are friendly and get to know your name/room number. Caesar - the recommended cab driver (took us to town and on a full day trip all over) is fantastic! CONS: They certainly didn't go out of their way to make the experience special – they just did their jobs…which is fine, but not extraordinary. Food. PROS: the salsa/garlic sauce served at lunch is phenomenal! CONS: For dinner – there are TWO entry choices. One salad choice, one soup, two dessert choices. And, the food is adequate – truly nothing special. General Overview. PROS: The resort is generally quiet. The beach is soft. I loved sitting on my front porch, watching the waves, reading and drinking coffee or wine. We stayed in a Beach Front Bungalow for 6 nights and spent $2200 – definitely a good price. CONS: You can’t flush ANY toilet paper in the toilet (think about this…). There are lots of bugs/critters in the cabins. The staff was friendly, but not overly accommodating. The furniture throughout the place is plastic. The cabins get quite sandy…as do the beds. We would not go back. This place is not at all exceptional, except perhaps that it is small.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Mexico you have been searching for”
Reviews.Author: wjoRapidCity
Reviews.Content: I booked this place for my parents 25th wedding anniversary. We had 12 people from ages 10-59. There were some initial reservations on some of my family members parts because of the location and the lack of activities for the children. We have traveled all over the world and this will be noted as the best vacation we have had as a family. If you are questioning at all whether you should go there, just do it...you won't regret. Here are some tips based off of some of the other peoples complaints. 1. Print off the detailed map and directions to the hotel from the hotel's website. Then you won't get lost. Simple enough, I can't imagine showing up to the cancun airport and expecting the taxi driver to know where your hotel is in Playa....these people obviously have never traveled before. 2.Stay in the bungalows....#1,2,3,4, 9,10,11,12....these are the closest to the beach and still get the breezes.... 3. When you tip at the meals leave it on the table...not in the Box. When you eat breakfast make sure to ask for the menu (this is included) not just the continental breakfast. 4. The beach...just to the left of the front beach is a non rocky area to walk out....get a couple of cheapy childs innertubes and take to ride the waves...you can spend the whole day doing that. 5. The staff love to know your names and will remember you favorite drinks/meals/ etc...introduce yourself, because unlike other resorts you will have the same people everyday....most of these guys have worked for the same place for the last 22 years....jesus at the bar being one of them. 6. We never heard any music from the princess hotel down the beach. 7. Bring a couple of good books...this place is short on structered activities, but not on shaded hammocks...that you can spend a whole day in...listening to the surf and feeling the cooling breeze.

Reviews.Title: “The Antidote to Mega Resorts”
Reviews.Author: conchfc
Reviews.Content: My husband and 8-year old daughter and I stayed here from April 6-11th and it was exactly what we were looking for. You don't need to get up at dawn to claim a beach chair. There is no loud music or swim-up bars or a jacuzzi you can't use because it is full of kids. Just a simple pool, a quiet stretch of beach, swaying hammocks, a charming restaurant, excellent service and the best mojitos you will ever enjoy (at only $5 USD a pop!). We stayed in bungalow #2, with our daughter sleeping in the loft. Note: the ladder up to the loft is 7 feet of a straight vertical climb, so whoever sleeps up there needs to be able to negotiate that. We told our daughter not to climb down to use the bathroom in the dark without waking us first to assist, and she is pretty nimble. Also, there is very little headroom in the loft. The bathroom is a little cramped. We found the bed to be perfectly comfy. The place is so friendly and small-scale that we were comfortable with letting our daughter have the run of the place without direct supervision (unless swimming, of course), which made her feel very independent. There were mosquitos each evening for an hour or two, so bring bug spray. We tipped after each breakfast and dinner using the tip box. I recommend taking the hotel transport to and from the airport. Day trips: We rented a car for $60 USD from the hotel and drove to Tulum & Xel Ha, splitting the day. The road is pretty bad, but an adventure. You don't want to drive it at night. It will take about 90 mins to do Tulum. I wish we had spent more time at Xel-Ha, which had excellent snorkeling and food -- well worth the price. Note: gas is expensive. We used a quarter tank and it was $25 USD to re-fill. Another day, we took a taxi to Xcaret. The aquarium there with sea-turtles and rays was impressive. The night-time show was excellent. The food was regrettable, snorkeling nonexistent (unless you pay extra) and the "river" crowded and uninteresting (don't rent the snorkel equipment for this -- there is nothing to see). A mixed bag at best. Xel-Ha was way better.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: KalamazooMonica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Petit Lafitte April 4-7 and it turned out to be more than we could hope for. Although, the road to the hotel is rugged and under contruction and many taxi drivers had difficulty following the signs, but it's worth it once you get to the hotel. The service is very friendly and several employees spoke english rather well and I have taken spanish class for 4 years in school so I was able to communicate with the partially bilingual waiters. We stayed in a bungalow, which I highly recommend. There was a king bed for my parents and a loft bed above the bathroom for me. When we first got there, small droppings were on my bed, but they graciously changed the sheets for us when we asked. There is no tv or clock radio in the room, which turned out to be a nice escape from the over-technologized lives we tend to live. There is a mini fridge, stocked with drinks and candy, and a small safe to keep belongings. The beach is only a short walk in the sand from the bungalow. Most of the ground in the complex is sand, but we recommend wearing shoes at least half of the time, to avoid getting blisters. The breakfast offers a wide variety of options. We brought a container of oats because we like oatmeal for breakfast and the chefs cooked us some every morning. The fruit is great too! Lunch is available at the bar, however we only ate there once, and it was also great. Dinners are mainly buffet-style, sometimes the entree is brought to your table. Again, food is great! In the main building, there is one computer available to check your email and such and upstairs there's a room with a tv (all channels in spanish), pool table, ping-pong table, and a large selection of books you can read. My mom and I had a deep tissue massage and it was very good, and only $60 for 1 hour. The beach is not crowded at all and you can walk along it for miles. The people overall are very respectful and not the rowdy bunch you'd typically find at the larger, fancy resorts. I highly recommend visiting their zoo, there are many native birds, deer, wild pigs, capybaras, and ostriches. A lot of the hotel is still under construction, mostly because of the hurricane, but that does not get in the way of the finished portion. If we were to visit Mexico again, we will definitely stay at the Petit Lafitte!

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Serenity on a beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: LMSundaze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Petit Lafitte for 10 nights in January. We had a wonderful time -- it was beautiful, quiet and relaxing. The staff was very friendly. Unlike some of the other reviewers, I thought our king size bed in the bungalow was comfortable. The breakfasts were great, the lunches at the bar were excellent, and I also thought the dinners were fine -- not gourmet or anything but tasty. Petit Lafitte has been described very accurately in all the tripadvisor reviews, and I think someone reading them would get a very good idea if they would like this place. During the time we were there, there were few children except for a couple over the weekend. Many of the people there were repeat guests, and they knew each other, but still I think the atmosphere was friendly, not cliquey. We took a tour of Tulum and Coba one day with Cesar, and I highly recommend this. We also took two trips into Playa del Carmen by taxi. I recommend get some pesos to pay for the taxi with, this was much less expensive. As others have described, the road into Petit LaFitte is in bad shape but once you know where to go it isn't a big deal. However, if you are looking for a place to get in and out easily for side trips, this isn't it. All in all, a great vacation. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not Great”
Reviews.Author: rkwpnw
Reviews.Content: I picked this place for our family because of the great reviews... but was somewhat disappointed. As many reviewers have noted, the road leading to the place is just terrible, hopefully this will be fixed soon. The staff were very friendly and nice. Especially Emilse. The thing that disappointing me the most was that of about 100 guests our daughter (3 years) was the only child! Most were older folks and a few couples. The people in the pool were the staffers kids! So the atmosphere was kind of boring. The pool is small and was cold In February. The beach right here is very rocky for swimming. If you walk further south towards the all inclusive there are better beaches that are sand bagged. The food was good. The breakfast better than the dinner. The dinners were hit or miss. The lunch grill (not included) on the deck was great! So overall ok stay but would not stay here again. Also we came from Tulum, and PDC is disappointing after the quiet beauty of Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff!”
Reviews.Author: NikiPA
Reviews.Content: Over all it was a nice stay at Petit. Finding the hotel was difficult because of the lack of signs once you were on the dirt roads. But the staff was amazing!! The food and drinks were always delicious too! The rooms were cute and clean. We did not stay in the bungelow's. One day they were short staff and they didn't clean our room, but that was no big deal. Well, it was kinda gross b/c you had to put the toilet paper in the garbage can! We were disappointed by the beach and how small the pool was. If you don't mind being packed in with kids at the pool and fighting for a chair on the beach, then you will be fine! The hotel does not provide enough chairs and it can cause a headache every day fighting for a chair or having to get up at the crack of dawn to get one. We probably wouldn't go back because you can't go in the ocean, due to the reefs and it was too small of a resort for us. I like a larger area to get away from people and where there are enough chairs for all guests! Depending on what you are looking for, I would still recommend it to people. It's not a party spot, which we liked. It was quiet in the evening. We really enjoyed that. If you stay at this resort, take a taxi into Playa Del Carmen. We had a nice time doing that - Eddie our driver was the BEST! We had lunch at Senor Frogs, which was a blast!! Overall - a nice trip! Thanks Petit!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing location”
Reviews.Author: KSGreer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late December through the new year. There were ten of us, and we had two of the bungalows and two of the regular hotel rooms. My husband and I were in bungalow #2. The rooms themselves are clean but nothing special. The bungalows are great because they are so private and right on the beach. You do hear the noise from the bar at night sometimes, however. The beach is gorgeous. Plenty of hammocks and lounge chairs to go around. The staff were great and the food more than enough. We found that the lunches (which are not included) were the best, but dinner and breakfast were still more than acceptable. There is a nice game room with plenty of trashy books that other travelers have left behind--a must for the beach. ;) A tip--avoid the "spa" there. It was little more than a patio with a massage table. No real equipment and no privacy, with prices that rival a luxury spa's. This is not a "luxury" hotel, but it boasts a better location than many that are in that area. I would definitely stay here again if I wanted to get away and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Some very good things, and some not”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinDeb
Reviews.Content: Compared to an all-inclusive mega-resort, this place is still much better. Beach was great, but our oceanview room (#205) only had a partial view of the ocean from half of our balcony and no oceanview from the room. When we commented on this when we arrived, we were told that we could write for a discount (it sounded like others had pointed this out and the staff was not surprised). Room was large, and clean, but bed was hard (not in a good way) and we both woke up with backaches. Food was great and staff was very helpful at first, but we were told to put tips in the tip box at any time during or at the end of our stay and that they would be divided among the staff. When we received no attention at dinner on the third night (no water, no bread basket, no offer to order wine or drinks), we talked to other staff who said that the tip box was for staff other than the waiters and that we should have been putting tips on the table. Recommendation: Ask for a room closer to the beach on the third floor if you want the oceanview that you are paying for - try to get rooms starting with 40 or above and on the third floor. Or, in the cabanas, ask for # 1, 2, 3, 9, or 10. Also, be sure to tip the waiters at every meal no matter what the staff who appear to still be on an older, less intrusive, system say to you.
