Reviews.Title: “Sometimes less is more...”
Reviews.Author: we2SofA
Reviews.Content: Our search for a quiet and authentic beach destination included of course, reading reviews on this website of various places near Playa del Carmen. Upon reading the comments about this hotel, I was excited that maybe there was someplace left where we could hang out, read a few paperbacks on the beach and enjoy quiet evenings in the company of similar minded folks. I read every review on this hotel and they all paint a similar picture - one that is very accurate. So, in spite of the desire to wax poetically about watching the full moon rise over the palms adjacent to the beach bar, sipping the drink of choice and enjoying conversation with some wonderful people, I’ll say this: make sure that you are the right type of person for this hotel. If you need to be entertained, you’ll make a bad choice coming here. If you want a loud and raucous crowd, forget it. If you’re looking for a long buffet line with unlimited choices, this will disappoint. On the other hand, if you are happy waking in the morning to the sounds of the birds and waves spilling onto the nearby beach and having a quiet breakfast under the open-air dining area, you’ll be OK. If you can find peace in a lounge chair on a wide white sand beach with a good book or a walk along the beach, this place will provide the setting. If you’d like one of your most difficult decisions of the day to be whether you’ll order a beer and ceviche or a margarita and beef taco for lunch, this will be your daily challenge. Perhaps the biggest surprise might be how absolutely wonderful the staff is and how you fall in love with their charming personalities and their honest desire to please. Quiet, picturesque, simple, romantic, intimate, tranquil, serene, charming… are words that perhaps best describe Petit Lafitte. As the saying goes, “They don’t make ‘em like this anymore”. This place is truly a little gem, hidden in a treasure chest filled with too many super-sized resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for...”
Reviews.Author: treetravel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Petit Lafitte and we miss it already. The hotel is in a lovely quiet location north of Playa del Carmen. Our 15 year old son and his friend stayed in the hotel part and my husband and I stayed in a bungalow on the beach. After reading some of the recent reviews I booked two excursions for our first days because I was worried that the boys would be bored. By the third day, my family was begging me to just hang out in the hotel. The generous & kind staff catered to the boys, and got them fresh coconuts daily and made them special frozen drinks. The beach is spectacular and there are hammocks and palm trees to lay in while enjoying the ocean breeze. If you are reading this review then there will be no excuse to complain about the road in further reviews!! Yes, it is a hell of a road, bumpy, twisty and hard to follow. BUT if you simply hire the car company on the Petite Lafitte website you will be fine. No headaches for us. Once we knew the road, we used regular taxis and could tell the drivers where to go. We really enjoyed the meals. Breakfast was simple with fruit, rolls and coffee but you could also order eggs, pancakes off the menu for a reasonable price. The staff posted the dinner menu each morning which offered two entrees, soup, salad and dessert. Everything was really tasty. The margaritas were also great. We had lunch at the hotel two times and that was really yummy, especially the steak tacos. Petit Lafitte is not a fancy place (we didn't ever wear shoes) and there is little to do accept enjoy your family and the wonderful location. When I walked passed the all inclusive Princess Hotel up the beach with the hundreds of sunbathers drinking the free beer at 10 in the morning, I realized why I loved the quiet Petit Lafitte and I couldn't wait to get back to my little hammock under the palm tree. We are already planning out next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a good book”
Reviews.Author: sabrinab
Reviews.Content: Location: Like other reviewers, we had a ridiculously difficult time finding this place. Our poor flustered taxi driver from Cancun had to stop four times to ask for directions. The best advice I can offer is to turn by the Coca-Cola (from Cancun)/Crystal (from Playa) sign then TRY to follow the signs to the resort. We had read here that it was a bad, windy road, but I cannot begin to describe to you how crazy it really is. Rooms: We stayed in Cabin #1 which has, arguably, the best view of the beach. We felt lucky to get it, and enjoyed sitting out on our little porch and looking at the ocean, but we found these rooms to be too rustic for our tastes. No TV, no phone, no clock. During our 3-day stay the internet was down, so no computer either. The beds are rock hard and our sheets were well worn. There are a couple of uncomfortable chairs and a few lights, but they are very dim. It felt like camping. Expensive camping. Food: Breakfast was offered from 7-10: cereal, fruit, pastries; dinner from 7-9: soup, salad, two choices for the main. Everything was decent, but not spectacular. The mains could have been warmer. Service was good, but I didn't find it exceptional. The margaritas, however, are as great as everyone here says they are. Nightlife: Absolutely none. It is sooo quiet. Everyone seems like they are moving in slow motion, and, at least during our visit, they kept to themselves. This is what we thought we wanted; we knew we didn't want an AI party scene. We are in our 40s and were looking for a romantic getaway. When it came right down to it, though, we have to admit we were a bit bored in the evenings. We played ping-pong (their only activity--not even board games) and turned in early. I suppose we could have gone into Playa, but we were so worried about finding our way back in the dark, we didn't try. It is true that Petit Lafitte has a beautiful beach, nice employees, and clean cabins. Nothing was horrible; just be sure you know what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for us - but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: LerxstMN
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Petit Lafitte, but the hotel is definitely not for everyone. It fit very well with what we wanted. Hopefully you will find some of these points helpful as you plan what things are important to you. This hotel is not good if you: -Want a fully all inclusive - includes limted breakfast (good) and dinner (choice of two mains) -Want a larger party place - it only has 30 rooms - there was usually one or two other couples at the bar unless it was right before dinner - but pretty quiet in the evenings and the bar closes at 11 most nights -Need a really nice room. The room was functional and clean, but that is about it. We were only there to change and sleep anyway and for the price ok. If it was to rain all week it may not have been good. -Want any sort of arranged entertainment - none of that (which we liked). Also other than the bar/beach there isn't much to do other than a room with a pool and ping pong table, but we really didn't need anything but the bar/beach. -Want beach/poolside drink service - great bar staff, but you need to walk to the bar and get it (the upside is you are not disturbed - we were NEVER disturbed on the beach really even by people selling things). Also note that the bar is right on the beach so from the farthest point it will still be under a minute (well under) to walk there. -While the beach is great the swimming is questionable due to all of the rocks in the water. There is a spot you can to (to the far left of the beach). this seemed to be the case pretty much everywhere along the beach in either direction for a very long ways. the water was nice - it was very dirty and full of seaweed at other resorts we walked by. -The road in is somewhat rough and unsightly in spots - really not a big deal at all (though I wasn't driving) What you may like about the hotel: -Some of the points above that other people may not like -Overall the staff was very good -The bar service and drinks were good and also reasonably priced -The beach is very nice which was key for us. Great sand. -The breakfast/dinner inclusive plan was good as it allows some freedom to go to town, etc. if you want without worrying about missing out. We found it to be a very good arrangement. The wine list is very short and we like our wine, but found ones that were ok to good for a reasonable price ($20-25). I think you could bring your own if you were so inclined. -No timeshares, nobody on the beach selling you things, very nice. Also low pressure on tipping - we did tip well for the good service, but never felt pressured to do so. -The bar is right on the beach with a great view and the lunches there were very, very good and again fairly reasonable. Great chips/pico and garlic cream sauce - order the extra hot salsa - hot enough so I could only use a very little at a time. -The cold breakfast bar was free and quite good for our four days. The coffee was great - and I usually don't drink coffee. At dinner the mains were a bit hit and miss, but the soups and salads were very good. After the big lunch and soup/salad bar I was ok with the dinners anyway - no real complaints. We were in the rooms in the main complex, but the bungalows are apparently much nicer if you want to stay here with an upgraded room experience. Overall very much what we were looking for - a nice, quiet, small place. We would go back (tomorrow). Definitely not for everyone though and I hope the items above will help you decide if it is right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ReemZayde
Reviews.Content: We heard wonderful things about this place so perhaps our expectations were too high, but we found the stay adequate but lackluster. Also, our experience was colored by the fact that the signage to the hotel is non-existant, or actually misleading. The only sign on the main road does not direct you down the right turn. We spent over two hours, which we had hoped to spend on the beach, driving up and down the road, stopping at every hotel, asking for directions. Each hotel gave us different directions, none of which were correct. We finally were able to reach the hotel by phone and got the secret instructions (Follow signs for Azul Five, turning at the Coca Cola plant). This leads you down pot-hole ridden dirt roads, past industrial waste and construction sites, and ultimately to the hotel. No one was apologetic for the waste of time (either by phone or upon arrival). One staff person said that 60% of their guests are repeat guests so know how to get there. When I asked about the other 40% he just shrugged. Another staff person suggested the lack of signage is intentional to help keep the place secret. Well, it doesn't seem to me like a good way to run a business, when your guests arrive already unhappy with the hotel. Other guests we spoke to, including a couple who had frequented the old Capitan Lafite for over 20 years, had the exact same experience. When your time on vacation is limited, and every hour precious, to spend hours driving up on down the road simply because they don't put signs up, is ridiculous. OK, so once you finally find it, is it worth it? Hard to say. We stayed in some great places this trip, and this was certainly not the best. The beach was fine, but lots of big rocks in the surf so not great for swimming. Also, by the time we got down to the beach at 9am, all the loungers and hammocks had been claimed, which was annoying. The bungalows are great. The food is good. The staff in the restaurant were great. The staff at the front desk seemed somewhat clueless. Overall, I give it a C+, and don't think we would stay here again, even though we now know how to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRICHMAN
Reviews.Content: As per previous reviews road into hotel is dismal. Once there you are at one of the great cozy vacation hotels. Beach is beautiful, never a problem getting a lounge and never crowded. Walked north and south past all inclusives which reminded me of Coney Island on the 4th of July. Fortunately they are not to close. We stayed in bungalow three. Did not miss TV or Telephone. Wireless connection was good. Food was really very good. After one week there was only one soup my wife did not like. Fruit was great as were all the mains. Pool and bar were very nice. Staff at hotel at all times was very helpful. Surpisingly a fair number of families with children under 11. The children were well behaved and seemed to have a fun time. Would not suggest this location for teenagers or singles. My wife took yoga classes in Playa three times and enjoyed them. Cozumel was a nice day trip as were the ruins and dolphin excursion. All and all a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamoftrains
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 children (ages 2 1/2 years and 5 months) stayed here for 3 nights and had a lovely time. As someone else said, this is a wonderful alternative to the mega-resorts. The staff is efficient, professional and friendly and get to know you by name. The food is great. Though lunch is not included, the bar menu for lunch is reasonable and very tasty - as are the drinks! The rooms, while nothing special and a bit tired, are perfectly clean and comfortable and right on the the beach. This is a quiet place, so don't come if you want loud parties. The beach immediately in front of the hotel is a bit rocky, but we didn't find this to be a problem. If you are driving, it is a bit tricky to find, but once you know that, it's actually pretty easy. The hotel will email you a map. When you get to what looks like the end of the road, turn left into the roped off parking lot with the attendants. They'll point you in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Great get-away-from-it-all place”
Reviews.Author: clange
Reviews.Content: We chose Petit Lafitte due to good reviews on this site. We wanted to get away from it all for a few days. This was our first ever trip without kids. We are 40-ish. We bought package with Amex; Olympic Tours to shuttle us to the hotel. They had no idea where it was, and we drove around literally for hours. (Felix was really upset he couldn't find it.) To find it, take the road for "Azul Fives" (which I think is a development, not a road or town). There are a couple of Petit Lafitte signs, but in the dark anyway, they don't really look like they point to any roads! You will have to drive over a dirt road (which will be paved soon, I would guess, due to all the development going on there), through a factory or construction site (not sure which), down another dirt road, and there it is! They knew we were coming and kept the kitchen open for us. We had a bungalow (#13), the 5th from the beach. It was clean, has A/C, no TV or phone, has mini fridge and coffee maker (get coffee at restaurant instead). Bed doesn't have a very good matress. Pillows are fluffy, but not dense. There's a loft over the bathroom area, accessed by ladder. Would be good for older kids/teens. Pretty dark in bungalows at night, but reading lights over bed and loft. Bungalow has porch with chairs. Stairs lead right to sand. Hotel is situated between a bunch of crowded MEGA resorts (Yuck.) and some newly built high-end ones. Petit Laffite is on quiet stretch of beach. Chairs and hammocks always available. Open air restaurant. Breakfast is great. Little buffet (cereal, rolls, yogurt, juices) plus a la carte entre. Great choices. Delicious. Lunch is served at bar. American bar food, plus great "Petit Tacos", and some fancier stuff. Dinner has buffet with soup/salad/dessert. Two choices for main course. We found the food above average. Soups are very good. Entrees above average. Staff pretty nice. Good mojitos. Nice beer selection. House wine is awful; order by the bottle. Very quiet resort. After dinner (9:30), maybe a few people at bar, but not much going on otherwise. If you want a nightlife, this isn't the resort for you. About half people were retiree Americans. Some middle aged Americans. A couple of families with kids. Can be noisy in bungalow in early morning if you don't have your A/C on. Kids and birds can make quite a racket. But if you want to sit on a beach for 3 days and do nothing, and Mexican dirt roads don't freak you out, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Come for a day or two and try it out”
Reviews.Author: wizardofid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Capitan Lafittes for years until it sadly closed. We decided to try out Petite Lafittes. The road from the highway is laughably bad. Potholes everywhere, and you have to cut through a construction zone, but worth it in the end. The staff is fabulous. David the restaurant manager works very hard to make sure you enjoy your meals. The soups are fabulous, and the entrees great. The atmosphere in the restaurant has changed. At the old Lafittes they suggested that parents with young children dine early. We had unruly children at dinner (gotta blame the parents)--screaming and crying. The restaurant staff went to a lot of trouble to make Valentine's day special! The bar is great with Victor and Jesus serving up great drinks. Although the cabanas are nice, clean and roomy, we were disappointed in how they were packed together (we could hear people ordering in the dining room). There were children crying (not just playing), at all hours, and the pool area was turned into a daycare some days. We had no hot water for most of our stay until we finally got Ivan involved, and the resulting repairs were made immediately. If you liked the old Lafittes, this is not as homey. And don;t walk down to see what they built on the old site or you may cry.

Reviews.Title: “Early departure due to some problems”
Reviews.Author: careams1
Reviews.Content: We left Petit Lafitte early due to some annoying problems. (No hot water in our bungalow during our stay and small children playing (and crying) outside our bedroom window at various times of the day. (including 6:30am) Our request to move to another room was denied, as they were apparently full. Their beach location is absolutely Gorgeous, but the access coming and going to the hotel for day trips was almost impossible. The restaurant and outdoor bar were very good, the staff o.k., but the inadequacies mentioned before did not justify their price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but certainly not outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: honestopinion89
Reviews.Content: Positives: great beach, beautiful setting, friendly staff Negatives: very isolated with the terrible road conditions, summer camp setup (dinner starts at 7 pm and people line up; you get 2 dinner choices); limited front desk coverage especially with no phone in bungalow. It's a nice enough place but it's just not #2 of all hotels in Playa del Carmen. We stayed in town first at Playa Maya which was just as good.

Reviews.Title: “LaFitte did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: beachlover575
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I literallly just returned from Petit Lafitte 2 hours ago. And the post-vacation depression is sinking in. We went for our 2 year anniversary and were looking forward to a great long weekend getaway. I booked Petit based on the wonderful reviews from my fellow TA travellers, and once again, as always, they were right on the money. Petit Lafitte is truly a gem amidst the super mega-resorts which sadly enough, are starting to bleed their way into the tranquil landscape of Playa del Carmen. We did not want a touristey hotel, but yet still wanted to be close to town and near adventurous excursions. Petit Lafitte was perfect. As travellers warned, getting to Petit was a bit tricky and the access road is absolutely horrendous. You can't imagine a road with worse potholes, bumps and uneven ground. It's unbelievable that this road is permitted to stay so ragged! But at any rate, once you very carefully navigate your way through (hopefully without any flat tires), you emerge upon the very welcoming paradise of Petit Lafitte. As mentioned by other travellers, service was very good. Everyone on staff is very attentive to your needs. They do make a point of remembering every traveller and referring to you by name. Emilce at the front desk was especially accomodating and gave great recommendations for my boyfriend and I regarding local sights; she also helped us book our adventure tour, which we highly enjoyed. The bartenders are great and friendly. Although, be careful with their pranks. I jokingly gave Victor the 3rd degree after he dropped a fake spider on me (little did he know i'm very arachnophobic!). Breakfast and dinner are included in the cost of your stay and for the most part, the food was above average. It was nice to not have to leave the resort to hunt for different places to eat everyday. Make sure to wander through their little 'zoo'....a wonderfully sweet man named George takes care of the animals there. But the entrance to the zoo is not marked well and appears very unassuming, so it's easy to overlook. Ask for George and I'm sure he'll give you a tour, as he did for my boyfriend and I. We enjoyed meeting the many other travellers at LaFitte...the seasoned veterans AND the newcomers. It definitely added to the homey feel of the hotel. As warned, the room beds are VERY hard, oddly enough, and there is no hot tub on site. But those were the only negatives for this hotel. Our room #505 was simple but very clean and we had a great view of the ocean, pool and bar. We had a wonderful stay at LaFitte...the beauty of the location and the pleasant ambiance at the hotel made for a wonderful anniversary getaway. We would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking forward to a tranquil vacation for lots of R & R in a beautiful setting.

Reviews.Title: “A great niche hotel”
Reviews.Author: knm_minnesota
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan 29 – Feb 2, 2009. Loved it. Quiet, unpretentious, good food, very relaxed and no sense that we were being nickled and dimed to death. Having said that, this is clearly not the place for everyone. If your idea of a great vacation is a Carnival cruise, spending your nights out clubbing, or in a wild party resort then you'd best look elsewhere. If you're looking for a quiet, secluded place to get away for a bit, then this is the spot. We walked the beach from Petit Lafitte to the northern pier at Playa and then north up to H10. There is not another place that we'd rather have been than Petit Lafitte. Having said that and in response to other reviews: 1) we were not so enamored with the cakes, but loved the crusts on the pastries 2) we loved the tacos de huevos for breakfast (the French toast was also excellent) 3) the sopes were very good from the lunch menu 4) the soups were absolutely outstanding 5) the main courses were very good as well. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Doug8256
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Petit Lafitte Jan 6-9 and found this to be a perfect a place for a 3 night stay. Most of the recent reviews are spot on in describing this little hideaway. 1) There is plenty of new construction occuring on the way in to Petit. It is a slightly confusing drive in from the main highway but people along the way will point you in the right direction. Amazing to be driving over another resorts sidewalk, but hey it works. I am confident this is just temporary. My only complaint is that the entrance to Petit is not enviting. It may be due to the surrounding construction but it is rather plain. Maybe a little facelift? 2) Employees are very friendly and accomodating. There is no attitude here. A brief introduction and for the entire stay, these people always acknowledged us by name. To me this is appealing in contrast to the larger resorts. The employees here definately make customer service a priority. 3) Stayed in a bungalow with partial view of the ocean. Very clean, quiet and gave you a cozy relaxed feeling. There is no tv in the bungalow, which we did not mind at all. Mini fridge, hairdryer, coffee maker, and plenty of hot water. A/C also worked very well. 2 Dbl beds with an upper loft single bed. Spacious porch. 4) Beach is wide and spacious. Although people walk past the hotel most of the day, there was never a feeling of intrusion. As stated in other posts, the area directly in front of the hotel is somewhat rocky, but just to the north there is a nice sandy entry point. Beach was free of debris, and there was always enough lounges, palapa's for everyone. Did not observe any people out at dawn "saving" chairs for the day. Also, the bar is a very short walk to the beach. 5)Outdoor restaurant which serves full breakfast and dinner had a very nice ambience. Serving times varied enough that there was always plenty of seating, and never crowded. Staff worked both meals which meant a very long day for them. They still smiled. Food is fantastic. Two choices for dinner. Having stayed at large all inclusives in this area, id recommend this place to those who wish a quiet, peaceful few days with pleasant, hard working, friendly staff members who appear to put the customer first. For this trip, this is exactly what we wanted, and it is what we received. This is a small resort, and it does not offer all the gadgets of the large all inclusive resorts. You must pay for lunch if you require it, and for drinks. By the way, these are real drinks!! Frozen Marg's all around!! Cheers, Doug

Reviews.Title: “Such a cool place.......”
Reviews.Author: Redlilley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Petit Lafitte for part of our honeymoon in December 2008. We could not fault our stay in anyway, the staff were extremely helpful, very friendly, knowledgable and took to our quirky english ways without a second glance!! The sea and beach view from our room was outstanding, our room was always spotlessly clean and very well kept. How they controlled the sand we trailed up and down the stairs I will never know!! ;-) The hotel was very quiet at all times, the beach was beautiful with lots of sun-loungers and soft white sand. The pool was refreshing but never freezing and always very clean. The food in the restaurant was excellent and the staff were happy to recommend places to eat in the somewhat tacky Playa del Carmen when we fancied a change of scenery. The margarita's served at the bar were truly amazing and an absolute must for those old enough to indulge in good alcohol. I would thoroughly recommend Petit Lafitte to anyone who wants a wonderful break away from the mammouth all inclusive resorts and the tack of Playa del Carmen or Cancun. Petit Lafitte is a truly wonderful place

Reviews.Title: “Much better than a Super-Mega-Resort”
Reviews.Author: diving-mommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at Petit Lafitte from 12/31/08 to 1/4/09. We stayed in an oceanview hotel room. It was sparse, but clean and met our needs (bed, tv, a/c and shower). Don't expect high luxury here! The only things we really missed having were a clock and an in-room safe. The food was delicious! Both breakfast and dinner are included. There were lots of choices and we found it all to be above-average and plentiful. The staff was helpful when they were asked to be, but otherwise left us alone. The location is gorgeous, although it is hard to find and far from Playa (you have to take a cab). They have a beautiful private beach with plenty of chairs. The pool was clean but on the cool side. The seaside restaurant was open for lunch, snacks and drinks most of the time. There were many families with kids there, a few honeymooners and tons of repeat customers at the hotel. The repeat customers create a sort of clique-i-ness to the place that was somewhat intimidating. If you want a small, simple hotel that is secluded and away from the main drag and if you don't enjoy the super-mega-resort scene, this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest little place in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: wyoming_pamela
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous stay at the Petit Lafitte. A secluded and small hotel, it is light years away from the hustle and commercialism of Playa del Carmen. Our bungalow was cozy and very clean, the food (while not gourmet) was good, there were many wine selections, and the beach was lovely - but it was the friendliness of the staff that made our trip. They greeted us by name each time we met, joked with us (especially our waiter, Manuel), and did their best to make our stay enjoyable. Enrique, the manager (?) and concierge handled every problem (like the luggage lost by the airline) and request (he helped us to book a fishing and snorkling trip) with efficiency and patience. The rest of the staff followed suit. When we left, we felt like we were leaving friends. Only two things would have made our trip more enjoyable; a little more light in our room and a computer which was not monopolized by children, so our adult daughter could complete some necessary business more easily. Don't let the drive in freak you out. As you approach the hotel it seems unlikely that the route could lead to a hotel, but it does. If you are driving get very explicet directions. If you are not looking for life in the fast lane, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little place”
Reviews.Author: gcarfan1
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews of this place before booking. It was just what my family wanted. Quiet, not resorty, not tons of people. However, there were a lot of kids for those who want a more adult excursion. Here's what I liked: Quiet, great service on the beach beautiful area good food relaxing. They have a game room with ping pong, pool, videos and left books. Lots of chairs and shade for beachgoers. Very multicultural cliental. Lots of europeans, americans, etc. Air conditioning was great. Water Pressure, AMAZING. Had a safe, refrigerator, etc. What I didn't like: SO HARD TO FIND. Their road got built on by another resort so it's hard to find, at one point you have to drive on another resort's hotel sidewalk! Make sure you get REALLY precise directions. Service was a little slow. getting our plates taken and water refills took forever. It's a trip into Playa. A cab ride is about 12 bucks each way and no one knows where it is. (Make sure if you ask for location you tell them it is NOT Captain Lafitte, that no longer exists.) Not a place for those who want to be "in the mix" everyday. There is only one computer with internet and usually kids are on it playing games or something. They really need an "adult only" computer. (I realize people come here to relax and not worry about internet but it's nice for plane information and checking email and weather.) Last day we lost electricity and water for like 3 hours, no big deal but I had to take a last minute shower before heading out for airport. Very HEAVY/HOT comforters. Too hot to sleep with AC off and a sheet, too cold to sleep with AC on and just the sheet so had to turn AC on high and sleep under comforter. Overall, good place. Rooms were alright, views were beautiful, beach was beautiful, staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Back Home”
Reviews.Author: testlick
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the "new Lafitte". With the exception of a couple of years, we have been coming to the old Lafitte for over twenty five years. Obviously we have been happy. There is always some trepidation when going to a new place, particularly after having been so satisified with the old mainstay. Due to the staff, great and improved food and continued laid back ambience, our expectations were not only met but exceeded. The Lafitte staff is like family to us and in turn treats us like their family. We cannot say enough about the service rendered from all fronts. The Mayan people are truly the most humble and giving on this Earth and always have a smile, regardless of the cirmcumstances. We found the grounds and Cabanas very new and clean and the prices continue to offer one of the best values around. Lafitte is a place to lay back, lounge and relax and forget about the craziness of today's world. And there always is a conversation at the bar throughout the day. We are booked for a week in February 09'.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet bungalows and good food”
Reviews.Author: everclimber
Reviews.Content: Based on other Trip Advisor reviews I chose Petit Lafitte for a surprise birthday getaway for my husband. It was a good choice. For 3 days we never left the hotel area other than to walk down the beach. The food was delicious (hey, I live in New Orleans and am a foodie-so this says alot). The whole place was clean, slow paced, quiet, with nice guests, and nice, mostly english speaking help. The beach bungalows were rustic but comfortable. They are advertized as beach views but don't expect them to all be facing the beach. Our bungalow was towards the back and did have a view but we couldn't really hear the waves. They are still building their gardenview bungalows, of which a couple of them will still face the beach. When they finish it these new bungalows will face a beautiful garden area with parrots. The beds were a bit on the hard side and we had difficulty figuring out the A/C (no instructions and it was not intuitive). There was plenty of hot water, thick fluffy white towels, beach towels, shampoos, soaps, etc. but no lotion. Our room had no clock, no phone, and no TV so disconnecting from our hectic daily schedule was made easier. There was wi-fi in some places and a computer, with internet, for guests in the game room for those who needed it. But, after a couple of days of decomressing I was actually annoyed to see anyone carrying around a laptop and talking about the stock market news of the day! I highly recommend using Transportadora Velazquez (pdctransfers.com). They were cheap, on time, friendly and already knew the way to this hotel. There is absolutely no way I could have figured out how to get to this location without them (behind another couple of residential areas, over and down a sidewalk for The Tides hotel, down unmarked, single lane, dirt roads...you get the idea. The weather was a bit windy and cool at night so take some pants and a light jacket. All your meals are served outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, nice property”
Reviews.Author: Xscape
Reviews.Content: Very charming place to stay. The staff was wonderful and we really felt they tried to provide great service. The beach and property were beautiful. We stayed in one of the Hotel rooms. The room charm was ok, but bed and bath linens were very nice and the room felt clean. My only complaint about the room was that there was quite a bit of mold in the bathroom, but know this happens in a humid and beach environment. Plenty of bottled water in the room. The food was very good and plentiful! Nice ocean breezes and very few mozzies! It was farily quiet in Nov. BE SURE to ask the hotel for directions if you are driving. The signage is few and far between and does not actually tell you were the hotel is. It is in an area of a lot of construction and the entrance looks like the entrance to a different hotel...enter to "The Tides". Overall excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: jsdg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 days at Petit Lafitte, and to get right to the point - I can definitely recommend this place. There was only one single negative issue: getting to the hotel... We rented a car and had a hard time finding it in the beginning and actually making it there. I've seen a lot of bad roads in my days, but this one tops them all and is not for the faint of heart - especially after all the rain they had before we got there. Of course, it's not really the hotel's fault, but rather due to all the construction in the area, and it's supposedly being fixed soon. But once you make it, it soon proves to be well worth the drive. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The bartender makes terrific drinks and the people in the kitchen know what they're doing. The rooms are not luxurious, but are clean and have everything you need, including WiFi and free bottled water. We were lucky that the place was almost empty and we got the best oceanfront room. The food was great and plenty. Again, due to us sharing the hotel with only a few other people, we had our meals under a palapa right on the beach. It doesn't get much better than that. Of course, I'm not sure how things are during busier times. The beach is nice, although there are some rocks as other reviewers have mentioned. However, this is pretty much the same everywhere in the area at the moment. If you want superb beach with NO rocks - take a trip to Tulum. If you want party every night, this not for you (but then you'd be in Cancun anyways). But it's perfect for a few quiet and relaxing days on the beach. You can actually walk to Playa del Carmen on the beach if you want. It's about 1.5 hours each way. We did it a couple of times and it was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: helenapk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in early October and we loved it!! The reception staff is amazing, made us feel like home right away! Our room had a balcony with ocean/pool view. The AC and hot water were working perfectly. Once there though, I wish we had booked one of the beach cabanas. There were all occupied during our stay. Those look really cozy, are right on the beach, with a small patio, surrounded by palm trees. The front desk manager, Enrique, suggested that for those we need to book in advance as they don't have that many. The staff is very friendly (front desk, the cook, the bartender) and the food is amazing. We had both breakfast and dinner included in the rate. For lunch we just ate at the pool bar. The place has everything you need (except maybe shopping - the small shop by the entrance is just for souvenirs). We didn't wonder outside the hotel too much, as it's about 20 minutes from Playa del Carmen in a cab. The only downside - if there is one, is not really hotel related. The access road is a bit bumpy. Luckily, we decide not to rent a car so we experienced that just when arriving and leaving. We arranged our transfers from Cancun with pdc transfers. We prepaid a private transport on their website at a really good rate. Overall, we had a great time, with long walks on the quiet beach, great food and very friendly people. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Doulie
Reviews.Content: We were looking for solitude, relaxation, good food, and a barefoot atmosphere and the Lafitte delivered. As we made the bus trip from Cancun, I was surprised to see the mega all-inclusives sectioned out along the highway with their grand entrances. Many Euros are accustomed to these types of resorts and they appear to be gaining popularity with Americans as well, but we wanted more authenticity, meal flexibility, and less "packaging". From the bus station in Playa we grabbed a taxi, but due to construction around the Lafitte it was a bit difficult to get there. Once situated however, we were delighted. Stayed in beach cabana #2 steps from the ocean, read in hammocks, took beach walks...even a long one to town with several swims along the way, snapped photos, and swapped stories over beers with the handful of other guests. The meals were wonderful, with a chef who cares. The food was on par with any of the fine restaurants we went to in town for lunch or the occasional dinner away. The staff was attentive without being bothersome or hurried and most had worked there for years. You felt more like you were being welcomed into a family for a period of time. The desk was also very helpful with arranging a trip to Chitzen Itza or with the handful of taxis to town (15-20 minutes due to traffic). I will return to the Lafitte and just hope that the developers don't totally ruin the surrounding area. Side note, the beach is nice, but to really enter and swim you need to enter about 20 yards up or down the beach. right in front of the Lafitte is a small coral or limestone area covered in a dark weed growth. This subsequently breaks loose and washes ashore. Though this isn't ideal, don't let it sway you, the beach is beautiful. Note that we also stayed at the JW Marriott in Cancun and at the Shangri-La in Playa during this same trip. They all had their pluses and minuses, but the Lafitte atmosphere and service was my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “We will return again and again”
Reviews.Author: thymetobe
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel, location, staff, and total experience we had at Petit Lafitte. Our clean, well equipped bungalow was right on the beach a few miles/kms from Playa Del Carmen. The food was beyond our expectations - truly delicious. And, David, the restaurant manager, handled my gluten free needs every day, every meal with such care I never had to worry. Everyone has written about the staff and we couldn't agree more. They elevate the definition of hospitality, Also we learned that the hotel is wholly owned by Mexicans. We like supporting the local businesses especially when they do an exceptional job.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Lafitte- a wonderful, small mexican resort”
Reviews.Author: sunshineseeker2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this small, authentic Mexican, beach-front resort. The friendly staff calls you by name, quickly learns what you like to eat and drink, and is willing to meet your special wishes. The air-conditioned wood cabanas were a welcome retreat from the hot sun. We were thankful that the cabanas were technology free and designed for solitude. During the day we walked the beach, or layed in the hammocks. We also enjoyed floating in the warm,shalllow beach. Breakfast was a large plate of fresh fruit, yogurt, and whatever you wanted to order off the menu. Dinner was more than enough food with fresh salads, delicious soups, a meat or fish course and dessert. the bartenders made great margaritas and the beers were cold! Because the resort is small, we never had to wait in long buffet lines, and had great service. It was a 15 minute and 120 peso ride into PLay del Carmen. The staff was quick to order the cabs and they were always on time. If you want small, friendly, authentic, and peaceful, Petit Lafitte is a great choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Petit Lafitte
HotelInfo.Address: Carretera Cancun - Chetumal km 296 + 2.1 | Xcalacoco, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
